title: Long on style, a bit short on comfort
text:
For us, the Wallace had more pros than cons. Perhaps this list will be helpful for you:

The pros:

- we love this upper west side location
- the common areas and the room were clean and modern
- the staff was friendly and helpful
-the bathroom was very nice
- there are fabulous drinks and free fries for happy hour in the cozy lobby

The cons:
- while the room is stylish, it is missing some things that would make it more comfortable like a luggage rack and storage. The bathroom had one hook and no towel racks. Maybe a larger room would be a better experience?  
- I worked from our room for several days and there was very noisy construction outside all day long. Of you plan to be gone all day, this will not bother you, but if you are going to be in your room during the day, at least is spring of 2024, the rooms away from the street are very noisy.

Our room was spacious, comfortable and well designed. We didn’t want to leave. We will definitely return to The Wallace. 
Thank you to all the helpful staff.

title: Stylish hotel in nice neighbourhood
text:
We chose this hotel as we wanted to be in a quieter area and needed a bit more space. We chose a double queen suite for the three of us. 

The area was good with two subway stations nearby 72nd Street and 79th Street - these take you downtown very quickly and it’s easy to get connections to go further afield. There’s a cafe on the corner of the street where we got really good pastries and coffees for breakfast each morning. There are quite a few restaurants, cafes and shops nearby. 

When we arrived we received a warm welcome and were quickly checked in, our room was very nice and spotlessly clean. Great first impression! 

Beds were comfortable and bedding good quality, although I prefer a duvet cover rather than the bottom and top sheet configuration that tends to be used in the USA. There were two big drawers and a hanging rail as well as several other small drawers next to the bed and in the dressing table. 

The bathroom was spacious by NYC standards with a good shower (rain head and wall mounted shower head). 

The living area was very comfortable with a large sofa with chaise long section big enough to be a third bed!  Huge T.V.  under which is a big unit with lots of storage which also serves as a desk with a desk chair.  We ate our breakfast here most days and takeout one afternoon.  There are no plates or cutlery so make sure you bring/buy some if you’re planning to eat in the room. 

The wet bar area has a sink, fridge, kettle, coffee machine and complimentary hospitality drawer. 

The wardrobe is at the entrance to the room (in the living area) and is spacious and houses an iron, bathrobes, slippers, hairdryer (not very powerful compared to UK ones!) and umbrella. There were plenty of hangers and a floor to ceiling shelved section. 

There are panels with buttons controlling the lights and blinds with a ‘privacy’ and ‘service’ setting which was handy. 

If I was being really picky, there are a couple of things which would make it absolutely perfect, some hooks for coats in the living area somewhere and a heated towel rail in the bathroom.  Also, housekeeping was a little bit bit and miss, the hospitality drawer wasn’t always topped up and I noticed the counter top wasn’t wiped a couple of days, but overall the room was very clean and housekeeping more than happy to provide what you needed very quickly when called. 

We unfortunately had some
Very noisy people above our room, we probably could have moved rooms if we’d asked but I didn’t want to pack everything up again so we stayed put, it didn’t interfere too much. 

There are no other services available in the hotel, it’s really just a serviced room. The Wallace Lounge is run separately and is only open in the evening. We ate there one night and the food was very nice. It’s a shame this area couldn’t be used to provide drinks and snacks in the day too as it’s a very comfortable area to sit.  Even just providing tea/coffee and drinks would have been nice.

text: Hotel is new and fresh, immaculately clean and a great UWS option. There is a bit of noise and light gets in thru the hall door. Lack of an on site restaurant is in convenient but many good options in the neighborhood.

We love staying there especially with kids as the rooms are wonderful and spacious, the staff are so kind and helpful, and it's a perfect location for all the city has to offer. title: Great choice
text: Wonderful hotel with excellent staff and great service. The room was immaculate and when I needed help the response was rapid and very helpful. I would stay again without hesitation. Also two parking lots very close to the hotel were very handy.

title: Well run front desk and friendly helpful Staff.

Lights can be switched off from bed so good lighting to read in bed. Large TV with good picture and all controls worked well.Nespresso machine for coffee and in drawer a packet of pretzel sticks and a chocolate oat bar to greet guest. Firm mattress .Housekeeping very good .I would have liked a magnifying mirror in the bathroom. Front desk Staff friendly and efficient. They answer the phone promptly. There is a Pain Quotidian across the street.  I enjoyed my visit.

title: Family time
text: The Wallace is on the Upper West Side which is a great location, accesible to transportation and great shops and restaurants.  It is snuggled in a residential area close to coffee shops and both Central Park and Riverside Park.  The rooms are beautiful and comfortable.  It feels like home away from home

title: One of our best stays!
text: Hotel is beautiful! Rooms are roomy, clean, and well stocked. Staff is so friendly and helpful! We loved the lounge. The perfect resting place after a long day. Great location with shops and restaurants all around. Definitely recommend!

title: Perfection
text: This boutique hotel is amazing. It is close to so many things. There are tons of great places to eat nearby. It's on a quiet street. So when you come back after a long day of fun, not only do you get to enjoy all the comforts of your room, you have a quiet nights sleep. It is the only hotel that I can't wait to go to bed, because they are so comfortable. With it being a boutique hotel, the service is outstanding. Everyone is so friendly.

title: Nice Addition to UWS

At the top of my list is cleanliness for hotel stays.Nescafe machine in room was nice, not crazy busy, and close to everything in the neighborhood. Bonus points for Earth, Wind, and Fire in lobby!

My 16year old daughter felt very safe and welcome coming and going.  They treated us like family.  The rooms are impeccable and very clean.  I highly reccomend The Wallace, it's a true delight in the busy city!!

Only improvement would be keeping the lounge open for longer hours during the day so that one could get a light bite and coffee. Catering more to the guests staying in the hotel.

title: The civilized NYC

title: Great staff, gorgeous hotel!
text: The staff is amazingly friendly and helpful.  The hotel is very clean, well appointed and has a very cool vibe.  The room was super spacious and had everything I needed.  I will be staying again when traveling for business!

title: Wallace
text: One of my fav nyc hotels. Rooms are nicely appointed, staff is friendly and courteous, and two blocks from the beacon threaten!  Close to nice diners, good restaurants, wine stores, and citarella/fairway market.

title: A hidden gem on the UWS
text: Stayed at The Wallace to attend a show at The Beacon Theatre. This hotel is immaculate, beautifully appointed, and quiet. Everyone from the front desk and doormen to the lounge hostess and maintenance workers are very friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat, close to the theatre, myriad attractions and dining options, and a short walk to Central Park. We will be back!

title: Beautiful hotel
text: we chose the Wallace for its proximity to the Beacon theatre and the quality of the rooms.  The front desk. Staff were exceptionally friendly. The rooms exceeded our expectation. The beds were very comfortable. The hardwood floors were a nice touch and very clean. The rooms were spacious specially for New York  there were so many great restaurants  within walking distance on Amsterdam avenue.

title: New York cultural visit
text: Great location alway from chaos of Times Square but convenient to the major attractions. Took in the metropolitan opera and Hamilton on Broadway. Great restaurants close by and Central Park just a few blocks away.

title: Feel like a Star
text: Our New York trip at the Wallace was wonderful, very high end hotel. The suite was very welcoming with a message on the tv and snacks and water for us. We found the beds comfortable and loved the  over head shower and robes. It was raining and they had umbrellas for us to use. The staff was very friendly and you felt like a star.

title: Truly magical
text:
This is my go-to hotel when in NY.  Everybody is incredibly attentive, professional and friendly, and I would especially like to recognize Betty from the front desk for her heartfelt service and welcoming me “home”. 

Thank you for your dedication to excellence, I truly appreciate it!

title: Our new go-to hotel for NYC
text: Excellent newer hotel in the UWS. Wonderful staff and the rooms are so nice and modern. The piano lounge has gotten to be such an attraction that we love to end our day there nightly. Highly, highly recommend.

title: A little gem
text: The Wallace is a little gem on the UWS with a sweet lounge on the first floor. The rooms are lovely and spotlessly clean. The staff is very friendly and super helpful. I have stayed here many times - it is my home away from home.

title: Amazing stay
text: We booked this hotel because the price was within range and it looked nice. Wow. We were blown away by the service and the room was gorgeous. I loved the coffee and tea selection and the cool shades. Can’t wait to return.

title: Beautiful hotel, amazing location
text: This was our first time staying at The Wallace and we will absolutely be back. The hotel is beautiful and our room was a very good size. The staff were all incredibly friendly and there is a great lounge open on select nights with a nice drinks list and small bites available. The location also can't be beat - it's a 5-10 min walk to Central Park and a 2 minute walk to the subway, but the location was quiet and we didn't have any issues with noise at night.

title: The most amazing hotel
text:
We stayed at the Wallace for a week. What a beautiful hotel from the lobby to the bedrooms and all the facilities such as the gym and bar. The staff are amazing and helpful helpful, who go above and beyond for you.

Our trip to New York was perfect

title: Excellent stay and service
text:
The Wallace won me over because it was well located and all the reviews I read on travel portals and on Google were excellent and are certainly true.
All contact from booking to check-out was excellent, staff were very friendly and always willing to give you information and help. Good and cozy atmosphere.
The room was excellent, quiet, soft bed, pleasing to the eye decoration and very pretty.
It will definitely be our choice when returning to the city in the future.

title: wonderful experience
text: Wonderful experience! Great location -- close to Beacon Theater, bars and restaurants, 2 blocks to Central Park. Stayed 1 night. The hotel has a great aesthetic; details matter! Quiet rooms in a great decor. The cocktail lounge experience was a nice ending. Definitely recommend!

title: Simple Luxury
text: What the Wallace does, it does perfectly. The rooms are pretty, clean and well-appointed with lovely materials. The staff is accessible and very helpful. There is no restaurant, but ordering take-out from the numerous nearby was easy and quick. We highly recommend the Wallace.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: Clean, comfortable hotel in the upper west side - away from the craziness of midtown, which is what we were looking for!  Conveniently located a couple blocks from the metro. Would definitely consider staying again the next time we’re in NYC

title: A haven
text: The rooms here are simply beautiful, luxurious yet very comfortable. The best neighborhood. So many restaurants right around and easiest access to subway to go up or downtown. Staff was very helpful and welcoming.

title: Alcohol kills coffee
text:
Without a doubt a beautiful, modern, comfortable, well-located hotel, with friendly staff, comfortable rooms, but without breakfast.

It has a bar but they don't offer breakfast. Because? Is it not profitable enough? Is it cumbersome? Come on! Make that effort!

title: NYC trip
text: Beautiful hotel, rooms were very modern, clean and accommodating. Staff was super friendly. We were too busy to partake of the happy hour but looked fabulous. Bar area very classic and friendly.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Fantastic!
text: Highly recommend this wonderful property in the UWS. Great location, very spacious/comfortable rooms, the staff is so kind and friendly, and the lobby is warm and cozy with live music and a great atmosphere. Can't wait to return!

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Consistently excellent, professional staff. Rooms are beautiful, quiet, and well kept. The location provides a true representation of NYC, instead of the touristy mid-town. Location is within a short walk to subways providing accessible to all Manhattan.  Would recommend this hotel for anyone coming to NYC.

title: New Yorks Finest
text:
For the last two years since its opening we have stayed at The Wallace and its become our 'Home from Home' in New York. We are lucky enough to experience and stay in some of the worlds finest hotels and without question The Wallace is one of the best!
The entire experience at The Wallace is seamless and driven by a service culture married to a lovely product. Nothing is too much for the staff, the rooms and suites utterly spotless and spacious beyond any standard room in NYC. The consistency of The Wallace is just amazing and far more importantly every single member of staff.
Dont stay anywhere else.... Book The Wallace and enjoy a better life in the Upper West Side.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Lovey hotel, very clean and quiet. Very friendly staff. Beautiful updated rooms and bathrooms. We stayed in the Hudson penthouse and it was a wonderful stay! Only tiny downside is no room service although they have the lounge serving food Wed-Sat I believe. Heavily scented bath products I was not a huge fan of but everything else was perfect. The room was gorgeous and so clean and quiet! Nice gym. Would definitely recommend and stay again!

title: comfortable hotel in great location
text: love this hotel. no fitness amenities. no room service, but get outside and walk and eat!!!! the rooms are very clean and the staff is very friendly. very close to everything you want in nyc.. subway stop, zabars, levain cookies etc

title: Unexpected Gem
text: Booked online for a quick business trip with boss to nearby meeting and was so pleasantly surprised. Staff was very friendly, room was spacious and immaculate with lots of nice touches such as modern light/shade controls, luxe towels/robes. Cozy lounge with fireplace near lobby a nice touch, too. Really felt that details mattered. (Full disclosure: we checked in late and wound up getting upgraded to two-room suite, a real treat. Other traveling partner loved her regular room, too, though!)

title: Upper west side gem
text: Was looking for a comfortable, reasonably priced hotel near family in the Upper West Side. The Wallace exceeded our expectations. Staff was warm and welcoming, rooms were clean. Decor was sophisticated. Great location. Quiet. Was unable to try the lounge as it was not open the night we stayed. There are several food options nearby and the front desk provided a printed list of options.

title: Always incredible!!!
text: The Wallace is always incredible time after time. This is the only hotel me+my family will stay at in NYC. The staff is always so friendly. Can’t wait to come back. Thank you for the wonderful service!

title: Amazing!
text: I am so happy I chose this hotel. From my arrival to departure, everything was super amazing! I truly enjoyed my stay! Even though short, it was very nice. Staff were super friendly too.  I will definitely be back.

title: Luxury in the Upper West Side
text: Friendly and professional staff, starting right at the entrance. Smooth check-in. Room (a one-bedroom suite) was impeccable. Clean, functional, comfortable. The rain shower head was a nice touch. No issues with heat or hot water. Train station nearby, felt safe walking around. I would love to stay at the Wallace again the next time we visit the Upper West Side.

title: Gorgeous
text: Loved our stay at The Wallace, perfect for families.  We stayed in a one bedroom double queen suite.  So spacious, loved the seperate sitting area, great place to relax and unwind after a long day of sightseeing and exploring the neighbourhood.  Coffee and tea making facilities and fridge to store our drinks and milk.  So close to restaurants, cafes and the subway.  Wonderful friendly staff, especially the doormen.  Spotlessly clean. Wish we could have stayed longer, would love to return one day.  Definitely 5 star.

title: Great Place to Stay on The Upper West Side
text: This was our first stay at The Wallace and it was a great experience. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, our room was beautiful, spotless and had all we needed for our stay. We chose The Wallace for its location and its reputation. There are plenty of places to dine in the area, Central Park, The Museum of Natural History and Lincoln Center are fairly short walks and there are plenty of shops along Broadway, Amsterdam and Columbus Avenue.  We highly recommend The Wallace, it was a perfect stay for us.

title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
text: The rooms are beautifully designed, the location is excellent, and the staff are helpful and gracious. Each restaurant recommendation the staff made was also excellent. It’s my go to hotel when I was in New York.

title: A great hotel!
text: This hotel has a wonderful staff that is accommodating and everyone we encountered served with kindness and excellence! Room was nice and very clean, super comfortable bed and thoughtfully appointed! My wife and I highly recommend!

title: The only place to stay on the upper W. Side
text: we were in town for the opera because we’re decadent fancy people. We chose the Wallace because of location, but will go back because of literally everything. The staff are friendly, courteous, and always willing to help. The live music in the restaurant was terrific, and the gym is actually a nice size for a hotel in the middle of the city. Literally not a single complaint

title: Perfect little hideway on Upper West Side
text: The hotel is quaint and perfect for quick visit with family on the Upper West. Three blocks from the 1 train to Mid-Town and Lower Manhattan. BUT beware, there is no food or beverage available. There are plenty of terrific restaurants near by, with my favorite Safafina only a block away. Zabar's and other deli's near by as well.

title: Upper west side gem
text: Outstanding staff and vibe. Rooms modern and clean. Can’t beat the location and the ability to explore the upper west side. Rooms are very quiet so rest is no issue. The bar area is really fun with a great selection of liquor and bites.

title: Beautiful hotel in great lication
text: My husband is a snob and it was his first visit to the UWS. I loved it! We had a 2 and 4 yo boy. First of all this is a tough city at those ages but there was a park nearby the Dunkin’ Donuts, Central Park, subway C and B I think? We did the dinosaurs at the natural history museum and that was a WIN! Great nearby restaurants. Starbucks was a block away kitty corner but closed partway through our stay. Did laundry near 79th for a pee bed. Easy to do things. Bring or BabyQuip your own stroller as the hotel doesn’t have any loaners. Great rooms. Beds were a bit firm. Good space. We did a double queen one bedroom suite and it was perfect!! It was a bit chilly I’ll say but a minor HVAC concern that didn’t affect us too badly but as you know with kids, all of these things when kids travel makes for a challenge. I’d definitely stay here again!!

title: Best Hotel in Upper West Side
text: The Wallace is located near restaurants, stores and major attractions. The staff is always friendly and very helpful. Booking on-line is easy and I know what ever room I select, I will have a comfortable, relaxing stay. Thanks!

title: My new preferred address in NYC
text: Perfect! The location is ideal - a short walk to Central Park and a short walk to the Hudson River parks/paths. Lovely, subtle decor. Spacious room with incredibly thoughtful details and the best lighting I have seen in any room ever. Staff that are genuinely warm and welcoming and quick to assist with special requests. Big thank you to Betty and Angel and the wonderful doorman (my apologies for not having his name) who were exceptional in their roles and clearly worked well as a team. Not sure I will ever stay anywhere else in NYC again!

title: Gem on the Upper West Side
text: Stayed here for six days in January, combining business with a bit of a holiday. The location was excellent, with lots of very good restaurants in close proximity. And the room itself was ideal: well-thought out details, not filled with stuff we had no use for, and very comfortable. Highly recommended!

title: Great place to stay on UWS
text: We recently spent four nights at the Wallace and greatly enjoyed our stay. Our room, a Queen one bedroom suite, was perfect! The bed was comfortable and bathroom well lit . Staff was friendly and helpful. We normally stay in the Flatiron or Union Square area of NYC: staying on the UWS was a treat ! The location is close to the Park and there are plenty of great restaurants nearby. The Wallace was recommended to us by a friend and we were very pleased!!

title: You will not regret
text: Tasteful contemporary styling with excellent thought into the creature comforts that meets the needs and wants of every traveler.  The staff was quick to respond with any request and the stay was private and relaxing amidst the NYC energy.

title: Nice hotel
text: Excellent hotel, fully remodeled, big, nice clean room, friendly service, nice location. Very good design, comfortable bed, large bathroom. Hotel has deck place on the roof with gorgeous view. Close to Metropolitan Opera

title: Wallace is NYC luxury.
text: We stayed at The Wallace for a show at the Beacon Theatre. The Wallace was clean, modern, and had a wonderful bar that was cozy for pre dinner drinks and conversation. And the room was clean and very quiet.

title: Great location, very nice rooms.
text:
We stayed here while catching a show at the Beacon Theater which is around the corner. Location is great-lots of restaurants and markets nearby. Central Park is also a few blocks away. Hotel lounge is very nice to grab a cocktail and snack—a little pricey. The rooms are clean and beautifully decorated and very spacious, especially for NYC rooms. Nice sitting area and large TV and good in room amenities. 

At the price point, a nice addition would be coffee service in the lobby but there is in room coffee maker. 

The staff is very friendly and welcoming!

title: A great west side of Manhattan experience!
text: We highly recommend The Wallace when visiting Manhattan!  Close proximity to the Beacon Theater, Lincoln Center, Museum of Natural History and Central Park.  Spacious rooms, great guest amenities, wonderful service, safe and clean.  Just a truly lovely experience!

title: Outstanding boutique hotel experience!
text: An absolutely wonderful experience at this clean and modern boutique Upper West Side hotel. Outstanding service and professionalism from the staff. Excellent location near Central Park, dining, theaters, and a short walk to The Met and Lincoln Center. Most highly recommended!

title: Superb getaway.
text: In a noisy and busy city The Wallace is a secret quiet gem in the perfect upper west side location. The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. The room was spotless with a comfy bed. The lounge and piano bar had a surprise happy hour with delish fries.  Can't wait for a return visit.

title: Best hotel on the Upper West Side
text: We were thrilled with everything about this hotel. The location, the decor & the staff made for a perfect stay. We stayed in a 1BR suite as a family of 4. The decor was chic and of quality finishing. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be back!

title: Perfect spot on UWS
text: One of the best hotels I have stayed in in NYC. Rooms were spotless, staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. Piano bar is warm and welcoming. (Make a res.) Location just terrific. Wildly recommended.

title: Perfect Hotel with friendly staff and comfy rooms
text: Great location for museum visits in upper Manhattan! Hotel is close to subway and has nice, recently updated rooms; very friendly and helpful staff, We arrived with a red-eye from CA and I asked for early check-in. They called us at 11 and we took a nap at noon. Rooms are clean and welcoming. We will be back!

title: Just what you want for a stay in the Upper West Side.
text:
This is a boutique hotel finished the way you’d like your home to be. Perfect bed, bathroom, lighting, large TV, wonderful cleaning and service with a smile. The finishes on all furniture are above expectations. 

The jazz lounge off the lobby gives the hotel a vibe that elevates your spirit and the service is impeccable. The live music is wonderful!

This is the best deal in town for cost/accommodation ratio. Highly recommended!

title: Best Small Hotel in NYC
text: The loveliest, friendliest and quietest hotel we have ever stayed at in NYC.  The room was wonderful, comfortable and the high tech amenities are great.  The staff is amazing, friendly and so helpful!  The location is great and it is quiet and welcoming. We will be back.

title: Top quality!
text: Everything from the lobby, the lounge to the rooms was excellent. The details and the quality of this hotel is outstanding. It’s not easy to find a place like this in nyc, especially when traveling with three young kids. Will definitely be returning!

title: Great hotel, fantastic stay
text: We stayed at the Wallace in June 2023 in the first half of our NYC trip. We chose the hotel after a lot of deliberations and were extremely pleased with our choice. The queen suite that we opted for were perfect for our family of 2 adults and a teenager. The room was very spacious with a separate seating area and had amazing facilities to make good coffee, store food and other amenities. The washroom was very spacious and despite the fact that we were on a bust street of UWS we slept very well. We would definitely stay here on our next visit. The only con was that the hotel didnt have a restaurant onsite (which we knew while we were booking). But we reached very late in the night after an 18hr flight. Some options for food would have been good. But for breakfast there are a lot of vibrant cafes around. The hotel is also very well located to see the various museums, parks and sights of NY. All in all a fab stay.

title: A perfect stay
text: We loved this hotel! The team is very professional and kind, the room is perfect, with all the amenities we needed, very calm and quiet, the bed is very comfortable and the upper west side is a very nice part of the city, just a few blocks from Central Park. We’ll be back, we found home away from home,

title: Amazing hotel
text: I chose the hotel to celebrate a special occasion and the hotel staff went above and beyond in making it more memorable.  The rooms were clean and spacious and had everything I needed.  I will definitely be back.  Thank you!

title: Great Stay
text: Great hotel, fantastic location. Would stay again. Hotel gave us a room with 2 beds at no extra cost. Staff was extremely friendly at all times. Lounge was a great place to hang out, drink your coffee or have a cocktail in the evening.

title: Great place
text: Perfect neighborhood. Clean rooms with good amenities. Friendly front desk staff. Quick and easy checkin or check out. They have a lounge with a fireplace where you can enjoy the evenings with friends or just by yourself.

title: The Wallace - a home away from home
text: This was our first stay at The Wallace Hotel and we chose it  because of it’s location a block off Broadway Blvd and near a large food market.  But we discovered that  The Wallace is a wonderful place to stay at if you want to unwind and truly relax when away from home. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We were even surprised with an upgrade when when we checked in. Amazing! Our room was  nicely renovated, the bed was really comfortable and the shower was large and spacious. Several evenings a week there was a piano bar in the lobby with music, wine, beer and eats. A great way to end the day. We enjoyed our stay so much my husband and I have decided to make our place to stay whenever we’re in New York

title: Don’t think twice, book it!
text: This beautiful unexpected gem of a property will NOT disappoint. I went off the usual hotel chain grid and found something spectacular. The Wallace has perfected the upscale boutique experience. The rooms were so clean I immediately removed my shoes and put on the slippers they provided to keep it pristine. We were upgraded to a suite with a separate living room and kitchenette. When I say every detail was thought of, I do not exaggerate. Beautiful rainfall showers and robes, comfortable beds and easy to use remotes for the tvs, shades, lights, you won’t want to leave the room. However as most will, there are so many amazing things to do within walking distance, and for food, so many options close by you won’t have a problem finding a place to dine, or likely you’ll choose carry out to enjoy in your perfectly appointed room. We don’t even remember falling asleep, it’s that cozy, and woke up refreshed. Very close to Juilliard and Steps on Broadway is 1 block down, which is why we were there. Felt so safe and truly felt like luxury on the Upper West Side. I forgot to mention how genuinely friendly the staff was, I cannot even remember the last time I was anywhere with a staff like this, you all made it the most perfect stay, and we cannot wait to return.

title: Our NYC home away from home!
text: This was our 2nd stay at The Wallace Hotel since moving out of NYC.  We originally chose The Wallace because of its perfect Upper West Side neighborhood location, steps away from all our favorite grocery stores (Citarella, Fairway, Zabars, Trader Joe’s) and convenient to subway (lines 1,2,3) at the 72nd St station and bus (M5, M7, M11).  But more than that, The Wallace is an ultra chic, clean boutique hotel with rooms that are atypically spacious (for NYC) and the staff are super kind and helpful.  We love The Wallace Hotel!

title: Fantastice Upper West Side Hotel
text: The Wallace is a gem! The staff were friendly and helpful. The lobby bar is welcoming with great service. And, our room was spacious and lovely. I couldn't ask for more! We really enjoyed this location as well. The grandkids loved being able to walk to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. There are amazing restaurants within a block or two of the hotel as well.

title: THE place to stay while in the city
text:
I don’t have enough words to praise the whole team: welcoming, enthusiastic, helpful, discreet… here at Wallace you feel the vibes of a family business. All the opposite of those hotels chains (read - tourist traps- Thompson Central Park for instance…)
Everything was super clean and the place is very quiet, all the more enjoyable after a whole day in the city.
If you can afford it go for a suite on the upper floors (1002 for instance) but in any case, look no further

title: Amazing hotel!
text:
Where do I start, this was our first time in NYC, and I am so happy we found this hotel. 
From check in to check out, the staff were amazing. 
I sadly can’t remember the lovely lady on check in when we arrived!! (Sat Dec 9th), but both her and the young man couldn’t have been more helpful!! 
We also had an evening in the jazz bar on the Sunday! And, again, the staff on shift that evening went above and beyond to make our evening!! 
The hotel is so quiet, and well placed for all areas of NY! 
The room was AMAZING! 
This was a trip to celebrate the end of my treatment for cancer, and I can honestly say the staff made it for me!! 
I wouldn’t hesitate to stay again! And would highly recommend it to others!!

title: Recommend!
text: I would recommend this hotel.  Clean, nice recently renovated rooms, great location on the Upper West Side, and staff is helpful and friendly.  We only stayed one night, but would definitely recommend for a longer stay.

title: Peaceful retreat
text: Very enjoyable stay. My 16 year old daughter and I felt very safe and comfortable. Great location; close to many restaurants and cafes. The room was clean, well appointed and spacious. Would highly recommend.

title: Great Hotel
text: we got to the hotel at 8 AM and requested if we can get the room and we did get the room by 10 which was very good and the staff specially the front desk they were very nice and friendly I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Stayed here the week before Christmas with family, including a tween. We had a nice suite with 2 rooms. Our room was clean and spacious, with an in-room Nespresso machine. The location is excellent -- great neighborhood feel and close to tons of restaurants, Central Park, museums, and easy access to the subway. Staff were super friendly and helpful, too.

title: A UWS slice of heaven
text:
We were lucky enough to find & stay @ this hotel a year ago.
Our 2nd stay was even better. 
So convenient for everywhere in the city but also a bolthole if peace & quiet are needed.
Our room is spectacular with the deepest widest bath of any hotel I have ever stayed.
The lounge is now open serving cocktails & little plates & the ambience is fantastic & although jazz is not a genre we enjoy the other guests loved it.
Thank you to Betty @ the front desk & her boss for acknowledging my early birthday & anniversary by sending a bottle of wine to the room.
All the staff are warm & friendly & if I am lucky enough to be able to visit NYC again this will always be my hotel of choice.
Outstanding ⚘️⚘️⚘️

title: Chic and great value
text: This hotel is lovely, a stylish lobby and gorgeous bar.  High value that does lack a few perks... no room service, no valet.  The bed was good not great.  But those are all understandable as so many hotels in the city have become ridiculous/unaffordable. Kind and helpful staff.  So clean, very nice chic bathroom.

title: Great choice for UWS
text: This has become my new go-to option in NYC as the location is excellent and the rooms are extremely well-designed and spotlessly clean. The bed is very comfortable with nice linens, and the bathroom is beautiful and has a great shower with good water pressure. Plenty of outlets available, although no usb ports by the bed. The buttons to operate the shades and lights are amazing to have. This time the lounge was open, and we were able to have drinks there with friends one night which was very nice. The cocktails were delicious, and the happy hour was a nice surprise. The sitting area with the fireplace looked very cozy. The lobby also smells amazing (I purchased the candles they use as gifts last year).

title: Lovely stay in Manhattan
text: The Wallace is elegant and comfortable.  A fine choice if you want to stay in the Upper West Side neighborhood.  At Christmas time we found it calming, after the crowded streets of midtown.  There are numerous breakfast spots close by, and subway stations are easy to reach. Plus we slept soundly with no street noise!  We will definitely stay there again.

title: Most wonderful time!
text: I can’t say enough about this amazing hotel! The staff was welcoming & so awesome. The room was clean & spacious & so comfy. We walked to breakfast & dinner both days, such a perfect location. We had a great time & we will never stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: A Hidden Gem!
text: We came to NYC for the night for a show at The Beacon Theater.  We booked The Wallace based upon the location alone & found a hidden gem: elegant, cozy spot with friendly, helpful staff.  We'll absolutely be back!

title: Designer quality hotel, with fantastic staff!
text: Fantastic hotel, definitely the best in the UWS, from all angles of great designer finishes in the space, really exceptional and helpful staff, beyond accommodating management who helped me extend my stay- including a booked out Saturday night in prime Dec holiday time. The rooms are quality and set out well. Would definitely recommend the Wallace Hotel!

title: Girls Trip
text: We came to see New York at Christmas.  This trip was part of a bucket list for my mother-in-law.  The hotel was everything we anticipated and your staff was absolutely impeccable.  They provided us with great service and were more than helpful to us with no clue about NYC.  They gave us excellent directions to all our planned events.  Thanks for providing WONDERFUL customer service to two ladies from rural GA.

title: Your quiet sanctuary in the city
text: Clean, comfortable, quiet, contemporary hotel with courteous staff. It's not the spot to bring a large group or have a spa weekend or get a free breakfast. But if you want a very clean and quiet place to rest that is conveniently located on the upper west side, this is worth it!

title: Great Manhattan stay
text: Had a great time experiencing the area.  Loved that it was so close to the park and delicious gluten free places to eat.  The staff was helpful in guiding me where to go.  I was traveling alone and felt very safe and taken care of.

title: Will be back
text: The suite was gorgeous, spacious, and essential for travelling with kids. An easy place to stay! Staff were all very friendly and available. All requests (such as for an infant crib) were fulfilled easily. Will be back soon.

title: Service was exceptional
text:
This is our 3rd trip to NYC, first time at Christmas time, and this was by far the best hotel we’ve stayed in. We took a red eye and fully expected to have to wait hours for a room as we arrived so early on a very busy weekend. We called ahead to let them know we would be there quite early and they said they would certainly hold our bags. I used  the lounge restroom (very nice) to freshen up and when I came out, Angel and the woman working with him had secured us a room and we were able to rest up before heading out! What service! The room was so clean and they even left us a complimentary anniversary gift. 
The upper westside was quiet and quaint but so easy to get to midtown and lower Manhattan via subway or taxi. Super close proximity to Central Park and walking distance to many great dining restaurants. Will stay again.

title: Stay at The Wallace Hotel
text: We stayed at the Wallace Hotel the weekend before Thanksgiving this year. We are very pleased with our stay. The location of the Hotel was convenient to the subway, Central Park, and the American Museum of Natural History. In fact, we walked to Central Park and AMNH. It is also pretty quiet. I couldn't even tell we were staying in a big city. The reception staff was very friendly. It was so nice to sit by the fire place in the lounge to have a drink after a long day of walking around the city. Saturday night, they had a great singer accompanied by a piano player and upright bass. The room was very spacious and the perfect size for my family of 4. The shades and lights were controlled with the touch of a button. The bathroom had great water pressure and hot water. It was my husband's birthday, and they left a special treat and nice note in our room when we checked in. That was a very nice touch that made our trip feel special. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Lovely hideaway in UWS
text: Luxury, boutique hotel in the Upper West Side. Situated in a quiet, residential area of the city, staying at the Wallace feels like being a local. The rooms are renovated and modern, with all the little details for your comfort provided (an umbrella, complimentary water in the mini fridge daily, bathrobes and slippers, etc.) Comfortable beds. Dreamy piano bar on the main floor. Will stay again.

title: A hidden gem
text: Loved the hotel. Excellent customer service, rooms are impeccable and has everything I needed. It has a Nespresso, complimentary coffee and tea and some snacks. The bathroom is spacious and the lights in the big mirror are a plus. Very clean and confy bed . The location is very convenient and there are many options of places to eat.

title: The Wallace is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in
text: The location is great, a lot of attractions are within walking distance. The decor is lovely, the street is quiet and the staff were lovely. As it was our first time in NY, I think we were so lucky that we picked the Wallace as our base.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in Upper West side
text: Friendly staff and beautiful spaces. Immaculately clean rooms. Housekeeping was discreet and did a great job refreshing the room while we were out exploring for the day. Location was perfect, easy walk to many restaurants, Central Park, Lincoln Center. Subway stop is close by too.

title: My new go to in NYC
text: Absolutely loved our stay there. It was for business but it was all pleasure. Such nice people (Cal and the other woman whose name is escaping me right now!), wonderful linens and beds, stylish surroundings and the room didn’t feel small which is a big plus in NYC. Great location!! Just yes.

title: Excellent hotel!
text: We loved the location of The Wallace, the friendly staff and the entire experience.  The upgrade to a one bedroom suite was outstanding.  I like that it is one block off Broadway away from the traffic noise.  The hotel is close to the 72nd station and 79th station.  It is walking distance to many restaurants and shopping on the Upper West Side.  We are planning another trip for 2024 and will be staying at The Wallace.

title: An Upper Westside Gem
text: The Wallace Hotel is absolutely one of the best hotel experiences we’ve had in NYC. Friendly staff and cleanliness are outstanding and the location is 10/10! I would recommend this to all of my family and friends who need to find a lovely hotel on the Upper Westside!

title: Great hotel
text: This was an outstanding place to stay if you are looking for a quality booking. Excellent location, safe, clean, well appointed. We had not been to this hotel nor heard about it until booking it a few months ago. We now have our "go to" place on the upper West side.

title: Small Boutique Hotel With A Big Heart
text: The Wallace is located on the Upper West Side close to all amenities and steps from the subway line Rooms are well appointed and spotless. Modern design and comfortable beds.The true gem of this hotel is the staff. Helpful, friendly and professional. Amazing people. Shout out to Angel for making our stay a special one. Thank you! Don’t miss the great lounge on the main floor with live piano music. Small intimate lounge great cocktails and small bites.

title: Decent hotel
text: Very friendly staff that allowed me to check in early after a long and exhausting red eye flight. Spacious rooms and great location. My room was poorly situated and I was woken up daily to obnoxiously loud construction (avoid room 701).

title: Great hotel on the Upper West Side
text: Great location - pricey but worth it to be within walking distance of so many attractions.  Friendly staff, comfortable room. Fairway Market just one block down, many restaurants nearby.  Walking distance to Lincoln Center and Central Park.

title: Good location, hotel lacks amenities
text: Staff is cordial but not attentive.  There is no coffee service in the lobby and the bar is closed a couple of nights a week.  Rooms are clean and housekeeping does a good job.  There are better alternative hotels in the area that offer full service amenities.

title: Great place
text: Convenient, quiet, friendly staff, nice stairwell for those who don't like elevators. Looking forward to coming back with the family. Great king suite. Glad I found it. Just off Broadway, and a few blocks to Central Park.

title: New favorite NYC hotel
text:
I’m so glad I found The Wallace for my family’s trip to celebrate our twins’ birthdays. The location was perfect for us. We love the UWS and the hotel is near countless restaurants and shops. But it’s also a nice residential area. So it was very quiet at night. 

The hotel is elegant and sophisticated. A refreshing change from all of the overbearing hotels trying to be hip and Instagrammable. It felt like classic Manhattan. The lobby lounge was perfect. There was even live jazz. 

Our suite was amazing: huge, lovely, in perfect condition with more thoughtful touches than I could even count. The beds were comfortable and restful. The living room was spacious. There were two desks, two massive TVs, plenty of storage. 

I could go on and on. Suffice to say it’s now the only hotel I’ll consider visiting in NYC.

title: A True Delight on the Upper West Side
text: We had a delightful stay at The Wallace and would highly recommend it! It is close to the Beacon Theatre, restaurants, shopping, the Museum of Natural History, and Central Park. The rooms were spacious, and it was so quiet for NYC!

title: Our "Go To" Hotel in NYC
text: We stay here whenever we are in NYC to visit family.  The rooms are beautifully appointed, the beds REALLY comfortable, the lobby creates a great sense of arrival and is a VERY enjoyable place to hang out.  The cocktail lounge in the lobby (featuring really great live entertainment!) is really awesome (book a reservation through RESI or the front desk) and has a very classy vibe. The staff is key to a great guest experience and the team at The Wallace really shows love to all who stay there.  We have spent a lot of time in the UWS and think The Wallace is the best hotel in the area!  We always look forward to our next visit!

title: Wife’s 40th!
text:
Our first stay at The Wallace. We love it. The owner deserves kudos for the “down to the studs” modernization of this classic building. She has great taste, simple elegance in decor that is super comfortable and restful. Steps away from subway in the evenings it felt like coming home after a busy day in the city. Each morning we were well rested. We love to experience the local flavor when we travel and the amazing residential neighborhood has endless shops, coffee, restaurants and is close to Central Park which we throughly explored in fall colors. 
We stayed in a penthouse Hudson Suite for wife’s birthday. it was a great value and wonderful. I  think all the rooms have the same finishes. 
Thanks Wallace for making these five nights special.

title: A perfect home base for our honeymoon
text: We were married on a Sunday and arrived at The Wallace on Wednesday for a 4-day honeymoon. The location is perfect. The Upper West Side is full of life, yet quiet enough to be relaxing. It's easy to get to any other area of Manhattan, particularly the theater district. The Wallace itself is modern while also warm and charming. It has an intimate feel. The hotel is kept spotless and our room was spacious enough and very comfortable. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. I highly recommend The Wallace for your stay in NYC!

title: Beautiful, Spotless, Warm and Welcoming
text: Upgraded by front desk to a king suite upon check in. The room was the cleanest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Great appointments in the room (decor, steamer, fridge, nice coffee maker/coffee tea) beautiful bathroom.  The Wallace is FANTASTIC. Highly recommend.

title: Excellent location, staff, rooms
text: LOVE the Wallace! I have severe chemical sensitivity and the room had no chemical smells meaning they aren't trying to cover up bad odors. The location is close to subway and Central Park and in a quiet neighborhood.

title: Great hotel
text: Great gem on the Upper West Side!  Recommend it strongly.  Stay was terrific. Hotel was nice. Staff was great. Location is very good. Room was spacious and clean. Great bar on the main floor. Nice crowd of people.

title: Excellent except for loud door mystery
text: This hotel was a great find, especially as there doesn’t seem to be many hotels on the Upper West Side. We absolutely loved the location - felt safe to walk around even at night, was close to all the buzzy restaurants and cafes on Amsterdam and about a 10 minute walk to Central Park. Everything in the room looked brand new and was immaculately clean. Staff were super friendly and helpful. There was just one annoying issue… The doors to the rooms are very heavy and loud when they close. During certain periods while we were in the room, including late into the night, we could hear the constant sound of doors opening and closing loudly. It was frustrating and confusing because we couldn’t understand why someone would need to go in and out of their room so often and especially through the night. It was unclear whether it was caused by one unusual guest (and maybe other guests were hearing it and going out to look in the hall causing even more door noises) or whether we were in a position where we could somehow hear every door in the vicinity. That was a shame because the hotel was otherwise excellent.

title: Excellent facility in upper west side - but please update your payment infrastructure
text:
On a visit to the US starting in DC, we wanted to spend a few days in NY and opted for this hotel in upper west side in NY after looking at reviews on TA. As we were to travel from DC the same day we were to check in for our first night we got a an e-mail from the facility saying that the card we has used for the booking 
had an issue as the payment had not gone through for the first night.  I then called the facility and spend around 30 minutes to settle this issue. There was no issue with the card but there appeared to be a fault card reader there at their end. Not a good start. Also, when checking in, their card reader appeared to be faulty and it took a while before the payment was processed, adding to a false sense during the stay. I would have expected this facility to have functioning payment procedures given the price level and I was not impressed. Apart from this, the hotel is really nice and rooms were clean and staff were nice.

title: Little Retreat in the Heart of the City
text: It was our first time staying at The Wallace, and we will definitely be back. The property is well situated on the upper west side near cafes, restaurants and shops. It's an easy walk to Central Park and the subway, but is out of the fray of the city. Our room was silent, the bedding was luxurious, and the bathroom, while not large, was beautifully appointed with marble tile and chrome fixtures. The lobby and lounge are attractive and feel very "New York." I highly recommend!

title: Beautiful, Luxury Hotel in a Great Location
text: The Wallace Hotel is a beautiful hotel full of luxury and comfort. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The lounge hosted live music and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location on the Upper West Side was an easy walk to restaurants and the subway station. I will definitely stay here in again when I visit New York,.

title: Not impressed
text: Positives: the doormen were amazing! Bathroom had nice amenities. Lack of Flexibility on late checkout. Noisy - no privacy. Heard the shower and conversations in the next room. We’ve traveled around the world and stayed in many places and honestly this was one of the least accommodating and lacking in amenities we’ve experienced.

title: A gem on the Upper West Side
text:
The Wallace was a great choice for our week in NYC, with one exception for me, which I’ll explain below. We booked a suite which gave us plenty of space. The hotel is just two years old. It is in a solid older building that has been thoroughly renovated - everything is fresh and up-to-date. With only around ten (?) rooms on each floor, we almost never heard the voices of other guests in the hallway or adjacent rooms. Our room faced the quiet side street. Though we could hear some muted traffic noise from further away, it was barely noticeable and never loud enough to disturb sleep. The staff was friendly, helpful, and competent. We appreciated that there was both a coffee maker and a kettle for heating water for tea in the room. Large windows provided plenty of daylight, and the blackout shades controlled by switches on the wall were helpful.

We loved the UWS location!! There is an abundance of interesting restaurants within a few blocks, and there is a grocery store just a block away. It’s not super-close to any of the major attractions (other than the Museum of Natural History and Lincoln Center), but it’s an easy walk (or bus ride) through Central Park to the Met Museum and a slightly longer walk to Midtown. At times we used the subway or bus to get to Midtown and more distant places. There are subway and bus stops near the hotel.

The downside of this hotel for me personally was the bed. Even though I am not a large person, I need a firm, supportive mattress, and the mattress was too soft to be comfortable for me. However, the sofa in the living room was firm and perfect for me. I asked for extra bedding for it, and I slept there comfortably for the rest of our stay. The person at the front desk said I was the first person they had heard complain about the beds, so they are probably fine for most people. I'm mentioning it because there are probably other people like me who have to be careful about mattress comfort when selecting a hotel. My husband was ok with the mattress, but he said it wasn’t as comfortable as he would normally expect in a hotel in this price range. 

Other, more minor drawbacks: flimsy plastic cups and paper cups for coffee/tea, quality of the linens was good but not great, no restaurant on the premises (not a problem unless the weather is really bad - there are many options nearby). 

This hotel has many positives! Considering the price we paid, we expected higher quality on a few of the things I mentioned. But this is Manhattan, where hotels are very expensive, and we had a large suite with many nice features. So, overall, it’s probably not a bad value. If the beds were more comfortable for me, I would stay here again for sure!

title: NYC marathon
text: Perfect place for doing the NYC marathon.  Can just walk from the finish to the hotel.  Hotel was nice clean, staff was friendly and helpful.  Did not do the dining as it didn't really work as part of our trip.  Had live music on the weekend.

title: Loved my stay!
text: I've stayed in a number of hotels on the Upper West Side over the years, and The Wallace was my favorite! The staff was welcoming, helpful, and friendly. I will definitely book with them in the future.

title: Lovely hotel on the Upper West Side
text: We had a great stay at the Wallace. The king room was a good size, with everything placed where you would want it from the furniture to the plugs. The room was calm and elegant. An easy place to spend time. The gym is small but well equipped and even being in there with 4 other people didn't feel too tight. We had a drink and a snack at the bar one afternoon and that was nice too. Highly recommend.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: We had not been back to Manhattan since pre-covid and we spent a lot of time researching hotels.  Very glad we chose The Wallace.  Great location, great rooms - spacious, updated, clean, quiet rooms.  Fantastic staff, wonderful lounge with jazz Thursdays through Sundays.  It will be our go to hotel in NYC.

title: Best stay in NYC
text: The Wallace will forever be in our hearts. From the warm welcome at reception to the consistent care from every member of the team, our stay was exceptional. We extended our stay to celebrate our daughter's birthday in NYC and the kindest lady from the front desk understood she had a food allergy, so went beyond measure and give her a gift of toy dog. These details exceeded the highest standard of hospitality. GM Victor Freeman personally cared to understand how our experience was. If you're looking for care, luxury, spacious rooms and an amazing experience, make The Wallace your stay in Manhattan.

title: Wonderful UWS hotel
text: I stayed here for a week in late September 2023. The decoration was tastefully done and the staff were friendly and helpful. Great location from which to explore the Upper West Side. A particular thank you to Naika for her professionalism and helpfulness with moving me at my request (because of noise caused by other neighbors on the floor). I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone else, and hope to return on my next visit to NYC.

title: Understated elegance
text: We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was perfect for our family of four. Loads of space and very clean, and looked exactly like the pictures on the website. There is a great selection of places to eat nearby, we particularly liked 5 Napkin Burger & Daily Provisions. Also cookies from Levain Bakery. Bus stop just round the corner and very near to subway stop as well, made it very easy to get around. Overall a fabulous place to stay!

title: Definety would recommend The Wallace.
text: We chose the Wallace for its location on the Upper West Side and because it was a smaller boutique hotel. We were more than pleased by our choice and would definitely stay here again. The staff was excellent, the facilities, beautiful, and most particularly our room with spacious well appointed and absolutely spotless.

title: Un gioiello nell’Upper west side
text:
Stupendo Hotel nell’Upper West Side, molto vicino al parco, in una zona tranquilla. 
Il personale veramente simpatico e professionale, ci hanno fatto un upgrade ad una suite dal costo proibitivo, in occasione del nostro viaggio di nozze. L’hotel non dispone di ristorante, quindi non c’è la possibilità di fare colazione. 
Grazie per questo splendido soggiorno!

title: A Gem on the Upper West Side
text: My husband and I were frequent guests, staying at The Wallace a couple of nights a week for nine months during an apartment renovation in the neighborhood.  We were incredibly fortunate to find The Wallace, a place that truly felt like home — only nicer!  The chic decor, immaculate rooms, and ideal location are reason enough to book a stay at this elegant hotel.  But what makes The Wallace special is the incredible staff, who can’t do enough to please each guest.  While we’re happy to be back in our actual home, we will miss Naika, Angel, Joseph, JaySean, Greg, Justin, Jose, and everyone else.  I’d definitely look for an excuse to stay again and would, without reservation, recommend the hotel to family and friends.  There truly is nothing like The Wallace on the Upper West Side.

title: Disappointing
text: We chose this hotel due to its ratings, but we felt like we were at any 3 star chain hotel. This was our third stop in this trip, and we stayed at a Kimpton near Chelsea and at a Sonesta in D.C. and both experiences were far superior. They have the same star level at the Wallace but inferior guest ratings, so logically we were expecting outstanding here, maybe that’s why it felt so short. The room we were at had no acoustic isolation, even light from the corridor got into the room at night. The pillows are fantastic, the bed itself is fine, but the blackout shades are a disgrace, as a lot of light passes on the bottom of it. The third party we booked from said we would have a bath/shower combo and we were given a room for special needs, only a curtain in the shower so it was annoying to have water seeping through the floor. Staff was fine in general. The lounge was closed off to guests due to private events in 3 of the nights we were there, and it’s open to the public so it gets pretty packed. If you like to be able to just walk in the hotel bar or restaurant after a long day, choose a different hotel. Another point, and this one made me wonder if it was cultural prejudice or discrimination, is that I specifically said that I was going to pay in cash for further charges at check out.  We prepaid for the room. They tried to charge my card for restaurant fees two nights before check out, but since I keep it blocked for safety reasons it didn’t do through. In the morning, as we were going out to enjoy the last day on the city, I questioned the front desk and said I was going to pay cash, and the receptionist said that we could go ahead and pay at that moment. We had to go back to the room to take more cash. Whether it is hotel procedure or not, it left a very bad feeling. So all in all, is not a bad hotel, but when coming back to the city I would never stay here again.

title: Lack of respect and politeness towards guests
text:
I was staying there with my fiancé from 10/08/2023 until 10/15/2023 on the thirteenth floor and forgot in the last drawer near the window 2 books and some documents that were in the middle of the books, one of them being my national ID card. license, which I needed and we had problems renting the car in Miami.
My fiancé called several times while we were in Miami to check and send it to us, but they said they would check and send it via email and we never heard back.

I am very grateful for not giving me the feedback I deserved regarding my personal documents forgotten at the hotel and your lack of credibility and trust.

title: Spotless, comfortable and well located
text:
We stayed at The Wallace to see a show at the Beacon Theater (just two blocks south of the hotel). We were able to park on the street right out front. A bellman met us when we pulled up, we got a lovely greeting at the front desk, and we were very pleasantly surprised by our light, bright, quiet, spacious and very comfortable queen one-bedroom suite. The decor is a tad generic for me but it was quite nice nonetheless. Everything was new and fresh. The bedroom was in the back and was wonderfully quiet. We requested a high floor and got it. There was a nespresso machine, an electric kettle for tea, a mini fridge, and a microwave. 

This hotel keeps it pretty simple-no restaurant, room service, valet parking-but honestly I think they fill a much needed niche for smart, friendly, well-run small to medium sized hotels in great locations. With the wonderful markets and food options nearby, we were actually happy to bypass yet another hotel breakfast and instead buy some delicious treats and cappuccinos for the room.

 We couldn’t have asked for a better stay.

title: Lovely stay!
text: Perfect UWS boutique hotel. Comfy, modern, & very clean; excellent & attentive housekeeping; accommodating & friendly staff. Felt welcomed immediately & always met with warmth & smiles. Bed is great, just a heavy-footed upstairs guest.

title: Wallace Hotel - great experience
text:
The Wallace is the historic upper west side Millbourne Hotel, a smaller apartment hotel which was renamed and had rooms totally redone 2-3 years ago. It is like new but they kept a historic feel. First, the location is about as perfect as you can get. Central Park a very few blocks - Lincoln Center a little further but we walked there also, subway stop 3 blocks, Natural History Museum 3-4 block walk, Zabars (we nearly lived there) 3-4 blocks so - 100 out of 100 on location.
Room was also near perfect. We got the smallest suite they had and it was huge - had seating area, small refrigerator, counter top with eating area. They bring microwave on request. We asked for a quiet room and were on the 11th floor with a great view. They have small appreciated touches - free spring water in bottles, books on NYC in bookshelves, umbrella in the room, great housekeeping staff ( shout out to Verone - real nice), and front desk and engineer super friendly. It might be useful to get bellman to show you around the room when u arrive - sophisticated lighting system takes a minute to get comfortable with, buttons raise and lower shades, shower great but again a little tricky to learn, - all in all a great experience. The price? high. Not as high as many others but we felt we got our money’s worth. The only thing I could think to improve - There is an evening bar off the lobby. It’s overpriced and has a piano but when I stopped in there was canned music. The hotel apparently contracts it out - other hotels in the area have small bakeries or nice restaurants off the lobby - Would have been great to go downstairs snd find a great breakfast place. But Zabars is but a short walk and is a fun place to grab to-go food. We will def return to the Wallace.

title: A Great Hotel
text: Fabulous room, excellent staff. This a fine hotel in a great location and we look forward to it being our go to hotel in NYC. Friends in Florida have been staying here and suggested we try it. Happy we listened to them as we loved everything about our stay..

title: Birthday celebration
text: The hotel was beautiful. Location excellent. Upgrade for special birthday so much appreciated. Everyone was so accommodating. Recommendations for restaurants and travel guidelines for activities were very helpful

title: Stay HERE!!!
text: This is my absolute favorite hotel in New York. You get to feel like a local. Every detail is perfectly thought out. The rooms are beautiful, the lounge is lively, and the food was great. I’m so glad to have found this gem.

title: Restful, quiet property in Manhattan
text: Well maintained, clean and modernized property.  Quiet….best NY sleep ever.  Premier property with high quality service, finishes bed and bedding and maintenance standards, Would definitely revisit on future trips to NY.

title: Review of The Wallace hotel
text: Impeccable hotel: perfect room with every amenity, and super clean. The hotel is very well situated: a short walk from the park and Met, close to the 72 and 79th Street subways, with good restaurants nearby and a short walk to the ballet, Columbus Circle and it’s shops, Broadway, etc. The staff were all charming and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Overpriced, small rooms and loud
text: Very expensive for very small rooms (much more that normal even for NY), night time cleaning crew makes loud noise in the halls at 1:30AM & 3:30AM near guest rooms. Staff lacks concern. Great part of town.

title: A wonderful UWS hotel
text:
We stayed in a One Bedroom Double Queen Suite for 5 nights. The bedroom and lounge were a really good size, especially for NYC. The wetbar was a welcome addition and housekeeping were generous with the bottles of water that they left everyday. The room was modern and clean and the blackout blinds meant that our 5 year old actually slept in! I also like the fact that they don't charge a resort fee. 

The neighbourhood is family friendly and there are plenty of nice reataurants within walking distance. 72nd and 79th street subways stations are a short walk away and we found it easy getting to all the major attractions that NYC has to offer.  

If I was to be really picky I would say that the bathroom is a little small in comparison to the rest of the room and it could do with some better storage options. It would also be nice if the Wallace Lounge was open during the day for drinks and light snacks. 

Overall, the Wallace Hotel offers good value for money and I would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

title: The Wallace Hotel New York is elegant perfection
text:
The Wallace Hotel in New York was quite simply the best hotel experience we have ever had. I cannot recommend The Wallace and its excellent staff enough, they are all fabulous, so kind and friendly. We have to say an extra special thank you to your staff member Greg, who helped us quickly secure a taxi to The MJ musical with only half an hour until the curtains opened. Greg ordered a taxi, and when it became apparent that 76th Street was blocked by a fire engine, Greg ran out of the hotel and secured a taxi for us on Broadway. It was thanks to Greg that we were at the theatre when the curtains went up. 

We also very much appreciated the beauty and elegance of the hotel and the luxurious furnishings. Our rooms were beautifully furnished and our beds were extremely comfortable. 

The Wallace is also perfectly positioned in terms of vicinity to most attractions and places of interest. You will be very close to Central Park and most of the world renown museums. There are plenty of places to eat, both formal and casual, nearby and excellent food markets such as Zabar’s, Citarella, and Fairway Market all within a few minutes walk. 

We will always remember The Wallace and your wonderful staff and we would love to return one day.

title: Great location and excellent service!
text: This hotel operates more like a private residence! The staff are excellent, professional and detail-oriented. It is in a different category than some of the other popular 4 star properties.This is a luxury experience.

title: The Wallace Sets the Bar High
text: The Wallace sets the bar in high, delivering superior hospitality that seems to stem from a culture of best people and exemplary leadership. I cannot say enough great things about the The Wallace staff - from doorman to receptionist to management, to maintenance, to housekeeper, The Wallace crew make this hotel exceptional in every way.  A big shoutout to Justin and Joseph who made our stay at The Wallace extra special again this year, going above and beyond to help me celebrate a big milestone birthday for my daughter.  We are already looking forward to returning next year!

title: Excellent hôtel à Manhattan
text: Très bon hôtel dans l'Upper West Side. Belle chambre, excellente literie et très bon service. On regrettera simplement l'absence de petit déjeuner ainsi que de quelques assiettes, verres et couverts dans la kitchenette (Queen suite). Personnel top.

title: Plastic Cups at a 5 Star Hotel!!! Dirty Bathroom Floor
text:
[Note: I would normally have not written this review but after asking for private feedback I was instantly put here with the hotel asking for my public feedback so here it is.] 

1. Hotel is supposedly a 5 star hotel.  I travel regularly.  I have NEVER been to a 5 star hotel that only has plastic glasses.  Spend the money to provide real glasses for water and also for coffee.  There IS a bar in the building.  Pay them to clean the glasses OR install a dishwasher in the building to clean glasses.  There is just no excuse for this.  You do NOT need a restaurant to be able to clean glasses.  We were constantly told that because you did not have a restaurant that you did not supply real glasses and coffee cups.  We were repeatedly told they only had plastic glasses.  We screamed and screamed until some real glass water glasses were found.  
2. This hotel has no clear COVID policy in place about what the hotel will and will not do if a guest has COVID.  We checked out early because we were told that the hotel would not clean the room until we checked out even though scientific evidence shows with proper face mask that staff can not get covid from the sheets and linen.
3. First day (before COVID) ask that bathroom floor be mopped and cleaned well (as it was very dirty).  Room was serviced but floor not cleaned.  I ended up on my hands and knees using a toothbrush to clean the very dirty disgusting floor!!  No excuse.

title: Excellent
text: We were in New York for four days prior to a cruise and managed to arrive at the same time as a tropical storm which also lasted four days. The Wallace was a great place to stay during this time. Service was excellent. The room very comfortable. Every staff member was willing to help with any questions. The bar/lounge was a great place to visit with very good light snacks and enjoyable light jazz. Neighborhood was great. We will return.

title: August 2023 - Perfect NYC Location. Clean, modern, friendly, VERY comfortable
text:
Well the positive reviews sum up The Wallace. We stayed for 5 nights in August 2023 in a one bedroom king suite. The room was perfect, immaculate, lovely modern decor and distinctive bedroom, bathroom and living area. We walked in and went wow, this will do nicely. 

Super quiet hotel with really friendly and helpful staff. When you walk in it looks clean, smells lovely and we were welcomed really nicely. The bed was fantastic and everything in the room from TV's to AC to Bathroom worked perfectly. Rooms service was superb too.

If you want to stay where New Yorkers live then this is a great location. Near to all the nice parts of NYC and a gentle walk or cab to get anywhere you want.

Really, it is superb and I can only imagine the poor reviews of from odd people as they reflect the complete opposite of our experience. For me you can book the level of room we had and better and get a superb experience.

title: The best hotel at the UWS. We had a great experience.
text:
The Wallace Hotel exceeded all my expectations and provided me with an exceptional experience from start to finish! 
The interior design is tasteful and stylish, creating a cozy and sophisticated atmosphere. The rooms are immaculate, spacious, and beautifully decorated, providing a comfortable and luxurious retreat after a long day of exploring.
On top of all this, the location of the Wallace Hotel is perfect. It's conveniently situated near popular attractions, making it easy to explore the city while still enjoying a peaceful and serene environment.

title: A truly wonderful experience at the Wallace
text: I’ve stayed in NYC hundreds of times over the past ten years for business, and The Wallace Hotel was, by far, the best experience I’ve had. This was a trip for personal travel. Each and every employee was friendly, kind and always willing to help! And the hotel and the rooms are so so clean! Our one bedroom suite was very spacious and had all the amenities you could ask for. The queen (versus the usual double) beds were much appreciated. The Wallace is a MUST stay.

title: A Hidden Gem!
text: Nice, quiet residential location. A reasonable walk to Central Park and Columbus Circle. Friendly staff. Comfy bar with excellent food and drinks. Updated, clean and well-appointed rooms. Well-equipped gym. Highly recommend and will return!

title: One week in NY
text: Nous étions ravis de notre premier séjour à NY. L hôtel est un boutique hôtel charmant, la literie est fantastique, quartier calme mais toutes les commodités à proximité, très propre et peu bruyant. Propre, chambre refaite tous les jours.

title: GREAT upper westside hotel
text: We have stayed at The Wallace at least 4 or 5 times.  It is clean, well appointed, relatively spacious, and with an understandably excellent location.  Staff are friendly.  Rooms are clean and NY large.  Beds are comfortable with lovely linens.  Bathrooms are large and well-appointed.  All rooms have Nespresso coffee makers and a fridge with water.  No restaurant in the building, but a very nice bar with live music later in the week and on the weekend.  A touch pricey but it's worth it if it's only 15% higher than nearby hotels.

title: The old Milburn was wonderful, this new version is four time the price.
text:
The new Wallace hotel was for many years the wonderful,family run Milburn. 
The new version could be at any airport in the world. At four times the price of the Milburn this place is a joke, stay away.

title: Review of The Wallace Hotel in New York City
text: We stayed at The Wallace for five nights in early September 2023, and we had a great experience. Our one-bedroom double queen suite was spacious and clean. It looked exactly like the pictures on the hotel website. The staff at the front desk and the doorman were very polite throughout our stay. The location was perfect for us: It's a short walk to Central Park, the Met, and the Natural History Museum. We also enjoyed the live music in the lounge. We had no complaints. We highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay there on future trips to New York.

title: Excellent hotel
text: The hotel is very good. The location is great, the room is comfortable, the bathroom is excellent and everything is new and modern. And there's also a bar in the lounge that has live jazz on some days of the week.

title: Fire alarm gave us a rude awakening.
text:
We, my son and I, were booked in for 5 nights in 2 de luxe king sized rooms which were delightful. However, the fire alarm went off around 2.30am on our second night. For me that was a walk down 14 floors followed by a walk back up again. There was no official notification that this was a false alarm only guests heading back upstairs alerted us. No apologies were issued (to us) next day. I felt this was poorly handled.
What it did tell me was that the stairs were very clean as I made this journey in my bare feet.
Possibly because of this incident my review is perhaps very "picky". The shower pressure wasn't the best compared with the ones in my home. I think I was close a the cleaners' cupboard and was wakened quite early by the comings and goings.

title: Exceptionally rude and hostile staff, but clean remodelled room
text:
I stayed here for my husbands 40th birthday. I was very excited to stay in a hotel that looked like it gave such great service but I was sorely disappointed. I called the hotel a few weeks prior to our stay to let them know it was a special occasion. So, I expected a warm welcome when we arrived at 1pm, exhausted from our flight. Instead, when I asked if a room was ready they said check in was at 3 and there were no exceptions. The front desk staff yelled at me and told me I had a bad attitude before telling me to leave and come back. I felt so uncomfortable I didn’t even change my clothes after an 8 hour flight.

I gave them my phone number to call me when the room was ready, and after wandering around hungry and thirsty (they didn’t even offer us water when we arrived) . They never called us to let us know the room was ready. They didn’t bring up the luggage and I had to deal with the intimidating front desk staff again to get our bags.

On a nicer note, towards the end of our week long stay they brought us a bottle of wine. I checked and it was under $8, but I appreciate the effort to give their guests a hangover.

The rooms are spacious, clean, and looked like the pictures, but for the price, rude service and lack of amenities it’s not worth it.

title: A great place to stay
text:
After a long flight from the UK we needed a nice place to stay in New York for a night before we moved onto the next stage of our holiday.

The Wallace was the perfect hotel after our long tiring journey. The staff on reception were exceptional and got us to our room within minutes. The room was beyond expectations and accommodated our family of four perfectly. The room was very modern and exceptionally clean. The bathroom was large and almost as new. All the facilities you could wish for were available, a nice coffee machine and cold water in the fridge.
