Very well located for Central Park and the National History Museum along with restaurants.

One particular comment is with regard to the young lady on reception that helped us out. On arrival we were required as normal to make a credit card deposit for potential damages etc. Our card was giving us problems, but the young lady kindly helped us out.

I cannot recommend this place enough, our only disappointment was that we were only able to stay for one night. We won't be staying anywhere else in New York when we return.

title: Mejor hotel que me he quedado en NYC
text:
Espectacular atención, !!
me encantó la decoración del cuarto, la ubicación, los productos de aseo, 
Me encantó el hecho de qué no tenga servicios de comida en el hotel ya qué este detalle lo hace aún más limpio ; es un hotel que está recién inaugurado tiene un año de antigüedad !!

title: Chic hotel in Upper west side nyc
text:
Enjoyed our stay at The Wallace ! 
Lovely interior , great location and very helpful staff ! 
Stayed in junior suite for a week n than extended my stay in superior king room , good value for money.
Comfortable beds , automatic blinds and complimentary coffee tea making facilities 👌

title: Beautiful hotel in great location
text: We stayed in the Wallace while we visited NYC to get married, and we could not have enjoyed it more. Our room was a one bedroom Queen suite on the 15th floor and was spacious and immaculate. We did not hear a sound from other guests while we were in our room. The staff were super friendly. The decor in the hotel is beautiful and there is a lovely aroma when you enter the foyer. Location in UWS is superb, away from the hustle and bustle of other parts of Manhattan, and the proximity of the subway provides easy access to anywhere you need to go. There was also live music in the lounge when we stayed and this was a lovely area to chill out after a busy day. Joshua working there was very kind to us and helped make our experience special. We would highly recommend The Wallace and look forward to returning on our next visit to NYC.

title: New and clean, but not luxury
text:
I would say I had an average experience for what I would expect in a luxury hotel in this price range. I loved that the rooms were new and clean (no carpet!). It's also the nicest hotel close to Columbia. But there were a few things that made the stay less pleasant. One is that the walls are thin. I could hear the adjacent rooms very clearly. They also are understaffed: there's no room service, they don't help you with your bags or show you the room, and if you order Uber Eats, the doorman won't bring it up to you. To me these are the things that separate nice hotels from luxury hotels. 

Second was a 2:30AM fire alarm that went off 3 times (most of us only left our rooms the first two times then ignored it the third time around 3:30). In the morning, I expected them to acknowledge the situation but it was like nothing happened but after talking to the front door man it turns out maybe one of the workers was smoking in the basement. I'm not sure if that's true or not, but the fact that we didn't get an apology letter... or even free coffee in the AM as a gesture that this unfortunately happened on a Sunday night before the first day of school. It then had me thinking about fire safety in the building. My room was on a high floor in the back, and there was no fire escape. Not sure what I would have done if there was a real fire in the hallway. Anyhow, I don't think I will stay here again.

title: Truly Excellent
text: The Wallace is an exceptional Hotel. The rooms are stylish and with utmost comfort in mind. The bed is enormous with beautiful pillows. The bathroom has a huge deep bath and a huge powerful shower with lovely bath and shower products. The mini kitchen has a coffee machine, a kettle and the fridge is restocked every day with fresh water and snacks. The service at The Wallace is excellent, nothing is too much trouble. In particular Justin Cordaro was five star from recommending restaurants, booking taxis and generally making our 6 day stay a wonderful experience.

title: Wonderful Upper West Side Hotel
text: A beautiful upper west side boutique hotel, rooms ultra-modern and very comfortable. Reasonably sized for New York. Extremely pleasant staff. Minimal in-house dining options, but numerous restaurant and coffee options very close to the hotel.

title: Great location in Manhattan
text: Excellent location for this hotel. Only suggestion is try to get a room on higher floors. The one next to the lounge are a bit loud, so better to stay on higher floors if you have children. The lounge was great to have a drink and light snacks. Overall, would stay here again!

title: Beyond our dreams
text: The rooms were well appointed, peaceful, stylish and immaculate!! The Wallace felt like an oasis in the city.  The staff we encountered at the Wallace were professional and above and beyond, from assisting us to our room, giving us dinning and parking recommendations to holding our bags the day we checked out so we could enjoy the location longer was exceptional. I wish I had more of the staff members names- esp. front desk and doormen as they all deserve mention. Thank you and we will be back!! Our room was so lovely we actually did not choose to eat in and instead brought all of our food back to the balcony to enjoy eating and drinking coffee with the unforgettable  view.

title: Wonderful!
text:
We had an amazing stay at this hotel in NYC! The location (upper west side) was fantastic, making it easy to explore the city's attractions. Lots of wonderful shops and restaurants within walking distance. Lovely area!
The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. Highly recommend this hotel for a great experience. We would definitely choose to stay there again!!

title: beautiful hotel!
text: This is a beautiful hotel in a great neighborhood.  Walking distance to so much.  Clean, and well-appointed room.  Quite large for NYC!  Staff was so friendly!  Would definitely stay here again.  Short walk to the Beacon Theater!

title: Best Hotel Ever
text: This is hands down the best hotel ever. Always a positive experience. The staff is lovely+location is perfect. Rooms are always spotless. The Wallace is now our go to hotel in NYC. Thank you for the amazing service!

title: Amazing hotel
text: The hotel made us feel rich. We definitely didn’t belong there but we felt very welcomed. The staff was wonderful and the room was amazing. It was easy to navigate. I wish we could’ve stayed longer than one night.

title: Great little hotel!
text: Great little hotel. Easy and quick check in (we arrived late from the U.K.). We stayed in a double queen which was ample for our family of four! The bathroom was huge, with a wonderful walk in shower and lots of lovely toiletries. Staff are their great asset and all were so friendly and helpful, going over and above their call of duty. We would have stayed again on our return from Toronto but sadly they couldn’t accommodate our dates. So booked into Pendry, West Manhattan, instead - what a terrible mistake (they need to take a lesson from the Wallace on service)! The beds are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in….worth the stay in itself!

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: We needed a hotel on the upper westside and that's what led us to the wallace. It's on a quiet location on 76th street yet an easy walk to good restaurants,  the beacon theater, central park and amorino gelato. A subway stop is nearby. Room was up to date and quiet.

title: Incredible hotel in an incredible neighborhood
text: I used to live around the corner from The Wallace and this neighborhood has always held a special place in my heart. I chose The Wallace for its location and I highly recommend this hotel. The staff is so helpful and friendly, the rooms are lovely, the neighborhood cannot be beat. For tourists thinking this is out of the way from NYC attractions, the 72nd Street subway station is just blocks away. There are many buses as well. Lots of food and shopping options close by.

title: Spacious and comfortable place to relax and enjoy
text: We enjoyed the spacious, modern, stylish and comfortable 2-queen suite. Friendly and helpful staff who always promptly took care of our needs and questions. Clean and tide living room, bedroom and bathroom. Comfortable furnitures (sofa, chair and beds). innovative lighting controls make it very convenient. Staying here is the best experience we had hoped for to relax and rest after exhausted traveling around the city during the day.

title: As Advertised
text: We stayed in a one bedroom double queen suite. The suite was new and stylish and looked exactly like the pictures on the website. The staff was super friendly and the location was perfect (close to the museums, Central Park, and lots of great restaurants).  We’ll be back.

title: Amazing experience.
text: My stay at The Wallace Hotel was simply incredible! The luxurious ambiance, stunning views, and comfortable rooms made for a perfect retreat. The stylish lounge bar and attentive staff exceeded all my expectations. The hotel's central location was convenient for exploring the city. Overall, a truly unforgettable experience of opulence and relaxation.

title: Weekend getaway with my daughter
text: The staff was terrific, the room was beautiful and clean, and the location was perfect. I liked that this was off the main street, so a little more secluded. Within walking distance to the 72 street subway, Central Park and Lincoln Center. Check out the roof top, too! I will definitely consider staying here again.

title: Muy recomendable hotel en el Upper West
text: Hotel muy comodo, muy bien atendido por un personal muy amable. Los baños impecables igual que las habitaciones. Todo agradablemente decorado. Lo descubri en noviembre 2021 y desde entonces volvi 2 veces mas. La location no es 10 puntos pero tiene entradas de subte muy cerca, colectivos y una enorme cantidad de restaurantes muy cerca. Muy recomendable!!

title: A gorgeous place to stay in a lovely part of Manhattan
text: On a recent stay at The Wallace, we experienced true hospitality -- warm, friendly staff who are genuinely helpful and kind. Gorgeous and spacious room with all the amenities one would want for a seamless stay. Delicious food and ambience in the lounge, and a perfect location. Thank you The Wallace team! We can't wait to return.

title: Extraordinary
text:
We loved our short but sweet stay at the Wallace. Victor and his staff exceeded our expectations. Very I had a total shoulder replacement and request the flattest pillow. I slept like I was in my own bed! Very helpful with aiding us in getting around the city. 
THANK YOU

title: Would stay again
text: The rooms were impeccably clean and very comfortable. The hotel is on a side street—versus a main avenue—we had no issues with noise. The staff actually seemed happy to be there, beyond simply being friendly and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised to find a jazz band playing when we returned from dinner, and by the number of people who came to the hotel bar who were not staying at the hotel. Would recommend and stay again.

title: Perfect place for a stay in NYC
text:
We spent four nights at the Wallace Hotel in June 2023. What a beautiful hotel! We even got an upgrade for a suite for our special wedding anniversary. Thank you so much!
The suite is very stylishly decorated and spacious. The beds are very comfortable. The lighting concept is very modern and thoughtful. The refrigerator drawer is handy for keeping drinks cold. The bathroom is very nice and modern with a walk-in shower and a small window to open. Everything is very clean and pleasant. The suite is on the 15th floor and it was very quiet. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The hotel is within a short walking distance to the Museum of Natural History, Central Park and the Subway station. We enjoyed our stay very much.

title: Bon choix à New York
text: Emplacement calme, proche de Central Park. Chambre très propre et de bonne taille pour NY. Literie très confortable. Salle de bains très bien. Attention : pas de petit dejeuner sur place ni rééllement de restaurant mais on trouve facilement tout ce qu'il faut autour de l'hôtel. Un bon choix pour New York

title: Wonderful!
text: Lovely hotel and hospitality.  The local team is very supportive and polite. The room and the cleanliness are perfect. The location is great, quiet, and at the same time close to everything. I highly recommend the place to stay in NY.

title: Best hotel on the UWS
text: I've stayed at The Wallace several times: the rooms are lovely and quiet and the staff is consistently helpful and friendly. Cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The bar downstairs is a gem.

title: Class personified on the Upper West Side and so near the Beacon!
text:
We chose this hotel for its proximity to the Beacon Theater, and we’re so happy we did.
Sophisticated, attentive, comfortable, and relaxing quiet! 
The added bonus was the piano lounge with low lit vibe and live entertainment until 10 PM. Was a fabulous way to end our evenings after a day out in the city.

title: Great stay
text: This is where I will be staying from now on. Helpful and friendly staff. Great location.  Transportation is close by. And excellent room.  Comfortable and clean. The room was luxurious but reasonably priced.

title: Beautiful, redesigned boutique hotel
text: Beautiful, calming colors and design in the hotel rooms with modern, easy to use, architecture including hardware, plumbing and lighting fixtures, electric blackout curtains, Nespresso, refrigerator, soft linens and towels - so many thoughtful touches. Great location near tons of markets and restaurants, and subway and buses. Room was spotless with daily housekeeping service, which is no longer a given in NYC. Will definitely be back!

title: Great stay
text: I would highly recommend this hotel! The staff was fabulous and rooms were clean and new! There was live music in the bar and the drinks were delicious. Check in and check out was painless. And it was super easy to walk for coffee and snacks. Overall, great location and value

title: A gem. Lovely place to stay.
text: I cannot remember when I have had a better hotel stay. It was excellent in every detail. The staff was exceptionally polite, friendly, and helpful. Our room was lovely and spotless. The Lounge was a special treat. I highly recommend the Wallace.

title: Extraordinaire
text: Chambre calme, propre, équipée avec attention aux détails. Situé à cinq minutes de la station de métro 72e rue, avec des lignes locale (1) et express (2 et 3). J'ai beaucoup apprécié le personnel : professionnel, efficace et vraiment aimable. J'ai rarement vu une telle qualité de service.

title: Great hotel on the Upper West Side
text: The Wallace is a wonderful hotel. Clean, great staff, large room for NYC, nice lounge in the evening,  Lots of good places to eat a short walk away.  Walkable to theater district, Times Square and Columbus Circle. Highly recommend

title: Upper West Side Dream Hotel
text: Almost afraid to leave yet another glowing review becusde I want this place all to myself! They did a beautiful renovation job, everything is new, front desk staff couldn’t be lovelier, got a free upgrade and the suite is just gorgeously done. Perfect location close to friends and Central Park ideal spot on UWS. 100% would stay again. Thank you!

title: Superb home base on the UWS
text:
My recent three-night visit to the Wallace was the best hotel stay I've ever had in Manhattan. My expectations were high based on the top-notch online reviews, but this is the rare hotel that actually exceeded my expectations. Although I booked the lowest room category (a superior queen), my room was very spacious and well-appointed. It was also immaculately clean and comfortable, with thoughtful small details like bedside one-touch controls for lighting, window shades, and privacy. The room included lots of useful complimentary extras, including both a Nespresso machine and an electric teakettle, and bottled water generously replenished every day.
The UWS location is central yet quiet and peaceful, and the hotel staff is professional, efficient, and always ready to help. Now that I've discovered this gem, it will be hard to imagine staying elsewhere in Manhattan.

title: Five Star Stay on Upper West Side!
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Wallace. Our bedroom was spacious, beautifully appointed, sparkling clean with many additional features, such as Nespresso machine and Bodum kettle.
The bathroom is well designed with high end features. 
From the moment we checked in to our departure, our stay was perfect. All the staff at every level were professional, friendly and very helpful. Great neighborhood too. Many restaurants, close to Central Park, the Met and Natural History Museum, amongst other wonderful site seeing places.

title: Homifay
text:
Amazing hotel great location and would gulf hot recommend.  This was our second visit and won’t be our last. The location of the hotel
Is excellent for sight seeing.  The rooms are also large so plenty of room if you want to have a wee pre drink before heading out.

title: Hidden gem in upper West Side
text: Hotel has very modern amenities and was clean.  The staff are helpful, friendly and knowledgeable and look like they are enjoying their jobs.  Great location and easy access.  Loved that they had music on Friday and Sat evening.

title: Wow!  Don’t hesitate to stay here!!
text: We stayed at the Wallace for the first time this July.  From the moment of check-in, this property exceeded our expectations in every way!  You can’t expect a huge room on the Upper West Side but this room was generously sized. The bathrooms are spa-like and the whole room was spotlessly clean.the hotel offered live jazz musicians in the bar while we were there and that was an unexpected delight. The hotel is close to the subway and centra park. We will definitely stay here anytime we are back in the city.

title: A great find
text: An excellent overall experience. Spacious well appointed room with a very comfortable bed. The lounge serves great cocktails with good live music. The team could not have been more helpful. Definitely a place to return to.

title: Boutique Hotel on Upper West Side
text: This newly renovated small hotel on a quiet block of the UWS is a total gem! I’ve stayed a few times now and it will be my go-to going forward! Dog friendly, family friendly and in an excellent location

title: A peaceful haven in the Upper West Side
text:
Every single interaction with the staff was pleasant, from the staff at the door and front desk, to occasional encounters with staff in the hallways or elevators.  To come and go throughout the day and evening with a warm smile and cheery greeting from staff was lovely.
The room was exceptionally clean, the room amenities were excellent, and the location was fabulous.

title: Exceeded all expectations
text:
This hotel blew me away. My family stayed in a one-bedroom Double Queen Suite for 4 nights and had the most comfortable stay possible. The room was fresh and clean, the design made great use of space, the lobby lounge was fun with live music in the evenings, and the staff went above and beyond to welcome us. 
I was shocked by how spacious the room was, especially for NYC. It had remote control
blackout shades which were amazing when we were jet lagged. The TVs were easy to link to phones or tablets to cast shows or movies on. And the upper west side street where it was located was so sweet and charming! 
It was such an amazing stay that I almost hate to let others know about it!

title: Bet say ever home away from home
text: This hotel was the excellent choice I felt at home almost like I knew everybody there already. The staff was really knowledgeable of the area. Which made my trip even better. Because I was working in the area. I didn’t have much time to enjoy the lounge but it seem like a really upbeat. Cool vibe.

title: A Gem in NYC
text: There are so many hotels to choose from in New York, but to find a gem is hard.  I had researched hotels and saw the listing for the Wallace. As an Upper West Side fan, I decided to give it a try. It exceeded my expectations.  The staff is warm and welcoming, the location you can not beat, the rooms offer a contemporary decor - and a beautiful bar - with a piano player.  Truly a gem.

title: Poor Service!
text: Wish I could give this hotel a better rating but the service just isn’t there. Nice hotel, great rooms but customer service is horrible! And that’s what makes the difference between a decent hotel and amazing hotel!

title: The best place to stay in NYC
text:
I stayed at the Wallace for a family vacation in early March. My husband, son and I had stayed here once before and loved it! We've been looking for a nice quality hotel on the Upper West Side since leaving as residents in 2014, so we've been thrilled to call The Wallace home whenever we come back to visit NYC. 

During this trip, we met my parents for a long weekend. As expected, The Wallace's impeccable customer service and high-end hotel was as we remembered it. We love the location as it is a short distance from the 1 train as well as Central park. The rooms are always super clean and luxurious -- we rented a one-bedroom Queen room and it's always more than enough room for our family of 3. 

Since we drive up to NYC anytime we visit, parking is always the biggest challenge for us. We don't usually pay for one of the garages, but have been lucky to find a spot on the street after searching for a little while. 

This time, we brought our dog up too -- he's about 12 pounds and anything bigger would have felt a little cramped in the hotel room. The staff were really welcoming to him and gave him lots of pets. 

The Wallace is definitely our NYC home when we come to visit and we can't wait to stay here again in the future.

title: Great Hotel
text:
We are so glad we found this gem of a hotel on the Upper West side. 
So close to the Beacon Theatre too!
Near to many other must see locations as well.
Our room was beautiful and the staff was great.
Highly recommend!

title: Great hotel!
text: Large room. The room is bigger than most of the hotel out there. High tech, you just need to press a button to have someone to clean your room, fast! Thank you to Ms. Betty kwok, for your kind help and support!

title: Large Spacing
text: Clean and comfortable. There is lots of space in your room and water, coffees and tea ready for you. Clean bathrooms, living room, kitchen & toilet. They will also clean your room fast, within 30 mins from my experience. Appreciate the front desk members, Betty and Joseph!

title: A compelling choice
text: If you appreciate boutique hotels, The Wallace is a great choice.  It offers a great location and standard of accommodation. I did lots of research and The Wallace met or exceeded our expectations - not many hotels do so.  Enjoyed the Upper West Side and the ease of access to sights, amenities, and the subway. High recommend for the discerning traveller.

title: Fantastic Hotel & A Real Gem in Upper West
text:
I stayed at hotel 08-14 June and had a fantastic time.   I stayed in a two bed/living room suite.    It was a little big for me but a friend had cancelled last minute.   The suite was amazing, rooms big and a great bathroom with walk in shower.   Wet bar was perfect for washing up after breakfast and so good to have an electric kettle for those important cups of tea.    There was so much space in the suite and it had everything to needed for a comfortable stay
Staff were very friendly and helpful especially when my flight was cancelled and had to spend an extra night at hotel so didn't check out till 15 June.   My thanks to Vic and Angel for their help and assistance while staying at hotel.  All the staff were friendly, helpful and always greeted you with a smile 
The hotel is close to many good restaurants, bakeries, shopping and very close for subway and several bus routes.
I will be returning to New York at Easter next year and have already booked the same suite with hotel for myself and two friends.
This is a real gem of a hotel in Upper West and is my number one place to stay anytime I visit New York

title: Excellent place
text: Loved the Wallace Hotel from the courteous staff to cleanliness and location of the hotel. Our six night stay was great. It’s close some good restaurants, bars and a short walk to the subway. I especially liked the staff and will definitely return.

title: Perfect for our family
text: Our room was One bedroom with 2 queen beds for a family of 4. It was spacious and the wet bar was small but big enough to manage simple breakfasts. 3-4 laundromats were around, and many groceries and restaurants nearby as well.

title: Spacious and Clean Hotel
text:
My family stayed at the Wallace for three nights: June 22 - June 25, 2023. 
We stayed at a one room double queen. The hotel is pretty new so the entire room was neat, spacious, bathroom was excellent(clean without any soap scum), good amenity, modern and classic deco. 
The staff were friendly but we had two incidents. 
My husband asked a front desk staff to make dinner reservation and the staff replied " I don´t do reservations." At the end, he made a reservation but it was unexpected.
The second incident was our check out date. We asked a front desk staff to keep our luggage at the hotel for three hours after check out. One front desk staff told us she would take our luggage if we were all to be out of premises. We had three big luggage and three hand carry on. We wanted to relax at the lounge without having to worry about our luggage. 
At the end, the staff took three big luggage into their care.

title: Great Hotel!  Highly Recommend!!
text: Beautiful boutique hotel with just the right amount of elegance without being pretentious!  Service is genuinely friendly and hospitable.  Upper West Side location is a short walk to great restaurants and to the subway.  We visit Manhattan twice a year and always stay at The Wallace!

title: Pleasant stay
text:
We stayed here for a few days while our apartment (down the street) was having work done. Our suite was lovely, clean, and spacious, and we would stay here again. The only reason I gave a rating of 4 rather than 5 was that the check-in experience was pretty miserable. 

Check-in time is at 3pm, and we arrived to check in at 3:05. Our room wasn't ready but since we were told it would be ready in 10 minutes, so we decided just to wait in the lobby. After waiting quietly for 45 minutes, I asked for an update and was told that I needed to "Try being patient." The room was finally ready at 4pm, with no apologies from the front desk staff for making us wait an hour with no updates. I fully understand that sometimes rooms aren't ready at check-in time, and had we been treated with respect and understanding, I still would have given the Wallace a rating of 5. But after waiting quietly for 45 minutes when we had been told it would be 10, I was shocked that I was scolded for not being patient enough.

title: Outstanding stay on the Upper West Side
text: After our recent stay at The Wallace, this hotel has become our first choice hotel destination in NYC. It's terrifically convenient to restaurants, shops, Central Park, and the subway. Our room was beautifully appointed and elegant. But what made the greatest impression was the outstanding service from the staff. Everyone we encountered--from the receptionist on the phone, to the doorman, to the front desk representative--was polite, helpful, and accommodating. Highly recommend!

title: An attractive, well run and well-located hotel!
text: I recently spent 10 nights at this hotel, together with two adult granddaughters, and can heartily recommend it!  The location is ideal , close to many nice cafes and restaurants as well as public transport and a wide variety of shops including food stores.  This is a friendly, comfortable hotel with good amenities.  Staff are well-trained ad helpful and create a welcoming friendly environment from the time of arrival onwards.  Rooms are state of the art as far as technical aids are concerned.  Beds very comfortable.  The suites include a microwave oven but it would be a good idea to add some basic cutlery and china - even disposable ones.  Keep in mind that the hotel does not have a dining-room, even for breakfast or room service, so that guests are obliged to either eat out or order food in.   A welcome plus is the music that is provided several times a week in the piano bar, sometimes together with a singer.  I would definitely choose to stay there again!

title: An UWS Jewel
text: I have always stayed in Midtown when in NYC.  On a recommendation from a friend, I chose The Wallace for my recent stay.  This will be my choice from now on.  The newly renovated hotel is a jewel.  The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and beautifully appointed. All common areas are clean and well maintained and the staff is warm and welcoming.  Uber is readily available for travel to wherever you want to go.  I highly recommend this jewel when staying in NYC.

title: Awesome abs lovely
text: Their customer service is top notched, very conducive environment where you can relax and enjoy your time without having any distractions or problems whatsoever. I had a great experience at the hotel and hopefully to come back again. Thank you

title: Wallace Reveiw
text: Clean and spacious rooms. Reasonable prices. The location was great. The staff were accommodating and pleasant. The fitness room had all the right machines. The lobby was nice as was the lounge. Nothing was on the negative side.

title: If on site parking, 5 stars
text: The Wallace was perfect for our brief stay. Staff was accommodating and friendly. Room very clean, comfortable beds, nicely appointed. Needed to park in a public garage, as they do not offer on site parking. Not a big deal but why 4 instead of 5 stars.

title: Superb
text: Excellent experience across the board. Can’t imagine a better location. Quiet, clean, very modern/contemporary design and furnishings, professional staff, great views, near many excellent restaurants, walking distance to The Met, Lincoln Center.

title: Quality Boutique Hotel
text:
The Double Queen Suite was perfect for our family of 2 adults, 1 teen. All the fixtures and fittings were of high quality and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was very well appointed and the shower pressure great.  We couldn't fault it at all. The location on the Upper West Side was ideal, a few blocks from the Natural History Museum (10 min walk) Central Park and through to the MET/Guggenheim (30 mins). It was only a short walk to the subway at 72nd Street which went direct to the centre of town. 
There are lots of lovely restaurants within walking distance too and the hotel provided a recommended list which was helpful. We would definitely return to the Wallace.

title: Modern, Clean and Upscale Hotel in Upper West Side - slight noise issue though?
text:
We loved our room it was very modern and light and a beautiful hotel to come home to at the end of a busy day around nyc. 

However, I think the walls are really thin as we experienced this really odd clanking, banging every single night (not sure if this was an employee with an early morning shift doing handy man work or if this the elevator). This slightly put me off the hotel - but the rest of the stay was really nice - it felt like a very upscale hotel and the staff were very friendly. Would highly recommend if looking to stay in the upper west side as the rooms are better than what you get in surrounding hotels.

title: We'll come back!
text: The two of us stayed for 3 nights. We appreciate the upgrade to a King suite. Very spacious, remarkably quiet, exceptionally clean. We were very impressed and are likely to re-book when we return to NYC.

title: Modern, clean and friendly hotel on the upper West Sixe
text: My family and I stayed for a week in the Wallace. We occupied two double rooms. The rooms and bathrooms are modern and very clean. We felt very comfortable. We appreciated that the fridge was refilled with complimentary water and snacks every day.  Staff was very friendly. The hotel does not offer any breakfast and the lobby bar (which has a small menu) is open Wed-Sun. However, there are plenty of restaurants and cafés in walking distance. The location on the Upper West Side was very suited for us as we were looking for a somewhat more „calm“ place. Nights were not as quiet as hoped for - but that’s obviously N.Y.. Central Park is a 7 minutes walk away, underground stations 5 minutes.

title: Wallace - Fabulous hotel and staff
text:
The hotel staff were very attentive and friendly and the rooms were fabulous and good value for money compared to other Hotels.
Very happy family, our oasis at the end of very busy days. We stayed there for 4 nights.

title: Nicely decorated room in upper west side
text: We staued three nights, arrived early morning and we were offered an early check-in and a room upgrade to a one bedroom suite. Very spacious room, We had a very nice experience at The Wallace Hotel. Would definitely recommend

title: Excellent hotel!!
text: Incredible hotel! Excellent location on UWS, superb friendly staff, clean pristine rooms with modern amenities , quiet and safe. Would stay again for sure, so many nice touches and again rooms are spotless and brand new, great housekeeping

title: Peaceful heaven in Upper West
text: After staying in crazy chaos of Penn station area, it was such a relief to enter the Wallace. The hotel is elegant and the room is very spacious. There is abundant of the storage room for your clothes, and this was the only NYC hotel that provided a set of sleepers. Staff were helpful and efficient. The metro station is 5-7mins walk but you can go down to the 42nd street station at one go - just one stop by express line. The bus is well connected to the East side and Central park is nearby. There is a big supermarket in 2 mins away which was very useful. All in all, very much enjoyable stay!

title: Home away from home
text: Exceptionally large room size for NYC. Quiet hotel in a more residential area of NYC, yet still close to everything. Staff are very friendly and the Wallace feels more like a home away from home than a hotel.

title: NYC Family Vacation
text: We stayed at The Wallace for a family trip to NYC. The location on the upper west side gave us easy access to Central Park and the museums around the area. It was also convenient to the subway and it was easy to get taxis on Broadway. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. We had an incredible time and would definitely stay again.

title: Amazing!
text: such an amazing stay. room, details, staff, cleanliness, value. all in one! espresso machine in the room. front desk and door staff were amazing. they upgraded me to a suite which was absolutely to die for. I won't be staying anywhere else when I'm in the city.

title: Bat Mitzvah Stay
text: We thought the hotel was wonderful. The room was beautifully appointed and comfortable. I appreciated the water and snacks that were provided. I would prefer a different coffee machine for regular coffee or coffee available at the property. We felt it was a great value for what we had.

title: Excellent stay
text: We stayed in a double queen suite for about a week with our seven year old daughter. Excellent stay altogether. Check-in and check-out were a breeze. The room was very spotless, nice, quite large and probably as quiet as it gets in Manhattan. Everything felt new and well maintained. Bed were very comfortable. The bathroom had very good walk in shower - and most important one that did not flood the bathroom. There was ample storage a nice wet bar and a small fridge. Housekeeping was excellent as well. Small downside is that there is no cutlery, no glasses and no plates in the room but the staff was able to provide some plastic cutlery and some glasses. There is no breakfast in the hotel, but there are places all around to eat and shop. The location is also great for public transport, the 1/2/3 72nd street station is only a five minute walk away, which makes the hotel also very accessible from the airports, in particular if you do not have much luggage. Since we stayed for six days and with three persons, we took a taxi, but even the subway would have been faster - and cheaper - for a single traveller to get to the hotel.

title: Excellent luxury on upper west side
text: New, modern hotel.  Everything worked perfectly.  Best choice for the upper west side. Lovely (lively) lobby bar. Showers/rooms were spotless and big. Would highly recommend, even at this high price point.

title: Exceeded all expectations
text: Really pleasant surprise. Got upgraded to suite. Really new rooms. Great bed. Great service. A+ experience.  Would definitely stay there again. Complementary water bottles and snacks as well as in room coffee. Suite was two rooms with two tvs.

title: Absolutely fabulous hotel
text: We stayed at The Wallace last year to celebrate my retirement and 50th birthday and chose the one bedroom queen suite , as we had 2 teenagers with us.  It was very roomy, my daughter chose to sleep on the sofa in the living room as it was so comfortable.  All of the hotel was absolutely spotless, staff were extremely knowledgeable, especially Justin , who I was in email contact with prior to our arrival, regarding dinner reservations etc. It is in a residential area, which we preferred as there was hardly any traffic noise and you are close to supermarkets and restaurants and Central Park is a 5 minute walk away.  The Lounge wasn’t open during our stay so I can’t comment.  I couldn’t find any fault with the hotel at all, it was excellent from start to finish.  So much better than returning to The Plaza Hotel  (where we married 19 years ago) for one night at the end of our stay .  Save your money and stay at The Wallace instead.  Can’t wait to return

title: Great stay
text: Beautiful hotel ! Rooms are brand new and modern and classy ! Can’t wait to go back . The lounge is open and that is great too!  I usually stay at the same place every time I visit NYC but now I stick with the Wallace. The staff is extremely accommodating and very friendly !

title: Great hotel and location with beautiful rooms!
text: I stayed here Mother's Day Weekend in a double queen suite. The room was large, beautiful and very clean. The staff is so friendly and helpful. We had two kids with us otherwise we would have taken advantage of The Wallace Lounge, which had live music.

title: Wallace
text:
The Wallace is quiet, clean and the staff is always friendly and helpful.
Great location. Close to shops, restaurants, subway, and Central Park.
Being walkers, we can access everything we need from the Wallace.

title: Upscale hotel
text: Very nice hotel near Lincoln Center and convenient to the subway (near 72nd street station for the 1, 2 , 3).  We were in a king suite which gave us a living room in which to entertain a few guests, all of whom were in town for a graduation up town.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The room felt brand new and was nicely furnished.  The bed was very comfortable.  Only one small complaint - I wish there had been a few plates, glasses and silverware in the small kitchen.

title: Excellent Upper West Side Boutique Hotel
text: Went there for a weekend wedding. Room was very clean and well appointed- no view though. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Close to Central Park. No food service on property, but lots of restaurants and cafes nearby.

title: Expensive but good value for money in NYC.
text:
In May 2023 we stayed 5 nights at the Wallace in a Junior Suite, which is not really a Suite but a spacious room (with wooden floor). The hotel is located in the Upper West side, a very nice and lively area, at walking distance from Central Park. The hotel is expensive but gives good value for your money in NYC. 
Staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful. The room itself has airconditioning, a small refrigerator (with complimentary water) and a Nespresso coffee machine. To our pleasant surprise, the windows can be opened to get fresh air in the room (although most of the time unfortunately you need to keep it closed due to the noise of airplanes and helicopters). The bed is very good, the shower good (once you find out how to manage the temperature) and the lighting is also very good, although it took us 2 days to find out how all switches work. 
The bathroom is small but functional and has excellent lighting. 
The tv has a Chromecast which means you can stream (eg. Netflix, You Tube etc etc) from your smartphone or tablet to the tv. 
The room also has a safe, an iron and ironing board and the hotel has a gym at the 2nd floor.

title: Wallace Hotel perfect NYC location
text: My 5 day stay at the Wallace in NYC was excellent from beginning to end.  The hotel's priximity to the park and my family made it the perfect choice.  Service was friendly and good.  Mini-bars could be stocked better. I will stay there again for sure!

title: Anniversary overnight
text:
Stayed at the Wallace for our 31st anniversary, had dinner and went to a show at the Beacon Theater.
Picked the Wallace based on reviews and was not disappointed. Johnathan at the front desk gave us a free upgrade to a room with an outdoor terrace...really cool! We had a great stay!

title: Très bel établissement
text: grande chambre (suite au 8ème étage), literie de qualité, propreté parfaite, cafetière expresso,grande salle de bains, chambre faite tous les jours, quartier très calme, à 7 mn à pieds de la ligne 1 du métro, seul point négatif, l'absence de petit déjeuner

title: Great stay in Upper West Side
text:
The hotel is located in the Upper West Side which has a less touristy feel. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Central Park and the Hudson River. The subway is only 5 minutes away which makes access to the sights very easy. We had a lovely, modern, spacious room on the top floor with a partial view of the Hudson River. All staff were friendly and welcoming. We had drinks in the bar on a couple of nights where there was often live entertainment. Warning! - It does get busy on Friday/Saturday nights so may be worth booking a seat on these nights, however the hotel did make sure we got a seat. 
Overall, we felt we made a really great choice of hotel for our trip. It definitely lived up to its reviews.

title: Great place - would highly recommend
text:
A fab hotel, way exceeded expectations. My room looked newly refurbished. Fresh, bright and v clean. Nice decor, love the electric blackout blinds. Spacious for NYC. BIG shower. Friendly front desk staff. 
Yes it’s not super central but Times Sq is easy walking distance. I loved the quieter location. Thank you.

title: Great Staff & Lovely Stay
text:
My daughter and I stayed here for a mother-daughter trip and really enjoyed our stay! The staff were fantastic, friendly and warm and the decor was elegant and upscale without feeling pretentious. 

Room was large, well ventilated, comfortable beds and well appointed. Great room system with curtains and lights changeable at the push of a button. 

The one drawback was the lack of a full restaurant/room service but it appears that one may open on the future. For this stay, we made do with Door Dash as needed. 

Lastly the neighborhood in the UWS is fantastic; more low key than the rest of the City, close to Central Park and the Natura History Museum, and great for a family vacation. 

We will definitely be back!

title: Wonderful stay at the Wallace!
text: We spent a weekend at this hidden gem on the Upper West Side.  Room was spacious, quiet and beautiful.  We booked the one with the two queen beds and separate sitting room.  It was wonderful to have separate spaces and so much room!  Area around the hotel is fun with lots of restaurants and shops.  Would highly recommend!

title: Ideal Stay
text: The Wallace was perfect in many ways. Location, staff, the amenities in the room were excellent. The bar in the evening with music and perfectly crafted cocktails was a wonderful finish for our day. The greeting at the front door and the welcoming scent of the lobby added to the experience. We will return this Summer for another stay.

title: Perfect location, lovely hotel
text: The Wallace was the perfect luxury hotel for our first trip to NYC. Quiet rooms, lovely staff, excellent location near Central Park, restaurants, the subway, and grocery stores. Highly recommend if you’re looking for a place to stay on the UWS.

title: An Upper West Side gem
text: This boutique hotel combines wonderful and attentive staff with state-of-the-art rooms,  The location in a wonderful residential neighborhood gives visitors a sense of belonging as they shop at the Fairway or Zabar's.  Excellent restaurants are in abundance.

title: The Wallace is a gem!
text: The Wallace Hotel has become my NYC hideaway. The lounge downstairs has live music on weekends, and the rooms are so dreamy and quiet! I always sleep well here. Love the staff. Everyone is personable and friendly.

title: The best hotel on the upper west
text:
Its hard finding a hotel this comfortable & luxurious in NYC at a reasonable price.

The wallace feels brand new, with well sized rooms (a rarity in NY). Friendly and attentive staff. Boutique sized hotel so it’s quiet and relaxed. 

Will return.

title: Convenient Location on West Side
text: I chose this property based on its location on the West Side, within walking distance or one subway stop of LIncoln Center.  The junior suite I chose was pricey, but immaculately clean and the modern fixtures were all in working order (one button touch to turn off all fixtures; raising shades, etc.).  Complimentary wi-fi, water, and snacks.  The piano bar on the ground floor looked to be very popular but I did not have a chance/time to enjoy it.

title: Book it!
text: This hotel is wonderful. The location is perfect, the employees top notch and the rooms so comfy and clean. Traveled with a friend and we had a wonderful stay. The lounge was great too! Live music and delicious drinks. Book it you won’t be sorry!

title: Easy trip
text: The friendly staff is the best part of the experience. The hotel is lovely as are the rooms. Overall we enjoyed a fine experience made better by the welcoming staff. Make reservations for the hotel lobby bar if you’re planning on a nightcap. We did not and were seated  in uncomfortable situations while much more comfortable tables and seats remained empty and available.

title: Very good hotel for a city trip
text: We had booked a queen size suite and received a free upgrade upon arrival.  The hotel is located on a quiet street and is nevertheless very well connected to the public transport network.  You can also walk to Central Park or the Hudson River.  Especially worth mentioning is the friendliness of all the employees in the hotel, the quiet location in the middle of western uptown Manhattan and the cleanliness.

title: Fresh and friendly on the upper west side
text: We've stayed twice, everything feels brand new and premium. The beds are wonderfully comfortable, and the staff are incredibly accommodating.  The newly opened lounge is a perfect spot to unwind in comfort. This is our favorite place to stay across the USA.

title: Very friendly and comfortable NYC hotel
text: From the moment you get there, the staff makes you feel very welcome.  They make everything so easy- such a refreshing change from the chain hotels.  They recently opened the lounge downstairs that looks great.  Rooms are very nice for the price.  Location is fantastic!

title: The Wallace - a great place to stay
text: Everything about The Wallace was great. The location and the staff and the room were super. I highly recommend to anybody that is looking for accommodations while visiting NYC, definitely a thumbs up!

title: Wonderful stay at The Wallace
text: The Wallace hotel is located in a nice environment. A few minutes from Central Park. Very close to the Beacon Theater (which was the main reason for us to choose this hotel). The minute you step in, you can feel that the everyone will try their best to make your stay a memorable one. The service is personalized. The rooms are beautiful. The bed comfortable. The whole hotel is spotless. I would come back anytime.

title: Excelente experiencia
text: Nos quedamos 5 noches en The Wallace. Excelente experiencia. El cuarto muy completo, todos los dias nos rellenaban las capsulas de nespresso y las aguas. Limpieza 100. El personal siempre muy atento y el barrio muy bonito.

title: What a great hotel!!!
text:
What a perfect hotel located in the UWS!   I came up to see Bono perform his show at the Beacon and The Wallace was located only a block and a half away.  The hotel is in family friendly neighborhood within walking distance to Central Park and a quick subway ride to Time Square.   Lots of restaurants nearby.  

The room was modern and clean with a smallish balcony that had I had more time, a bottle of white wine and a book would have been a perfect way to spend a Sunday afternoon!  The staff are all so friendly, with special mention to the gentlemen at the front desk who were patient with me when I couldn’t figure out the elevators initially.   

Overall, highly highly recommend The Wallace if you are coming to NYC.

title: Top notch
text: There was nothing that could have been done better during our stay at this hotel. Friendliness in NYC is very rare, and the staff here are a welcome exception.  We were upgraded to a suite without requesting one, the front desk staff were as nice as can be, the doormen, fabulous. Best hotel in the city, hands down.

title: Family Holiday
text: We loved this hotel. We stayed for ten nights in a One Bedroom Double Queen Suite which was perfect for our family of four. There was lots of space and the room was spotlessly clean. The shower was amazing, and the room as a whole felt like our own apartment. All the staff were friendly and helpful and we found the location to be perfect - we used the subway to get around but it was always great to be back on the UWS after a day exploring.

title: Great Spring Break
text:
We stayed in the 2 queen suite at the Wallace. Everything about the stay was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful even before our arrival when they emailed restaurant suggestions we requested. From housekeeping to the front desk and door person everyone was friendly and helpful. The room was larger and more comfortable than were expected, a pleasant surprise. Location was great for a family with children as it is just a few blocks from Central Park and the museums. 

Definitely recommend for families looking for a little more space and value.

title: Off the charts
text: Staff was amazing and detail oriented. Hotel is beautiful with large rooms (for NYC)that are super clean and have hypoallergenic bedding and no carpeting which was great for my sons. Definitely returning

title: Conveniently located; Morden and  luxurious
text: The Wallace hotel is conveniently located in Manhattan. In my opinion it is strategically located within a reasonable distance to The Empire State building, Times Square and A host of restaurants. The hotel was modern, clean, and the accommodations were immaculate. The property is well-kept and the staff is quite friendly. There is no on-site dining, but there are plenty of restaurant options within walking distance. A quirky bonus for me was that there was a Starbucks across the street for my morning cup of Joe. When we go back to New York, this hotel will be on the top of our consideration list. I’m not sure about the views from the different angles of the hotel but, the clean and new feeling of the hotel room was a refreshing joy to come back to each night. The shower has two showerheads one regular and the other coming from the ceiling which offered very good pressure.

title: I always stay at The Wallace if I can
text: I do a lot of business in New York, and my preference is for the UWS, as it provides me with access to my meetings as well as great restaurants and shops if I need anything. The hotel is located near subway stops and it's easy to get anywhere in Manhattan. I like the friendly staff, the doormen are very helpful. As a woman traveling in the city alone on business, it is nice to see you are recognized when you come and go. The rooms are clean and very well stocked with everything I need. Wifi is easy to access and reliable. Housekeeping is prompt and the room is cleaned daily, which is something I very much value as many hotels have cut back on this service.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Hotel is located on a quiet street but is only a couple blocks from lots of restaurants and stores. The lobby and rooms are very well decorated and comfortable. I only gave 4 stars because of the amount of light that comes in through the windows. A hotel of this caliber should really have better blackout. The room was in full daylight as soon as the sun came out.

title: A beautiful surprise
text: The Wallace is in a relatively quiet location ... away from the noise and chaos of midtown, but easily walkable from there.  The staff was gracious and welcoming and our suite was beautiful and spacious. Our new favorite hotel!

title: New York family trip
text: Fantastic experience it was such a lovely hotel and everyone so nice the rooms were great spacious and very comfortable . The staff were all friendly and eager to help and offer advice would return anytime

title: Exceptional Experience
text: From the moment you walk in you are met with a beautiful entry and an incredible staff!  The entire team at the Wallace goes above to provide it's guest with the ultimate experience.  We cannot wait to make this our go to home in NYC!

title: Wallace a Winner
text: A beautifully appointed room, with very thoughtful touches (a couple of free snacks, and a Nespresso machine, and electronic shades).  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Extremely slow elevator and no real room service.. And quite pricey.  But really the best hotel on the UWS.

title: The Wallace is Exceptional
text: Newly remodeled with an amazing staff from friendly and accommodating front desk to smiling and helpful doormen. Bar area with live music on first floor. Three blocks from Central Park; two blocks from Riverside. Quieter location. Nice amenities in room. Highly recommend.

title: 10 👌🏻
text:
El hotel estuvo a la altura de todas mis espectativas. Es bastante nuevo.
El diseño es hermoso, la cama perfecta, limpieza impecable y la ubicación la ame ya que la zona es elegante y tranquila. 
Sin dudas volvería y lo recomendaría

title: Good location, friendly staff
text: Found this hotel searching for one near a friend's house. The first I noticed was that the staff was very friendly, second that the rooms look fresh and of recent remodeled. an issue with the bathroom was quickly resolved. Good value for the money, specially with today's NYC cost of living and going out.

title: Great staff, room, location.
text: Excellent stay at The Wallace. You cannot beat the location of you want or need to be uptown, the rooms and staff were fantastic. Very clean hotel and area of the city. Will be back. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Comfy bed and pillows
text: This small hotel is very quaint. Perhaps the walls are thin but we heard when someone beside us (or above) was taking a shower. But the bed and pillows were so comfortable - I had my best sleep. And for that I would return. (We were disappointed that there was no restaurant but there is complimentary coffee and tea in the room and the fridge is supplied with two bottles of water and a bar, which was helpful.)

title: Fabulous!
text: Fabulous find!  Great Location--near the Lincoln Center and very good restaurants! Beautifully appointed!  Immaculately clean!  Attentive, welcoming staff.  A great experience! To all of you at The Wallace--thank you!

title: What a gem on the upper West side.
text: The Wallace is a real gem. The rooms are so spacious and beautifully appointed. The location is wonderful. We were within steps of everything we needed. And the price was well within budgets.  The spaciousness of the suites can’t be beat.

title: Fabulous place to stay on the upper west side
text: The Wallace is a beautiful hotel! The rooms are spacious and well-equipped. The staff is friendly and helpful. The Piano Bar is a great place to visit in the evening. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is very comfortable and brand new!

title: A New York Hidden gem
text:
This was our first time staying at The Wallace and we will certainly be back.  The room was fabulous and all of the staff were great, really made us feel welcome. A trip to the Wallace Lounge is a must.
This is a great hotel in an amazing neighbourhood, for those looking for something different in a NY trip than the usual tourist trap.

title: Great Hotel
text: I loved everything about this hotel. The staff was fantastic, the room was clean and new and modern. I loved the bar/coffee area. The location is great. I'd definitely stay again! I lived in NYC for 25 years and this hotel made my return great!

title: Great choice for Upper West Side
text: Fabulous stay - great location. Easy in and out.  The staff was super friendly and accommodating as we needed a late checkout.   The price was reasonable for this area so we will definitely be staying there again!

title: Excellent stay for our anniversary
text:
Our stay was amazing!  We arrived about mid morning the day of our check in and hoped to just leave our bags at the front desk but they already had our room ready. The staff was very accommodating and took care of all the details including snacks in your room the day of check-in. There was a Nespresso machine with cream and sugar in the room and they refilled it every day.  They also had water bottles every day in the mini Fridge. 
Lobby bar was super cool.  The area was great, close to markets, restaurants, bars, and walking distance to Central Park. We checked out Dead Poets Bar, Levain Bakery, Magnolia Bakery, Bagels & Co, Made in New York Pizza, and others. Definitely recommend staying at the Wallace.  This was the perfect place to celebrate our anniversary.

title: Super aber zu teuer...
text:
Es ist ein relativ neues Hotel und super Lage (Upper Westside, U-Bahn 1 in 5 Minuten zu Fuß erreichbar).da
Wir hatten ein Superior Zimmer und das war für NY Verhältnisse echt groß, extrem angenehm.
Ansonsten gibt es nicht viel zum Hotel zu sagen, weil es ja kein Frühstück oder etwaiges dabei hat. Leider auch keine Hotelbar, wo man vielleicht nach einem Sightseeing-Tag noch einen Absacker nehmen könnte.

title: Superb stay in The Wallace
text: The Wallace hotel has it all - excellent service, spacious elegant rooms, cozy boutique design, and excellent location in NYC - Manhattan. My wife and I loved our 2-night stay at The Wallace hotel. Natural courteous, kind staff and quality service was wonderful to experience. Thank you! This hotel is becoming our favorite for NYC - Manhattan visits, for sure.

title: Beautiful UWS boutique stay
text: Everything I was looking for and more in an upscale yet still reasonably priced hotel on the UWS — which is very, very difficult to find since there aren’t that many hotels in this part of the city in the first place.

title: Exceptionally Clean, Comfortable, and Quiet
text: Never disappoints! The entire hotel is spotlessly clean and beautifully appointed. Every staff member is friendly, kind, and helpful. I love the residential location because it's quiet and everything (including the subway) is within easy walking distance. Always my first choice when visiting the city!

title: Great location and better accommodations and staff
text: I can't say enough about The Wallace. It is a great value and the staff couldn't be more helpful and authentic. The location is great, and the room we had was quiet. The king suite is very spacious. Loved the Nespresso machine!

title: Amazing stay!
text: Our stay at the Wallace was top notch! The staff was so friendly and helpful and the hotel was beautiful! It was the perfect location for a show at the Beacon theater-highly recommend staying here! We will be back!!!

title: A great find
text: We so enjoyed our stay in this smaller hotel. Attention to detail with all the amenities in our room, which was spacious. The part I loved the most was how quiet it was. The hotel staff has been lovely. The location is perfect for exploring Central Park, walking to shows, and shopping.

title: Exceeded my expectations.
text: Everything about The Wallace exceeded my expectations.  The staff was friendly, helpful, and courteous.  The room was clean, modern, and roomy.  The location was perfect for my needs.  I have already recommended it to several friends.

title: Lovely Stay at The Wallace
text: The Wallace felt like a bit of luxury in the middle of Manhattan. Great location and had a delicious dirty martini in the lounge. Lovely to be upgraded to a suite. Allowed me to both work and relax in the space with ease. Will definitely return!

title: Best New Hotel on the Upper West Side
text: I've now stayed at the Wallace more than 10 times since it opened.  The rooms are new and great.  The staff if super friendly and helpful and the location if very convenient to transportation, restaurants, etc.  The Wallace is my favorite place to stay in NYC.

title: Perfect
text: I spent 6 perfect nights. Room was clean, well equipped and location is nice, calm and lots of restaurants around. Personnel is very kind. Subway 1 is 5 minutes from the hotel. Everything was fabulous.

title: Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location
text: The Wallace has fully updated rooms that are kept sparkling clean. Comfy mattress and good pillows. The staff is helpful and friendly. The location can’t be beat. Lots of restaurants nearby, an easy walk to Lincoln Center, and steps from Central Park. It is in the city, so if you’re not used to city noises you’ll want ear plugs for sleeping, but that’s going to be the case anywhere in Manhattan!

title: Birthday Getaway
text: I would like to express my sincere gratitude for the hospitality provided by Emar during our stay! It was my husbands 40th birthday and he was able to get us dinner reservations at his favorite Thai restaurant. He also made amazing recommendations for breakfast the following morning. Emar made our stay very special and pays attention to detail! He was so warm and friendly, I wish more people were like him in the industry. I will be definitely recommending this location to family and friends. Thank you so much for making our stay memorable and easy.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
Choosing the Wallace for your stay in NYC is a ''well-being'' warranty. All is perfect, from its Staff to the nice and clean rooms and its location int the Upper West side, close to every means of transport.
We recommend it !!!

title: Girls Weekend in the City
text: Great rooms and great location! We got a free upgrade to a suite, which was amazing for our weekend away. Great location and convenient to everything. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean, the bathroom was really nice with marble tile and a really nice shower. We will be back again for sure!

title: Great short stay
text: A great location with a new piano bar; a hidden gem on the Upper WS. Convenient location form my sons' apartment. Newly upgraded and super comfortable. Will be back to stay at this very comfortable 4-star hotel

title: New York Visit
text: Excellent value; helpful staff. No onsite restaurant, but the desk offers an extensive list of places to go in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. The rooms are very high tech, as are the bathrooms. Enjoy!

title: Great stay in a great neighborhood
text:
I liked everything about The Wallace. It’s low-key but still high end. I prefer the more residential experience that the Wallace offers, and the UWS can’t be beat. The room was comfortable, spotlessly clean, and had everything I needed—although I would have loved a rug to absorb some of the sound. 

I am in New York frequently and have never found quite the right hotel but I am happy to say the Wallace is it. Unfortunately when I tried to book my next stay for April, it looks like management has decided to increase prices accordingly, so I didn’t book again.

title: Super comfortable hotel on the UWS
text: Stayed with the family, including our 1 year old grandson in a double queen bed suite. Everything was super comfortable and we immediately felt at home. The rooms were immaculate, beds were great, service was wonderful and location perfect for our needs (visiting our daughter on the UWS). If we can afford it, would be delighted to stay here again and again in the future.

title: Small and elegant neighborhood hotel
text:
I stayed here for a second time with my husband and dog for a night. 
The location is great, and it’s one of the better upper west side options. 
Staff is very friendly, and they welcomed our dog, though did charge an additional pet fee. 
Rooms are relatively small, and both rooms I’ve stayed in have lacked views, but they’re thoughtfully designed and appointed. 
The property is a renovated pre war apartment building and maintains that charm. 
I would recommend it if you’re looking to stay on the UWS and get a more authentic local experience.

title: First Stay at the Wallace
text: Staff were consistently welcoming and friendly.  The common rooms and bedrooms were lovely.  Beds were comfy - rooms could use rugs to buffer noise from hallway.  Freebie snacks/water provided.  Convenient location for shopping, dining ("Red Farm" is my favorite) walking in Central Park and museum hopping!

title: Best of the Upper West
text: Lovely hotel with an exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are newly renovated including the bathroom and with tasteful decor. Location is excellent as subway and buses close. Nice neighborhood with lots of restaurants. We had a room with a large patio overlooking the river. Lobby bar had just opened and we enjoyed the pianist and the helpful bar staff.  This is a high class option for the upper west side.Delightful stay all around.

title: UWS Gem!
text: Great hotel! Fantastic location within walking distance to Central Park, modern and well-appointed rooms, clean, beautiful lobby, friendly staff.  Still seems like brand new.  Excellent restaurants close by, too.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: I needed to stay in the city for work and my husband and I decided to have a date night.  The Wallace has a great location, modern spotless rooms with thoughtful features and amenities, and lovely, warm and welcoming staff. Will definitely be staying here again!

title: Great visit
text: Incredible experience at the Wallace. Very nice place, with a great staff. We are Southerner’s, from Ga, and they made us feel right at home. I’ll definitely go back. The rooms were great, clean, and the lobby area is beautiful. The Wallace is situated in a great spot for seeing the sights.

title: Anniversary in NYC
text:
This was a truly lovely experience.  We enjoyed the neighbourhood. The hotel was fresh but what made it great was the friendliness of the staff.
I’ve stayed in several up scale hotels on Manhattan but this experience was special.

title: Wonderful hotel, amazing staff, small room
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were well appointed, the staff was incredibly friendly, and we liked the location (away from the hustle and bustle, near Central Park and museums). 

The only disappointment was the room size. We had a two queen room, and it was uncomfortably small for a family of four. Another couple we were traveling with were upgraded to a larger room by the staff at no cost, and had we had the same experience, our stay would have been ideal, but unfortunately the cramped space made it difficult to unwind because we had to use every square inch of space just to unpack. I realize hotel rooms are not always spacious in NY (we’ve visited several times), but this room for four was simply too small to be comfortable in. It felt like we were on top of each other at all times we were in the room and it made what would have been a five-star experience a four-star experience.

I can’t say enough about how wonderful the staff was, though. Every one was friendly, helpful, and provided a personal touch. Truly great. 

Overall, the hotel is great. Just make sure you get a big enough room to be able to fully enjoy how nice the hotel is.

title: Great hotel in a beautiful neighborhood!
text: Friendly staff. Beautiful rooms.  Upper west side location quieter than other NYC neighborhoods I’ve endured. Close to many good restaurants and stores. Near subway station. Just opened a first floor cocktail area for an evening drink. Highly recommend!

title: A Must Stay Hotel!
text:
We had a wonderful stay. Your hotel is beautiful, the rooms are appointed with every detail and every staff person we interacted with were incredible! 
If you are headed to the upper west side, I would highly recommend The Wallace.

title: Wonderful stay in Manhattan
text:
Great hotel. The rooms are large and beautiful. Clean and modern. For NYC this was quite impressive. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The location is perfect. 
It was suite noisy unfortunately. I was on the ground floor and probably near the stairwell or some other hight access door so it was difficult to sleep past 5 am. We could also hear everything next door. 
Also the parking garage they recommended had no spots so finding a garage took forever at night on the UWS. 
But I would still stay here again and again.

title: Loved our stay!
text: Great hotel! Staff is super friendly and always willing to help you out. Location and neighbourhood is perfect, lots of breakfast places nearby, close to the metro and Central Park. Rooms are clean and pretty. They left a bottle of prosecco in our room for our anniversary. Very thoughtful! Loved every minute here!

title: Fantastic gem in UWS
text: Wonderful stay at this boutique hotel. Great/warm staff that anticipated our needs, lovely decor both in the common areas & the room, and much attention to detail. Convenient to subway and Central Park. Highly recommend!

title: Noise level is unacceptable
text: While a very clean and friendly hotel, the room doors let in all hallway noise. Every click of an opening door, every conversation. A loud party on the hallway kept everyone up all night and security did nothing but chat loudly in the hallway with the partiers. It's too bad because otherwise the hotel is solid. I would not return.

title: Beautiful hotel on the UWS
text: 3rd stay at this hotel that feels like coming home to a quiet apartment.  Great location 4 blocks from the subway, staff helpful( shout out to Betty at check in).  Thanks for the great upgrade.  Will definitely be back

title: Elegant and Comfortable
text: This new elegant hotel will surely be my new spot for frequent work trips to NYC. It's a perfect location on the Upper West Side, staff was wonderful. The room was well equipped and very comfortable too.

title: Date night
text:
Deluxe King size suite is beautiful and perfect for a romantic night with my wife. 
Affordable, 24 hour parking is one block away in a safe neighborhood. 
Parking and the hotel are a one block walk from the Beacon Theater. We have already booked the Penthouse suite for another night in June.

title: Great place to stay
text: This hotel is a beautiful find in NYC.  The rooms are very nicely appointed and in great condition.  The staff were all super friendly and helpful.  There is a nicely appointed lounge and live music on occasion.

title: Fantastic stay on upper west side
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Wallace. Wonderful neighborhood. Fantastic Hotel. Great value on off season. Staff was very friendly, room was spotless, housecleaning was fantastic, shower was awesome!!! Very quiet and I loved the location. Close to coffee shops, restaurants & transportation etc!

title: Perfect hotel!
text: The Wallace is beautiful ! The rooms are beautiful ! I had a wonderful stay. This was my first time staying here , I enjoyed the rooms so much that I cancelled my next reservation at a different hotel and rebooked at the Wallace !

title: The best new hotel in town, says me, a long time NYC resident
text: Absolutely the hotel find of 2022. We started using The Wallace last year because we are in NYC almost every month and wanted to stay on the UWS, where we used to live. This is one of those reviews where the writer, me, debates should I give away the secret? But I want them to keep succeeding because I want to keep staying there. Great staff. Very nice and new rooms. Good beds! We both have bad backs - we are super picky on this. Nice bathrooms that are also large by NYC standards. We have stayed in the king 1 bedroom (my favorite), the king suite, the queen 1 bedroom and the queen suite. They are all good. I even stayed in a basic room last time when there alone and it was perfectly nice. Love that they have a nespresso machine (I bring some of my own pods) and a small fridge that actually works. The location can not be beat. Right on the 1-2-3 line, next door to Citarella and Fairway, and tons of restaurants over on Amsterdam. I think they are now opening a small bar in the lobby. It is a cozy space and I am looking forward to that. Keep it up, Wallace!

title: Great stay from start to finish
text: I visited the Wallace with my family, and then stayed in NYC two more days on business. Hotel is clean, well kept, rooms are brand new/renovated, and service was excellent. We had a few requests which were all accommodated quickly and with a smile. Definitely will come back!

title: Amazing!!
text: Exceptional across the board: service, rooms, beds, design, location, cost. It was our first stay and we will definitely be back. The bar downstairs didn’t open yet (apparently opens next week!) but I’m sure it will just add this experience. Nothing to critique as every aspect was as expected, or better.

title: New, crisp details, beautiful
text: Great staff, super clean rooms, convenient technology in rooms and slept like a baby in the comfy cocoon of a room. It’ll be a true home run once the lounge opens. The Wallace is our new favorite place to stay in NYC!

title: Chic Elegance with a Warm and Personal Touch
text: The Wallace continues to exceed our expectations.  It has become our go-to place to stay when in Manhattan.  While the location is phenomenal, the chic decor and comfort is outdone only by the very warm and hospitable staff.  Small touches like a Peloton bike (or two) in the gym and staff greeting you by name have made The Wallace an absolute gem for by business and leisure travel.  The recent remodel of the hotel is stunning and clearly did not overlook even the smallest of details.   I recently had the pleasure of riding the elevator one morning with the general manager, Vic, who was abundantly kind and seemed to take quite a liking to my four legged travel partner.  It's clear that his graciousness and hospitality is instilled in others at the hotel and make The Wallace the only place I will stay in Manhattan.

title: Perfect Stay
text:
This UWS boutique hotel offered good rates in January, so I could not resist booking a King Superior room (accessible) for five nights as part of my solo 80th birthday celebration in NYC. Close to my departure date, I invited a lifelong friend with the same milestone birthday (we were born three weeks apart in the same town)  to join me for four of the nights.. I was extremely pleased with the lodging. The spacious, modern, 4th-floor room offered a really comfortable bed, plenty of storage space, a good-size safe, big-screen TV, quick and reliable wi-fi, a small refrigerator, two free bottles of water daily, a Nespresso machine and bath robes and slippers. The one small drawback to the bathroom for us was that it lacked the space we needed to conveniently place personal items and had no hooks to hang clothing items when enjoying the huge walk-in shower. Housekeeping kept the room immaculate. We experienced no noise issues whatsoever.

The staff was beyond gracious, from the doormen to those, who worked at the main desk, to Housekeeping employees. Everyone proved to be genuinely friendly and helpful, beyond what would be expected. Kudos to those responsible for  hiring. In communicating with the hotel before arrival, I mentioned our joint birthday celebration, and a bottle of wine greeted us when we entered the room. It was totally unexpected and a really nice touch. 

The lobby, complete with fireplace, is charming and a pleasant place to sit. A bar is just being completed off the lobby and should be a welcome addition. There is no restaurant but plenty of cafes, grocery stores and restaurants exist in the neighborhood. Before coming, I asked the hotel about recommended places to eat closeby and immediately received two pages of suggestions, broken down into types of cuisine. 

We made a reservation the first night at the nearby well-reviewed Sushi Yasaka, which I can highly recommend for those, who enjoy Japanese fare. It is a small restaurant, with tables spaced closely together. We also enjoyed Red Farm, a Chinese restaurant about a 1-minute walk from the hotel; and I had a lovely solo dinner at Elea (Greek cuisine), also within walking distance.

The Wallace sits in a pleasant, fairly quiet area, I found it easy to walk to such destinations as Central Park, the Guggenheim,  the Metropolitan Museum of Art and Lincoln Center. Two subway stations (72nd Street and 79th Street) provide easy access to other parts of the city.

Throughout the years, I have often visited NYC and stayed in many different hotels. The Wallace is now my No. 1 choice, and I look forward to returning.

title: Love love love
text: Our stay was perfect from check-in to check-out. The staff was so friendly and helpful and everything was spotless! We traveled with children and the staff were very sweet with them. We would recommend the Wallace to everyone.

title: NYC at it's best
text: The staff was friendly and helpful.  The rooms was beyond our expectations and a great quiet night sleep.  Best of all, this is right next to Broadway and and Amsterdam where there were so many wonderful places to eat and drink just a few minutes walking.  Highly recommend.

title: Clean and Lovely
text: I come to NYC 1x a month for work and this is my favorite hotel. Staff is welcoming, rooms and lovely and most importantly very clean. It is the one hotel I would return to without question. The Wallace is a quiet gem!

title: The Wallace
text: Great suite, wonderful neighborhood. Extra friendly staff!  Helpful, clean, and nice products in the room and thank you for making us feel at home.. great shower and linens and very clean, good lighting.

title: Great place
text: I loved my stay! It was perfect and easy access to everything and everywhere I needed to be. The rooms were nicely appointed and very comfortable! I would absolutely return on my next trip to the city.

title: Wonderful hotel!
