text: Wonderful property. Exceptionally clean and well appointed room. The lobby and lounge are comfortable and inviting. We went to the Met Opera and found this excellent hotel to be close enough to the Met and our restaurant. Breakfast the next morning across the street at LPQ. A perfect stay!

title: Fantastic hotel - great location
text: The Wallace Hotel is the perfect choice for a boutique property! Rooms are well appointed, clean, modern and airy. Staff are excellent! Lobby bar isn’t open yet since the hotel is new, but overall we were very impressed with the property

title: Excellent accommodations!
text: Spacious, quiet and clean.  Convenient location with nice shopping nearby.  Daily service was well done and staff was friendly and professional.  Transportation arranged to airport was early and impeccable.  Looking forward to the bar!

title: Really enjoyable weekend sray
text: my husband and i stayed there along w my side of the family for a bat mitzvah.  everything was great! there is a nice breakfast/lunch  place right across street w grab and go or sit down options. Amazing value and really nice lobby, room and gym.  My only wish is bar had been open on Saturday and the weekend nights. I think it will open soon.

title: Excellent
text: It is a modern hotel, with an excellent location and in excellent condition.  The hotel staff was very friendly.  I was staying with my family for three days and it was very pleasant to know this hotel, the attention, the cleanliness, the location, they make it highly recommended

title: Amazing location especially for families, great staff, great sized room especially for NYC.
text: Amazing location especially if you’re traveling with young kids. Lots to do eat and see, staff were very kind. Our room was a great size especially for NYC. Quite annoying there are no USB outlets on one side of the bed, luckily we brought our own solution for that.

title: Classy beautiful hotel
text: We stayed at The Wallace on our trip to NYC. It was a classy, beautiful hotel. Upscale and spotless. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was gorgeous. We had a king suite and it was decorated so pretty. Nearby, there were tons of restaurants. I will be returning to this hotel next time I'm back.

title: Fun times at The Wallace Hotel
text: The Wallace is a great hotel. Wonderful, friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are lovely and modern. Beautiful bathroom. Great location on the Upper West Side. Lots of things to do nearby. Central Park, as well as museums, great restaurants and lots of good grocery stores. Close to subway and plenty of taxis. Watch out for the crazy bicyclists in the bike lanes!

title: Excellent—if you don’t have a car to park.
text: This is a beautifully appointed hotel, with lovely, elegant rooms and bathrooms, and the staff is also excellent: friendly, efficient and courteous.  The one problem we had was with parking our car, where the arrangements were not quite as easy as implied.  Otherwise an excellent stay.

title: great for a quick weekend trip
text: the room felt recently renovated, and more roomy than is typical for a new york hotel room. the hotel amenities are "no-frills" (no restaurant onsite), but it's on the upper west side, so there are no shortage of restaurants & coffee shops right on its doorstep.  great location for museum of natural history and central park.

title: Best UWS hotel by far
text: New, immaculately clean, great technology, large rooms, good value, great UWS location! Lobby was dead - could use some life there - but otherwise zero complaints.   My new go-to place when staying in the city.

title: Loved!
text: I hate staying at hotels because I’m a drop germaphobic, but our room was spotless. I really appreciate that there wasn't any carpeting, making it feel a notch cleaner than most hotels. The decor and lobby are well styled, comfortable and welcoming. Definitely has the boutique hotel feel we were going for without having to spend a fortune. We used the gym, which was also clean, modern, and tidy. The staff is super friendly and not uptight. The area is gorgeous and a walk or short subway/Uber ride away from any activity or site we needed. We spent down time on our trip walking around the area, which is a few minute walk from Central Park and Lincoln center. For kosher travelers, it’s around the corner from patis bakery to grab a quick breakfast or lunch on the go. We can’t wait to go back and this is def our go-to spot to stay when we are in NYC.

title: Very nice rooms
text: We had a really nice 3-night stay at the Wallace.  The room we stayed in (1 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds) was a really nice size for our family of 2 adults and 2 teens, and the beds were very comfortable.  The room also had some nice technological bells and whistles like the bedside buttons for the blackout shades and lights, as well as the ability to chromecast to the TV wirelessly from your phone.  We have stayed in about six or seven hotels in the Upper West Side, and the Wallace probably ranks either first or second for me.  The only thing it lacks right now is some sort of breakfast within the hotel, but I understand there is some sort of lobby dining opening in the coming months.

title: Perfect
text: Our family of four (two teenagers) loved the Wallace for the two-room suite configuration, beautiful decor, and helpful staff. Easy access to the park, museums, subways, and nearby restaurants. Loved our stay!

title: Fantastic hotel!
text: We loved everything about our stay at The Wallace and highly recommend it to others! The staff was very friendly and welcoming, the location was ideal for us, and the room was impeccable. We hope to come back soon.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Stayed here in late Aug to early Sep 2022. Enjoyed our stay at the hotel! As you can see from the photos, it's nice! It's clean, looks new, at a good location - accessible to the subway & grocery and near restaurants. I like the Upper West Side as it is more quiet than the likes of Times Square. Moreover, the room is relatively more spacious than other hotels in NYC. Service was generally good. Just make sure of your booking details - as our booking (in a separate website) had a different room from what the hotel had. We had to prove & insist that we booked a better room. Our room didn't have much of a view.

title: Simply wonderful
text:
We spent 3 nights here after Christmas. From start to finish it was just fabulous. The receptionist was so lovely, the place smelled beautiful.
Couldn’t recommend this gem more.
Easy to get to the subway stations, and a lovely bakery on the corner.

title: Gem in great Upper West location
text: Fabulous value property in great location near Riverside drive. Minutes to subway, close to shopping and a few blocks from Central Park. Rooms extremely well kept, very comfy bed, great shower, bar fridge and a kettle provided. Big screen TV with chromcast. Extremely clean and very quiet considering it’s off a busy street. Will always stay here in the future.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: The person who checked us in was very helpful. Are entire stay was wonderful. Cannot recommend more highly. Elegant with modern touches. I don’t have more to say but trip advisor wants more. If you want comfort in a nice area with good restaurants go here.

title: Perfect
text: This is a beautiful hotel in a more residential setting with large, quiet, spotless rooms and a very friendly and helpful staff.  The beds are comfortable, there is ample storage, and many extra touches such as custom controls for lighting and window shades, Nespresso machines in the rooms, and mini fridges with water. It is close to Central Park and near many shops and restaurants. We can't wait to return!

title: Zero customer service
text: Beautiful property, convenient location in a quiet neighborhood. Bar is not open yet. Unfortunately bad experience with staff and zero response from management to our email and multiple messages. Will not return and will not recommend.

title: Sparkling Clean
text:
Sparkling clean spacious suite. Wonderful to have such space in NYC. Easy & simple check-in, welcoming foyer. 
Cleanliness was striking on entering the suite. Truly was the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed in. Lovely decor, crisp linen, comfy bed and perfect pillow. Very useful ‘wet bar’ with fridge, kettle and coffee machine. Great shower in the bathroom too! Lounge was perfect for relaxing in after a long day of sightseeing. The housekeeping is something else, sparkling clean each day. A true credit to the Wallace.
Location is handy for 72nd sub and the express line to Times Square. We used the subway all week. Quiet street with minimal noise at night. Neighbourhood felt safe to walk out in the evening. 
This really is a great find in NYC and we would definitively book again. 
Nowhere is perfect, though this is close! To make it perfect some plates, crockery, pot cups and glasses please. It’s not pleasant eating and drinking from paper cups and plastic glasses. We used the grocery stores and deli around the corner for breakfast items and sometimes for an evening light meal however it’s just not the same eating with disposable kit (also wasteful). Worth noting that Fairways sell packs of disposable plates, knives, forks etc to be blue to do this. The hotel provides paper cups.

title: Feels like NYC apartment living
text: The Wallace met all our expectations and some! The neighborhood and plenty of restaurants and things you might need in walking distance. The street noise was barely heard through the thick windows. The staff was kind and the rooms were kept exceptionally clean. We spent most of the day out and about but was very happy to come “home” to a safe, quiet place each night. The complimentary upgrade was a very, very sweet gift too. Can’t wait to stay again!

title: Home during a difficult time
text: In November and December I required brain surgery at a west side hospital which required  four or five overnight stays in Manhattan (we live out of state). I am so glad I found the Wallace. Besides being quiet, comfortable and very clean, the professional, friendly staff made it feel homelike. We were shown every kindness during our stay,  easing our stress. Aalthough the street is quiet, around the corner on Broadway and Amsterdam Avenues are every kind of food and shop you could want. I’d stay there again in a moment.

title: Outstanding All Around
text: Thank you so much for a wonderful stay!  This was by far our best NYC hotel experience.  From booking through departure, The Wallace exceeded expectations and we hope to have the pleasure to stay here again in the future.

title: Excellent
text:
I agree with the other reviewers- this is a great small hotel.
Positives:
quiet, side street location
quiet interior space- no noise heard from other rooms or the street below
stylish and comfortable interiors
excellent comfortable mattress and nice bedding. The sheets are all cotton sateen and the pillows are a blend of synthetic fiberfill and feathers- apparently the duvet has the same composition.
We've stayed in a suite several times but I've also seen their lowest price single Q room and it was also very nice.
Outstanding housekeeping service- I even had a maid try to put slippers on my feet LOL! Be sure to always leave a good tip for the housekeepers as they are the hardest working staff members at any hotel.

Weak points:
Some decent coffee needs to be available either in the room or in the lobby. The in-room Nespresso "original" pods are just dreadful and undrinkable. We even bought some half and half but it didn't help. The fake  "creamer" is also gross.
I like that the lobby/lounge sitting area is quiet and don't care about having a bar in the evening in that space. However, the hotel should consider one of two things:
purchase an espresso machine for the lobby or hire a vendor to come in and make espresso drinks for purchase in the morning in the bar area.
The Kabuki hotel in San Francisco has an ideal set-up for a smallish boutique hotel and is a model The Wallace should try to emulate: A free, large self serve, automated at- the-touch of a button and easy to operate espresso machine with about 10 options incl hot and cold 
milk. Along with 4 simple breakfast options: prepared off site by a vendor and brought fresh each morning to the hotel for purchase: a sweet pastry, meat and egg sandwich, tofu wrap for vegetarians and granola/yoghurt bowl. A few pieces of fresh fruit - it doesn't need to be elaborate or extensive.

Yes, there is a P Quotidian across the street and I'm lucky to have a spouse who doesn't mind going out to fetch coffee but esp for single females who don't want to get dressed and made up to go out- the Wallace needs some in-house options. The PQ bakery has good coffee but we had a stale brioche one morning at this location so I can't give it a great review. There are also two nice French bakeries close by for croissants and coffee.

title: Our New NYC Home
text:
For over two decades, my wife and I have been going to NYC before Xmas. We stayed in a B&B in Chelsea for years --- bought out this year by developers. This little place was our home away from home and was sad to see it go. Great location and the staff always made you feel like home. It was great.

Life brings change, so we tried The Wallace. And sometimes in life you rekindle a special feeling quicker than you think. The Wallace is a special place.

Like any excellent hotel, the rooms are very well appointed with great technology for lighting and blinds. The rooms and bathrooms are immaculate. The location is outstanding   a few block to either the 79th or 72 subway stop. Around the corner are two great coffee/breakfast stops --- Viand Cafe and Mille-feullie (OMG Macarons).

The area of the hotel is out of this world. great -- quiet and nice with a short subway/cab ride to many of the great locations in NYC. 

Again you can find this in other hotels; so why the special part? The people. I think most of us in our professional or family life have learned over the last two years how special, special people are. It is a rare commodity.

The staff at The Wallace are just great and very special. With the storm that arrived in the northwest, they really helped us and others out with great ease and always made you feel at home. You can see they take great pride in their profession and their hotel. You feel the moment you walk in and more so by the time you leave.

Special shout-out to Nakia and Angel who really were wonderful and the epitamy of professionals in the hotel industry. Thanks again for making our stay great.

So the Wallace becomes our new home in NYC ... see you next December 2023 and look forward to drinks and conversation at the new bar/cafe area coming to the hotel.

title: Amazing idyllic haven in NYC
text:
This hotel met & even exceeded our expectations.

One of those places where I am almost loath to write a review in case it is fully booked forevermore.

Our room was spacious, quiet & oh so comfortable. A real haven where we could kick back & relax after walking the city.

The hotel lobby is beautiful & if & when the bar permit is approved will no doubt be astonishing as well.

Huge kudos to staff & management for enhancing an already idyllic place to stay.

title: Lovely Surprise
text: First time staying at this property.  We travel to NYC several times a year to visit family.  The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Large room and very clean, very new.  Updated for today's electronic needs and modern lighting including auto shades.  Look forward to the lounge/bar being opened which would have been a plus. Would definitely return.

title: A little gem in New York
text:
The Wallace is a modern boutique hotel based on the upper West Side. The area is tranquil compared to most of New York, but access to everything is quick and easy. We had a suite on the 8th floor which had everything one could think of … plenty of cupboard space, a beautiful bathroom, two TV’s , 2 King size beds, an unobtrusive sink and fridge area section ( in the lounge area). 
Everything worked at the push of a button- all the lights, the blackout blinds etc etc. Pristine. 
The staff were super friendly and helpful. Although, being new, there is currently no food available on the premises it was no problem for the staff to bring a couple of wine glasses and plates for the one evening we were too tired to go out (bought some salad etc at the little fresh supermarket round the corner on the way back). There are also plenty of restaurants for breakfast lunch and dinner in the close vicinity so it suited us for that to be the situation. 
The hotel’s lounge and warm fireplace is also lovely to sit and relax after a long day seeing New York.
I can highly recommend this little gem.

title: Good Hotel in Quiet Location
text: The Wallace is a nice new hotel, located on a quiet street in the Upper West Side. The rooms and public areas are clean and well-appointed. Our room was one of the smaller ones, but still reasonable in size for NYC. Others have commented on the lobby fireplace. It is a great space, especially when it is frigid cold outside (which was the case when we visited). This was our first stay in the Upper West Side. Advantages: easy in and out from the city if traveling from the west; lots of restaurants and bakeries; relatively close to Central Park. Disadvantages: about a mile from the "action" in Midtown beginning at Central Park South, including more high-end restaurants, stores, and theaters. A major drawback of the hotel is that there is no food or beverage service. A cocktail lounge has been promised for months, but none was open when we stayed. It would be nice to have the option of breakfast in the hotel. Some have commented regarding a super-friendly staff. Perhaps we didn't have a chance to interact with them much, as we only stayed one night. Our impression was courteous and efficient, but nothing out of the ordinary for a fairly high-end hotel where you expect courteous and efficient. Overall, would consider staying again, especially in better weather when we could truly explore the neighborhood.

title: Best stay in Manhattan
text:
The upper west side has always been our favorite neighborhood, and this hotel is a gem in the best place in Manhattan.
Everything is beautiful, modern and new. The staff are above and beyond friendly and helpful. The rooms are gorgeous and clean and vary in sizes (make sure you pick the right one).
Quick walking distance from all the coffee shops, bagels, bars, trains and more.
We will definitely be back. Soon.

title: Very very good quaint hotel in UWS!
text:
Our family stayed very comfortably in the 2queen one bedroom suite on UWS for a week.

Located on 76th st, tucked btw the subways on 72nd st and 79th st. Surrounded by many good restaurants and bakeries and supermarkets. Our fav was New Cottage chinese restairant on 79th and La Sirense French on 80th.

3 blocks down from central park. Tge hotel had a small gym. The one bedroom suitewas spacious and nicely renovated and designed. It was super quiet.

The staff were super friendly and always accomodating.

title: THANK'S THE WALLACE
text:
Incredible experiencie, Thak you !!
Rooms are extermely clean!  New ! Smell very good.
Very nice bathroom,
Incredible and confortable bed !
Warm reception area and beautiful lobby !!!
I will select The Wallace again and again...   The staff so kind...!

title: Great hotel!
text: A wonderful small hotel with warm, welcoming and helpful staff in a convenient and quiet neighborhood. The rooms are very tastefully designed, and some are quite large by Manhattan standards. We had a great stay, and will return soon.

title: Wonderful Manhattan Hotel
text:
The Wallace is an outstanding value in a great location.
The staff is gracious and attentive.
Our room was a lovely retreat for our winter visit to New York City.
This hotel exemplifies hospitality at its best.

title: Great hotel and Fantastic Location
text:
Great hotel with clean, new and very spacious room. Fantastic location, walking distance to many restaurants, Central Park…. 
Very friendly and helpful staff. Would defiantly stay again 
Highly Recommend

title: Great service from all staff!
text:
We come to NYC every year.  This is our first time at staying at The Wallace.  We absolutely recommend staying here.  The service from staff was A+.  Everyone was so accommodating and willing to help.  Staff were friendly and always went above and beyond.  Rooms were clean.  Beautiful lobby and lounge area.  Can't wait for our next visit when the bar opens.  
We will be booking and staying at The Wallace again.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel on the Upper West Side
text: My wife and I spent two weeks in the late fall and early winter at The Wallace.  We thought the rooms were great and at a good value.  The location is perfect for anyone focusing on the museums across Central Park and performances at Lincoln Center.  Plus, it is near two subway stations that take you up and down the length of the island.  And the neighborhood is quiet, diverse and interesting, with plenty of good restaurants and bars nearby.  The Hotel has a very helpful list of recommendations for dining.  The Wallace willl be even better when it opens its ground floor bar.

title: Cleanest hotel room I’ve ever stayed in and the the water in the room was actually included
text: My husband and I went to NY to run a race. After a stressful day getting there, Betty greeted us as we arrived and informed us that our room had been upgraded. The room was great. It was the cleanest hotel room we had ever stayed in.  There was not a smudge or speck of dust anywhere. Thank you to the person who cleaned our room. At checkout, there was another very pleasant woman who helped us. I’m sorry I didn’t get her name. Our entire trip was stressful except for our stay at the Wallace. Thank you for providing such a relaxing, enjoyable experience for us.

title: Hidden Gem On Upper West Side
text: Don' hesitate! Book this little gem in a great location. Right off Broadway and 76th. Close enough to action but far enough away to feel like you are in a quiet neighborhood. Staff and rooms are superb!

title: Lovely room, great location
text: Friendly, helpful staff.  Immaculate, attractive rooms.  Great location on the Upper West Side close to subway stations.  Comfy beds with nice linens.  Very quiet.  I think this is a very good value for the price.

title: Beautiful Upper West Side Hotel!
text: Our home away from home in NYC.  Have stayed several times and loved it every time!  Incredible staff, beautifully appointed rooms and a short walk from 72nd St subway!  Great hospitality is front and centre here!

title: Amazing experience!
text: I had to be in town for a business event and wanted to stay as close to the event as possible; a google search led me to the Wallace and I"m so grateful! The staff was warm, welcoming and the penthouse level suite was amazing!  We will be back!

title: Brilliant hotel
text: We stayed at the wallace hotel in new York and we were really pleased we did, very handy location for anyone visiting new York and this was our 1st time, from the welcome at the reception desk to the rooms everything was just perfect, our apartment had everything you could ever wish for, bed was so comfortable and the bathroom and shower was just amazing. If we go back to new York this will be my hotel of choice

title: Fantastique expérience!
text: Nous y étions en famille pour célébrer un anniversaire. Service attentionné, courtois, chambres magnifiques et de propreté irréprochable. Ce fût une très  belle expérience et nous recommandons chaudement cet hôtel.

title: Comfortable and Convenient Hotel
text: We enjoyed our weekend stay. Very comfortable room with wonderful privacy blinds making it easy to sleep and rest. Friendly helpful staff. Convenient to Manhttan and many NY City attractions, including a few blocks from Central Park (great for runners needing a place to stretch their legs). The room uses electronic switches for the lights, so this can be frustrating for those who want traditional light switches, but with time and patience, we were able to control the lights and blinds.

title: Great space, lovely & fresh room
text: We stayed at The Wallace in early December 2022. I was traveling with my 79 year old mother and 18 year old daughter. We chose the hotel because of the larger than normal room size (our room had a separate sitting/tv/entry area that was separate from the bedroom) and we liked the upper west side location. It was perfect for us. Yes, we had to Uber to our shows on Broadway but we found great restaurants close to the hotel and we loved the neighborhood atmosphere and it was an easy walk to Central Park. The decor and finishes in the room were clean and fresh, the beds were comfortable, and we would stay here again. A bar in the lobby would be a great addition, otherwise this was the perfect hotel for us.

title: What a lovely surprise!!
text:
What an absolutely lovely surprise to come back to this hotel after over a year of refurbishment. Gorgeous finishings, huge room, great staff.  
From before the check-in , talking to Melveta over email,  to the actual check-in, to the stay, to the sad checkout, everything about this hotel works for us. Now it is pricey and we will only be back if we can get it at a good price but we would be happy to return for Melveta and the  great staff alone.

title: Thanksgiving break
text: It doesn’t matter what you request you don’t always get it.  I requested a room away from the elevator banks and was in a room as close to the elevator as possible.  It was a holiday weekend so it was useless complaining.  Nothing would be done.  We could hear people in the elevator lobby at all hours.

title: Wallace Hotel
text: Wonderful hotel in great location in upper west side. Very clean rooms. Very quiet. Close to subway and restaurants.  Will stay here every time we go to NYC which is several times a year. Small, intimate, friendly.

title: Beautiful luxury hotel on the Upper West Side - finally!
text: I have been waiting for a hotel to open on the Upper West Side that is beautiful, luxurious, clean and friendly.  The Wallace was the answer to my request! They were terrific and the rooms are lovely. The staff we encountered were terrific. I only wish there was a bar in the lobby!

title: First stay at The Wallace but definitely not the last one.
text: I just returned home this morning and I must admit that I enjoyed every minute of my getaway to the Big Apple and I must admit that, from now on, I will always make sure to repeat my wonderful stay at The Wallace.  As other guests have mentioned the staff goes out and beyond to solve any issues you may encounter. The room and public areas are spotless and smell marvellously and the UWS  is quiet and safe but has plenty of restaurants, delis and shops.  The forthcoming bar/lounge will definitely be a magnificent place to relax by the fireplace after sightseeing and shopping.

title: Astonishing in every way
text: The staff is exceptionally welcoming, friendly, and helpful. The interior is gorgeous and well-maintained -- I have no idea what this building once was, but now it is definitely a luxury hotel. The rooms were very comfortable, with lots of high tech touches and great amenities. I was in town visiting family, having grown up nearby, but this stay made it feel like a vacation!

title: Can’t wait to return !
text:
My husband and I just returned after we spent 4 nights and 5 days at The Wallace. The hotel significantly exceeded our expectations. The entire staff could not have been more professional and attentive. The immaculately clean bed- rooms were very tastefully modern, with all the latest electronics and high end furnishings and finishes. The common areas were equally lovely. I visited the gym, which had the latest  equipment and was pristine. 
The neighborhood has everything we needed from morning coffee and breakfast right across the street and a bus stop a few steps away on Broadway. We were easily able to walk to and from Lincoln Center and other attractions.
Thank you for making our stay so wonderful.

title: Safe and peaceful
text: The Wallace never fails to make us happy.  Front Desk, Housekeeping, and everyone we interacted with were lovely, kind, and helpful.  It is the cleanliness that is most impressive.  This is a Gem of a hotel located in a lovely neighborhood.  Make sure to get a Levain chocolate chip cookie while in the area.

title: A gem
text:
Great location go  to a beautiful hotel. Lovely large, new feeling large rooms. Beautifully decorated. The walls are unfortunately very thin so could hear a lot of activity above and around us. 
Very friendly staff. Helpful throughout. I loved the neighborhood. In town for a concert.

title: The price does not live up to the "details"
text: Expensive and not worth it.. they have some things to work out yet. Perhaps when the reno is done it will be better. No robes in room, no pillow options. Can't sit in the lobby and bring in food or drink even though they have no service.

title: Great hotel in the upper west side
text: Great hotel.  Spacious rooms that are sparkling clean. Comfy beds, awesome showers, and friendly staff. Within walking distance of Central Park, Columbus Circle and Theatre District.  While there are no food services presently in the hotel, but there are plenty of coffee shops, restaurants and markets steps away.  Stayed in the one bedroom king suite which was spacious and lovely.

title: Couple getaway
text: My husband and I came for an anniversary vacation and it was everything we could have asked for. The rooms were really nice and clean. The staff was really helpful, informative and very kind. I would highly recommend The Wallace

title: Love this hotel
text: The staff, the service and the rooms are consistently wonderful.  Everyone is friendly and helpful with recommendations. Great location for restaurants and more of a neighborhood feel.  We look forward to our next stay at this lovely property.

title: Amazing
text: Super Clean, no city "odors". Rooms are beautiful. I would stay here again and probably will soon. The staff are super friendly and accomodating ,. Room had lots of nice touches and felt like home. The Wallace has our family seal of approval!

title: When in New York
text: Very nice, clean, safe place. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are large and cozy. Bathroom was spotless. Beds are very comfy. Location is perfect for what we needed.Definitely will stay there again . Thank you!

title: NYC Marathon
text: Fantastic room close to Central Park and excellent Upper West Side Dining! We had the most amazing time on our mother daughter trip. The marathon was an awesome experience. We would stay here anytime!

title: Best of Everything
text:
This is our new favorite hotel in NYC!

The staff is top notch! Very helpful, kind and even remembered our names!

The rooms are cozy, spacious and have all the necessary amenities for a perfect stay!

Location!! Can’t be beat! Near park, river and restaurants. It ideal location if running NYC marathon! Only blocks from the finish line. 

We will be back!!

title: Great hotel great staff
text: The hotel was perfect our stay in the penthouse suite was perfect lots of great design and loads of space just perfect location was perfect for site seeing shopping and restaurants we are coming back after a week away and looking forward to the great hospitality

title: Don't miss this place
text: The Wallace Hotel is perfectly located, the rooms are exceptional clean, with all the required amenities required for a extended stay.  The staff are some of the best I've encountered, friendly and helpful.

title: Wonderful Upper West Side Stay!
text: This hotel was classy, clean and the perfect location for a NY weekend getaway! The staff was helpful and friendly, and I have absolutely 0 complaints! I will definitely be back to take advantage of the great location during a weekend when I have more time to myself.

title: Amazing hotel in a great location!!!
text: Love the Wallace!  Staff are fabulous as are the accommodations.  This was second stay at the Wallace and I will not stay anywhere else on the Upper West Side. It is a great location with easy access to all the popular areas but in a nice quiet area.  It is a great choice.

title: Fabulous in Every Way
text: I reviewed hotels as a travel journalist for years and this is now one of my favorite hotels of all. The staff is fantastic, decor is beautiful, my suite was very large for NYC standards and no noise from within the hotel or from the street. The bed was very comfortable and the “smart home” features were top notch. Plus the location was great.

title: Beacon theater stay.
text: I picked The Wallace for its proximity to the beacon theater,  my wife and I walked into the Hotel and were greeted by a wonderful staff. We were given a room upgrade due to availability and directed to a quaint local restaurant, upon our return we went to our junior suite which was beautiful and quite spacious especially for New York standards.  from start to finish everyone at The Wallace could not have been better.  I'm not sure of the price for the Suite but our standard King room with all the taxes etc. was 330.00 which was quite reasonable.

title: Terrific property, team, and location
text: Well maintained, delightful  property that is truly a steal at this price point. The rooms are spacious, clean, and modern. The location is a quiet reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the city with easy access to public transportation, restaurants, and other conveniences (e.g. Trader Joe’s , Whole Foods). The team led by the incredible Emar, includes a lovely Jamaican woman at the front desk who is warm and welcoming. The housekeeping staff is also very attentive. A real hidden gem, appropriate for those seeking 4 Star accommodations by US standard.

title: Second Visit
text:
This was my second stay at The Wallace
and it was as good as my first. Rooms are
Redone beautifully and also have many hi tech features. Staff is outstanding and very pleasant. I live this area as it is where I spent slot of time when I was young and living in NYC. It is a real neighborhood and not packed with tourists.

title: Wonderful hotel for a New York City vacation
text: We had an absolutely fantastic 6-night stay in our Queen Suite on the 14th floor! Everything was perfect, the view from our room was marvelous. They have done an amazingly perfect job of remodeling the old Milburn Hotel, where we stayed a few times. Every detail has been beautifully incorporated:  the wide and usable pedestal sink in the bathroom, the electronic controls for the lighting and shades, the pocket doors separating the sleeping area, the temperature controls, the furnishings, everything! We definitely would return on future visits to NYC.

title: A haven of tranquility and sophistication
text: You know when you walk in and a hotel smells so good that it was going to be an amazing stay! We loved everything about this hotel. It made our stay in New York a real luxury and we loved the neighbourhood. It felt safe and the subway is only a couple of blocks away to get around easily. Their social media page is a wealth of info before you travel. our room 1402 had the most amazing view and light through the huge windows. My only criticism is some of the sustainability aspects - there was too much single use plastic in the room and we would have appreciated proper cups so perhaps bring your own. Otherwise it was perfect and a haven of peace and sophistication on the UWS.

title: AFRAID TO SHARE HOW GREAT THIS PROPERTY IS!
text:
The reviews were just too good. A new hotel on the Upper West Side of NYC, with clean well appointed new rooms and a reasonable ( for NYC) rate...preposterous! can't be real!

Well...after two amazing nights there and after hundreds of thousands of hotel nights in my business travel, it is true.

This hotel is a gem, the rooms comfortable, roomy and immaculate. The furnishings premium. The hallways and lobby clean, bright and odor-less.
Best of all is the staff, kind, caring, attentive and appreciative.

This is a real winner on a quiet street on the safer side of New York City,
Hoping not too many people read this review so this remains our little secret and does not make the hotel hard to book and more expensive.

title: A hidden gem
text: This small hotel on the Upper West Side is wonderful.  The room was well appointed and had state-of-the-art features.  The bathroom was spacious and equipped with everything you would need.  Comfortable bed and bedding.  Not a fan of the Nespresso machine, but some folks are.  The staff, to a person, were professional, friendly, helpful, accommodating.  If they would add a coffee bar in the mornings in the lobby and open their cocktail bar soon, this place would be perfect!

title: Beautiful Hotel with great location
text: It was our first visit to the Wallace. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We loved our room. The layout was great with a great view. Terffic shower as well. The only thing I'd change is the matress, it was hard.

title: Highly sophisticated Hotel
text:
A highly sophisticated and warm welcoming hotel. The staff is outstandingly friendly and helpful and makes you feel home the minute you arrive. The room is very well equipped, offers latest state of the art technology and a very thoughtful design and lighting concept. Whereas other hotels just offer a room or suite this hotel  offers a home.

As far as I am aware of  this hotel neither has a bar nor a restaurant. In my opinion it is not even missing as you - as a guest - can feel free to order in and enjoy whatever meal you prefer in a relaxed and very  luxurious environment.

title: Great bathrooms and great location!
text: This a great hotel that's both close to Central Park, good restaurants, the metro and Columbia University. It is basically brand-new, and everything is super clean. The bathrooms and the beds are superb. The reason that I do not give a 5 is only because I think the room could have been cozier. This is not a hotel you hang around in, but I guess you will be busy making NY. :-)

title: A hidden gem in a wonderful location.
text: We would highly recommend staying at The Wallace if you're visiting Manhattan. The staff, the rooms and the location are all wonderful, and it feels like you're in your own private bolt hole. This will be our go to hotel whenever we come to Manhattan.

title: Very pleased
text: The experience was beyond my expectations. Great rooms and very friendly staff. The Wallace will now be my new favourite hotel in NY. Loved the location and easy access to most part of the city. I will come back as soon as possible

title: Very nice place on Upper West Side
text: First visit to our daughter on Upper West Side so we chose this on location and ratings.  It did not disappoint.  It was a wonderful experience.  Very clean and fairly new.  Rooms were great.  Staff was wonderful

title: Perfection on the Upper West Side
text:
My husband and I have made several trips to NYC over the last 11 years. This was our first since 2018. I always research hotels on Trip Advisor, and that's where I discovered The Wallace. This is without a doubt the cleanest, most perfect hotel we've found in New York. The condition of the furniture, the walls, floors, beds, all of it, is as if they just opened yesterday!  The details, like leather drawer pulls, light fixtures, electric shades, area rug in the living room, are all top of the line. 
The hotel doesn't have a bar or restaurant,  but it doesn't need one. Starbucks a block away, an amazing French bakery also just steps away. Tons of eateries and bars easily within walking distance. Housekeeping does a great job of making the rooms up early. Doorman and front desk staff are all friendly and make you feel at home. The rooms on the front of the hotel don't offer a view to speak of. The building only has 14 floors. Not sure if other rooms look at anything other than next door buildings. I will gladly sacrifice a view for beautiful room, and that's what we have. We will absolutely return to The Wallace the next time we come to NYC.

title: Gem of a hotel
text: I always hate trying new hotels. But this one was great. The people that work there were friendly. The rooms were great. Beds and pillows super comfy. Defiantly more of a neighborhood feel than staying in midtown. But a great place to  return to at night to escape all the activity.

title: Best Place on The Upper West Side
text: Second time staying at the Wallace. It's a jewel of a hotel on the upper West side. The rooms and overall facility are excellent. We'll certainly stay here again on our next visit. Thank you and the Wallace team.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
Great facility in wonderful Upper West side, close to many restaurants, Zabar's, Central park, Museum of natural history.
Staff extremely friendly, and efficient.
Room amazingly spacious, immaculately clean, modern amenities.

title: Felt like a valued guest in a great location
text: This was our second stay at the hotel.  Both times we felt like valued guests - unlike when you stay at some of the larger chains.  They knew us and treated us really well.  Rooms are attractive and clean.  The only thing I might improve is the pillows are hard.  I should have asked for a softer one and I am sure they would have provided it.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Spent 4 days with our adult children , the staff , location and rooms were out of this world, a true hidden gem, will definitely stay there again when we visit. The planned bar area will greatly assist in a perfect meeting place, much needed.  On our road trip across America, this was the only hotel that took the time to reply to e mails sent.

title: Perfect New York visit
text: Beautiful property.  Bed was sooo comfortable.  Loved the location.  Easy access to everything.  Could people watch all day from one of the many coffee shops nearby.  Subway is a 5 minute walk. Definitely would stay again.

title: great value on upper west side
text: Wonderful stay.  All staff were friendly and helpful.  I was upgraded to a one-bedroom suite, which was airy and spacious and comfortable. Terrific bed.  The lobby is very well arranged with numerous seating areas for conversation or privacy.  On the one cool day in NYC, I relaxed in front of a roaring fire.

title: Good quality, lacking in amenities
text: Great room, excellent staff. Just disappointed by the lack of amenities, such as room service. I would have loved to be able to order food in my room, even though there are great grocery stores close by. The inability to have coffee and breakfast in the room in the mornings affected the appeal of this hotel. A hotel bar in the lobby would have immensely improved the quality of my stay.

title: Lovely Property on Upper West Side
text: The Wallace surpassed all our expectations! It is a lovely property where we could relax from the hustle of the city with plenty of restaurants, bars and coffee shops within walking distance. We moved from a different hotel in Midtown and we were SO GLAD! This little gem just made our NYC experience so much more enjoyable. Highly recommend!

title: Comfortable beds and good location
text: We stayed a week at the hotel and the overall the room was very comfortable and quiet. There are many drawers in the room but the closet is very small, there is no place to hang a winter coat but in the small closet which was already full with a few shirts and slacks, and there is no storage in the bathroom.

title: Modern, comfortable, spacious, very clean, great location
text:
Our deluxe King Room on 14th floor was modern, fresh, bright and spacious with high-tech controls for lighting and shades, good-size closet + Nespresso machine, kettle, safe, ample power outlets, large TV and quiet, efficient a/c and heating.

Nice bathroom with large shower, heated / illuminated mirror, plus thoughtful night-light.

All spotlessly clean and room serviced impeccably every day of our 4-night stay.

Great Upper West Side location, quiet apart from usual city sounds, 5 mins walk to Subway stations, 10 mins to Central Park.

Very friendly and helpful front desk and door staff. Hotel doesn’t (yet) have a bar, nor does it have a restaurant, although it doesn't need one, instead they provided a helpful curated list of local eateries, of which there are plenty of choices and ethnicities nearby (Tip: check out which you like the look of and reserve asap as some get booked up quickly).

Perfect, spacious, well-located and comfortable base for our first visit to NYC!

title: Beautiful, clean NYC hotel.
text: Absolutely love this hotel. We’re New Yorkers living in Long Island and I wanted a quick local getaway for my husband’s bday. Searched high and low for a beautiful clean city hotel that would meet our expectations. This fit the bill!! The rooms were beautiful, soooooooo clean and the rooms were big! Bigger than I would expect NYC hotel rooms to be. Check in was so easy. Joseph was at the front desk and was so pleasant. He upgraded us to a King suite which was amazing! I can’t stress enough how clean this hotel was. The room was equipped with a nespresso machine, automated blinds which were amazing for blocking out light. I was definitely surprised with this hotel but pleasantly surprised. Believe all the reviews about this hotel. It truly is a beautiful, nicely decorated and clean boutique hotel. Our visit was short but we wish we had another night. Would definitely recommend and would stay here again if we decided to do another staycation. Kudos The Wallace. Job well done. You deserve every one of these stars.

title: Terrific Hotel
text: The Wallace is just off Broadway but was surprisingly quiet. It's close to a subway station, there's a grocery store one block away and lots of restaurants within walking distance. We stayed for 8 nights, and it was blissful. The bed was comfy, the fresh Nespresso coffee was delicious each morning and the staff were consistently pleasant and eager to help. We would definitely stay here again when we visit NYC.

title: Marvelous hotel experience!!
text: Our 1 bedroom king suite was like having an apartment in the city.  Comfortable and efficient design; great lighting; friendly, helpful service; fabulous location - what more could you want?  We’ll stay here again!  We recommend it highly.

title: Fantastic hotel!! Simply the best hotel we've stayed in.
text: Absolutely fantastic hotel, fantastic friendly staff and a great location. We stayed for 7 nights in September 2022 and the room was absolutely perfect, it looked like it was brand new. Plenty of storage, usb charge points and normal plug sockets which a lot of hotels don't have. I literally can't think of any bad points about the hotel at all.

title: Beautiful hotel!
text: This was our first time staying at the Wallace, and we were so happy with everything! The lobby is warm and inviting with a working fireplace, and the staff are so friendly. Our room was incredible with thoughtful additions (like being able to push a privacy button instead of using a door tag, and pushing one sleep button to turn off all the lights, just to name a couple). Everything felt designed for our comfort. And the location in the Upper West Side was very convenient. We will definitely be back. If you’re coming to NYC, you should definitely stay here!

title: Perfect when traveling with your pet
text: Very satisfied with how dog-friendly the hotel and the staff were. The entire hotel was spotless and clean, and the lobby smelled fresh. The interior design was beautiful and modern, and I loved how everything was controlled electronically, including the window shade. The cleaning staff always made sure I had plenty of toiletries and towels each time they cleaned. And thank you for not charging for bottled water! The bottle style of the bath products match the style of the room perfectly, and they smell so fresh. The location of the hotel itself is perfect for a travel staying with their dog, as there is a pet store directly across the street, and a safe dog park within walking distance. The entire Riverside area just past the dog park is a safe and scenic walk for anyone with their dog. DoorDash is readily available, and there are great restaurants within walking distance for pickup, as well as grocery stores, like Trader Joe’s. I will definitely seek this place out the next time I plan a trip to NYC, with or without my dog.

title: Best NYC hotel!
text: The Wallace is our go-to choice every time we come to New York City. The staff have been wonderfully accommodating and generous, with particular kudos to Justin and Betty at the front desk. Wonderful location and beautiful rooms.

title: Wonderful UWS Option
text:
My family of 3 stayed here for a night in May 2022 on our way to Legoland NY, and this place is a gem! 

I used to live in the UWS and have always longed for a luxury hotel in the area, so I can stay there when I visit NYC. When I found the Wallace, I was smitten. 

This hotel is luxurious and affordable. We felt like we were living in our own apartment on the UWS again, but with all the wonderful hotel amenities. The staff was wonderful; the room was spacious, clean and had beautiful touches; and the location was perfect. 

We loved everything about this hotel and have already booked our next visit. 

If you’re looking for a hotel that feels more like a home when visiting NYC, this is definitely the place.

title: Gem on the Upper West Side
text: This new hotel is very clean, very spacious and in a great location. Staff was very friendly too.  I really could not have hoped for a better stay (six nights).  I do hope they open the bar and restaurant soon, as that would round out the experience.

title: What a Gem!!
text: This hotel is an absolute gem. The location in Upper West side is quiet but still central to so many sites. The decor is stunning. We hung out in the lounge lobby area just taking in the ambiance, and the smell! Omg the candle smell is mmmmm. The staff, every single person was so friendly, helpful and accommodating. From the door men to the housekeeping staff, ever person was so gracious. And to the fabulous gentleman in the sharp light blue suit who greeted us with warm fresh towels after we got stuck in the down pouring rain lightning and thunder, thank you so so much. It was the most thoughtful act any hotel has ever done for us. We won't forget it. We will definitely be back

title: Stunning Renovation!
text: Loved everything about this hotel. The location, the rooms, the style, the staff, the in house gym, everything top notch! Look forward to when they open their bar/restaurant. Look forward to returning - def my new NY hotel of choice!

title: Best place to stay in NYC
text: Excellent hotel in good location.  Very friendly staff and great rooms.  Whenever we are in town we stay at the Wallace.  We usually check out reviews of places we want to stay.  The Wallace had very positive reviews and we know why.

title: Excellent choice of hotel
text:
The hotel is well-located in the upper west side.  It is close to Central Park, a subway station , and plenty of local restaurants and shops.  Staff are polite and friendly, the room was large and well furnished.

Some very minor niggles
- we heard some noise from the room above us, which is disappointing at this price point.
- the ground floor bar is (permanently?) closed, so the beautifully decorated lobby area was deserted and lacked any atmosphere.

title: A gem on Upper West SIde
text: This is my 5 th stay at this fantastic hotel.  Pet friendly and such amazing service.   This renovated brownstone always makes me feel at home in big rooms with many amenities.  I love the robes and slippers in the suites.  Close to many fabulous restaurants and to subway and buses this hotel never disappoints.  Slinky and I love it. ❤️🤠

title: A hidden gem on Broadway!
text:
One of the best hotels we’ve ever stayed in!

Reasons why:
- Beautifully appointed rooms that were very comfortable, clean and spacious (the last one a luxury for NYC!)
- Responsive, helpful and friendly staff who were very personable and made us feel so much at home: from GM Victor Freeman, Steven and his team at the front desk the front desk, housekeeping manager to the technician and housekeeping staff). Whatever request we had, we were attended to promptly. Top marks for service!
- convenient location along Broadway, minutes from the Subway 1 stations and with all kinds of restaurants, shops (pharmacy, groceries, laundromat, you name it) within walking distance. 

All these reasons more than made up for the fact that the hotel didn’t have dining options on site (we didn’t need them because there were so many dining options within close proximity), and it was super easy for us to hop onto the subway to get to other parts of NYC. We will recommend the Wallace to everyone and certainly know where we will stay on our next visit to NYC.

title: Beautiful double queen suite
text: Beautiful suite was well-worth the cost. This was a great value for lots of space for 4 friends to celebrate a birthday with fresh well-appointed rooms, clean design and excellent service in lovely neighborhood near Central Park.

title: Great Hotel with really helpful staff
text: A really great hotel in a fantastic location. The rooms were much bigger than most in NYC and brand new. The staff could not have been more friendly. Once the new Bar is open I suspect you won’t be able to get a reservation!

title: Absolutely Terrible Experience - they told me my confirmed reservation was cancelled at check in.
text: I booked the Wallace through Magellan Luxury Hotels. I had stayed there once before, also booked by Magellan. I had a written confirmation. I arrived at the Hotel on the evening of 9/11 and was told I had no reservation because it had been cancelled allegedly for non payment. They claimed they had contacted Magellan and  received no response. They were not helpful despite my having a written confirmed reservation for 3 nights. Since it was Fashion Week the Wallace only had a room for one night and said they were full for the rest of the stay. I could not reach Magellan and was forced to find another and more expensive hotel for the next two nights of my stay. As I was there for important business meetings, this was especially stressful. The next morning I asked the Wallace if they were still full and they said yes. No one seemed at all concerned about my situation and they insisted it was Magellan 's fault. When I asked Magellan for help they told me they investigated and determined it was the Wallace 's fault. Supposedly the Wallace despite admitting fault to Magellan would do nothing to compensate me for the costs I had to incur for this fiasco. And Magellan, despite being my agent and claiming to provide "gold star service", would not compensate me. So much for "gold star service". I won't be staying here again. Confirmations mean nothing.

title: Overnight stay
text: We went here when it first opened to attend a marathon. The room was comfortable and tastefully decorated.It was a very quiet room and centrally located which made it easy to walk to events.I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Highly recommended!
text:
Very clean & classy hotel. Rooms are pretty big & roomy. Very close to subway station. Staff are very nice & friendly. Price is very reasonable for this hotel. It’s definitely worth it & meets the value!
Loved it!

title: Beautiful property. Luxury all around. Lacking soul and service.
text:
I arrived at 2 in the morning after delays from Europe. The check-in was cold and didn't do much to acknowledge my pain. I was asked if I needed help finding the room and said no, but clearly, I did.
It just feels like there is no experience in this hotel. You go to your beautiful room. And that's the end. No lounge. no dining room, nada.

title: Excellent option in Upper West Side
text: NYC has many many options depends what you want to do in the city. We specially went to the US OPEN and as many knows the west side isn't the best place but pretty clode to central Park and the subway. we choose this hotel because a recommendation of a friend of mine

title: EXCELLENT HOTEL!
text:
Spent a week at Wallace recently and could not have been happier! Rooms and service were TOP NOTCH! We have family on the Upper West Side and the location was perfect!
Can't wait for the lounge to open soon!

title: Fantastic Hotel in the Upper Westside
text: The hotel was fantastic in all aspects, and I highly recommend staying there.  The location was also great (including numerous fantastic food and restaurants nearby), and the staff was always very friendly and helpful.  A rating of 10 out of 10.

title: Friendly, great location but noisy rooms
text: I spend 60+ nights a yr in hotels.  This place is very nice, clean and well appointed but you can hear EVERY word spoken in the rooms next door & toilet flushing in room above us sounded like a sink with running water on.

title: Top Notch Room and Hotel Staff
text: We stayed in the suite. The room was spacious, pristine and comfortable. I inadvertently left my iPad at the hotel after checkout, and staff found it and shipped it back to me promptly. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Perfect hotel in great location
text: We had an absolutely amazing stay at the wallace. Firstly staff were excellent, and Justin’s comms pre check in were great even helping me with an upgrade for my wife’s birthday. The hotel is also brand new so condition and quality of everything was excellent. The rooms were big. The location fantastic on upper west side surrounded by beautiful cafes and restaurants and the park close by. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

title: Really nice hotel would definitely recommend!
text: Very convenient location; helpful and friendly staffs! Love how clean and new the room and bathroom are. Room is spacious. The wireless control is also really convenient at night. Wi-Fi is also easy to connect and high speed! Would definitely recommend.

title: Home From Home & NYC's Best Boutique Hotel
text:
This was our 8th stay in 9 months at The Wallace .... we are up to about 60 plus nights staying since its opening ( if not more )... The facts about this hotel are simple - 'The Staff', From Victor Freeman the incredible hands-on General Manager to all of his colleagues and team everyone is focused to making your stay sensational. The owner and his team have put a lot of thought and detail into The Wallace and its just keeps getting better....

The room product, the housekeeping ( Bella - a real star!! ) and every detail is well thought out... We cant wait for the lobby bar / restaurant concept to open. On my last stay I also used the gym... great space, simple and with great equipment ( Pelaton ) and fee weights ... all you need!

Location, location, location - over 9 months we have so grown to the Upper West Side area and community and its good to note that the hotel's IG feed constantly report on restaurants, bars and what to do and where and so many 'gems' to talk about!

We love this hotel because its sensational quality, value for money and gets it right!

Bravo - they have kept it as special as month one!

No small feat and thats down to vision, leadership and a great product with guests looked after by an engaged team....

title: Great Surprise
text: A very nice hotel in the Upper West Side area in New York, a hidden gem! Everything new and very clean. Walking distance to Columbia University, Central Park and Downtown Manhattan. The only thing missing is food service, even though there are many restaurants and coffe shops nearby

title: Perfect!
text: I can't remember the last time I had such a positive experience at a hotel. Every dimension of our stay met or exceeded our expectations. In particular, we heard no street noise and slept very well on the fourth floor, maybe because The Wallace is located in the middle of the block. We look forward to returning!

title: Practically Perfect
text: Everything was great, from the scent in the air, to the staff’s welcome, to our room, which was beautiful and spacious by NYC standards. The bed was extremely comfortable and the sheets are very high quality—didn’t want to get up! We had a terrace with a view of the river. The location is great and there are lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. We wanted to stay on the upper west side to be near family, but even if we hadn’t had that incentive, it’s a good area to stay because it is so quiet at night compared to other parts of town. This was our first stay and I hope we have many more. It was lovely.

title: This hotel is a great find
text: We absolutely loved The Wallace. Beautiful, clean, modern, and very classy hotel on a quiet street in a terrific, vibrant neighborhood with easy access by public transportation to anywhere in Manhattan. Very friendly and welcoming staff and gorgeous rooms and bathrooms. An amazing value for the price we paid. I am already recommending this place to everyone I know.

title: A comfortable and pleasant stay in UWS
text: I stayed at this hotel because I have family in the area, and I will absolutely be booking again in the future. Comfortable, clean, and modern accommodation and friendly and accommodating staff. Outstanding!

title: Newly Updated Wallace Hotel
text: Newly updated throughout. Clean, neat, spacious room, large batthroom/shower. Friendly staff, great location on Upper West side. Bar area pleasantly decorated - awaiting permits, so inactive at present.

title: Outstanding!
text: Beautiful hotel with top notch service, amenities provided in the rooms are those of a 5-Star Hotel. Each employee I encountered truly cared and wanted to ensure I had a great stay. I’m already looking forward to returning soon!

title: Perfect choise with family
text:
Todo perfecto, location muy buena, personal muy amable, habitaciones muy limpias y amuebladas con gusto. Los baños limpios y modernos. La recomendaría sin duda. 
Tienen una pastelería delante muy cómoda por desayunar (Le Pan Quotidien).

title: Perfect Stay!
text: The Wallace is such a fantastic find on the Upper West Side - great location close to Central Park and in the middle of great bars and restaurants.  We had two rooms for a family graduation trip. Both rooms were elegantly furnished and beautiful, but also warm and comfortable.  Beautiful and comfortable lobby.  Great set-up for business travelers who have to work in the hotel.  Every staff member that we interacted with was friendly, helpful, and professional.  We will definitely stay here again on our next NYC trip.

title: Nice, clean safe and GREAT location
text:
Great location, clean accommodations, friendly helpful staff and pretty decor!  Will plan on staying at this hotel again.  Close to Central Park and River park.  Lots of great local restaurants and cute shops.
Away from the insane madness of Time Square but close enough to walk to the Theatre District.

title: Absolute Gem of a Hotel
text: 5 stars is not nearly enough for The Wallace. The staff is responsive and so helpful.  The hotel is beautiful from top to bottom and the rooms are spacious and extremely well appointed.  It feels like our own little apartment in the city.  Cannot beat The Wallace for location--quiet street but close to everything you could want.

title: Excellent accomodations
text:
Hotel is lovely. Room was very pretty and bed is very comfortable. All top notch. 
Had a little trouble with the nespresso machine, but eventually figured it out! And couldn’t figure out how to get to ironing board, supposedly stored in a drawer under the bed. But these were really minor things. Otherwise great location and perfect for where I needed to be the next day.

title: Great Location
text: Recently refurbished hotel on Manhattan’s west side situated a quiet street within convenient proximity to Riverside and Central Park. There was no restaurant or bar on the premises but it is hardly needed given the number of establishments close by.  Room layout/controls and bathroom fixtures reflect the recent renovation.  Bed size felt slightly smaller than the queen mattress we are accustom to but still comfortable.  Two elevators cars are more compact and can get crowed or delayed during peak hours.

title: Exceptionnel
text:
Nous sommes restés 5 nuit dans cet hôtel. La localisation est parfaite avec le métro à 5 minutes à pied et central Park à côté.
Beaucoup de possibilités pour le petit déjeuner en évitant le pain quotidien a côté.
Le personnel de l accueil est au top. 
Les chambres sont spacieuses et calmes même si parfois les voisins  sont un peu trop présents la faute à une insonorisation moyenne.
Seul le service de chambre est assez inégal d un jour à l autre avec des peignoirs manquants ou un réveil en sursaut de la part d une employée qui sonne pour faire la chambre!!!
Rien de grave 
Les chambres opposées à la rue sont un peu sombres (vu sur les autres immeubles) mais très tranquilles 
Bref un endroit parfait

title: UWS Gem
text: This was the best hotel room I have stayed in in NYC at this price point!  Beautful, clean, updated new rooms with large space by NYC standards. The AC worked great on an unsually hot weekend.  The shower was huge and well stocked with great products.  The hotel was quiet and every staff member I encountered was beyond friendly and accomodating.  The neighborhood is great - there are so many bars and restaurants close by and just a short walk to Central Park and the subway.  You won't regret staying here!

title: Great location, quiet hotel
text: The Wallace is kind of an unknown gem.  On the Upper West Side, it’s location is handy for that part of town and easy access elsewhere.  The rooms are quiet, extremely well equipped and efficient.  Great beds, showers, all the amenities I wish for.   Note that there are no food or beverage services at this property, which was not a problem for us—right outside the door many many choices.  The lobby is well decorated and a nice space.

title: Understated Elegance, Great Service, Feel Like A Local
text: This hotel is an incredible addition to the Upper West Side. The lobby design feels Ralph Lauren inspired. It is a boutique hotel, and quiet. You will not find mobs of check-ins at a line of 5 front desk staff. We stayed for a total of 20 nights in July while our daughter was in a summer ballet program at Lincoln Center. We appreciated how low key it was,  and how helpful the staff were. Justin and Betty could not have been more amazing! The 2 times we returned we felt as though we were returning to our own pied-a-terre. We loved being right between Central Park and Riverside Park, as well as easy walking distance from the train and multiple new favorite restaurants. Our rooms came with a fridge, not a mini bar, but there is a grocery a block away. We upgraded for part of our stay and had a microwave, which was nice for Chinese leftovers. This is not a hotel for those that want a "Plaza" experience with all the bells, whistles, pomp, and circumstance. However, it is beautiful, clean, updated, and quiet and absolutely perfect if you are over the hive inducing tourist hotels and nauseating chain stays. Also great for extended stays.

title: not bad
text:
Not a bad stay. Not out of the ordinary either. Rather pleasant, very clean room.
Came with high expectations, not all of them were met. Would probably come back if we needed to stay at Upper West Side but didn't experience anything beyond the normal standard of a good hotel. Some staff were very friendly, some just ok - again, a very normal hotel experience. Don't really see where the raging reviews came from. Must mention that we booked the cheapest room category, maybe more expensive rooms have a view (ours faced walls and AC units and was rather dark) and an overall more enjoyable atmosphere.

title: Nice rooms but very little amenities
text: This is a small boutique hotel but it does feel bit like ghost town . Rooms are nice but very little staff , no thing in the room's fridge. The room was clean and well. equipped but nit worth the money

title: Stay here!
text: Friendly staff. Great neighborhood. The frenzy of NYC is close by but this place is an oasis. If you're a runner, the Park is 1 mile East and the trail along the Hudson is 1/2 mile West. Great coffee, bakeries, food close by in a sunny friendly environment.

title: The best!
text: Our stay at the wallace was perfect, in all aspects. Staff was very, very friendly and helpful, rooms were spacious and very clean, location was just great. We extended our stay by one night and we will be back.

title: The Upper  West Side Choice
text: We love the Wallace for the location, the impeccable staff, value, quality of rooms. Our favorite place to stay in NYC. Our child is at Columbia University, closest hotel to school. About a 10 min drive. A few blocks from Central Park. Family area, safe, and close to a lot of great restaurants. They don't have a restaurant or bar yet but it's coming this fall. Rooms are spacious, clean, and lovely.

title: Great property
text: Very nice, quiet property on the upper west side of Manhattan.  Rooms were well appointed with very well thought out details, such as the lighting and remote shades and beds were very comfortable.  Staff was excellent and very attentive.

title: De beste keuze in de UWS
text:
Wat een ontdekking, wat een topligging, wat een comfort.
De lobby is een elegante ruimte om even tot rust te komen na een hectische dag in Manhattan.
Stijlvol design, verse bloemstukken, discretie.
We hebben werkelijk genoten van de luxe kamers, voorzien van alle technische gadgets, ruime koelkast , built in safe in de nachttafel en een royale badkamer met regendouche.
Housekeeping top , kamers zijn kraaknet.
Helaas zijn er in dit hotel geen bell boys , wel uitstekende security.
Na een vlucht van 10 uur mag je zelf je valiezen (6 stuks) uit de taxi nemen en naar de kamer brengen.
Simpele elementaire one liners zoals ' Welkom in The Wallace  , hoe was uw vlucht, hoe was uw verblijf bij ons ? ' kregen we aan de receptie nooit te horen.
Het front office is efficiënt maar
ongeïnteresseerd.
Let wel, de Aziatische dame aan de receptie was de uitzondering, wat een warme persoonlijkheid!
De ligging, op slechts 5 minuten van Central Park is ook één van de vele troeven van dit hotel.
Een aantal goede gourmet zaken net om de hoek van het hotel, hebben alles in huis als men iets wil eten op de kamer.
Wij zouden zonder aarzeling zo weer reserveren in dit fijne etablissement.Warm aanbevolen.

title: best hotel in NYC
text: Just visited the Wallace for the second time in 6 months and while we were there, booked another visit in November!  Spacious, beautiful rooms, a gorgeous welcoming entry, the kindest most helpful staff, a quiet hotel for peaceful sleep, and a great price.  Can't wait to visit again soon!

title: Lovely hotel
text: Stayed at the Wallace for a mommy- daughter weekend get away. Location couldn’t be better and service rivaled or exceeded any other hotel I’ve stayed at. The staff made a point of welcoming my young daughter and making her feel special. Was the perfect place for our trip.

title: Disappointing
text: The hotel lobby was crowded when we arrived but there was only one agent on duty to process check ins. The room was fine, though the view was quite depressing. The staff were all consistently cheerful and accommodating. It is remarkable that NYC hotels have become so outrageously priced for such modest accommodations. The hotel entrance is quite underwhelming for a luxury boutique hotel. There is no sense at all of having arrived at a special place. All in all a disappointing stay that we will not be inclined to repeat in the future or recommend to friends.

title: Gorgeous and chic in the UWS
text:
We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. It has been some time since I’ve written a review, but I feel compelled after such a good 6-night stay here to write something.

First off, before even arriving, we had excellent communication from the hotel. All my questions were answered in detail and with a great response time.

As regular NYC visitors, this was our first time basing ourselves in the UWS. I’m so glad we did. There were great restaurants nearby, and of course the fabulous Beacon Theatre, where we caught a concert.

The hotel is so chic and sophisticated. But the ambiance is most definitely very warm and friendly. On arrival I was welcomed by Justin and Steven and it was a pure pleasure. I was accommodated with an early check in and we had also received a super upgrade which was just fantastic. The room was very elegantly appointed. I loved the fridge, secret ironing board storage and the drawer safe. Plenty of hangers and a lovely fresh bathroom with a good shower.

The hotel is new and gorgeous. Not quite like anything we’ve experienced in NYC before. Our accommodation was bright, spacious and felt very homely… 

The aroma in the lobby area was amazing. I loved entering there. That whole space will be even nicer once the hotel bar opens, as it will create more of an atmosphere.

Staff wise, I found everyone to be extremely friendly. Most I can’t name, but the door people, reception staff, housekeeping… all greeted us with warmth. We also bumped into the GM Mr. Freeman one day and he too was friendly and engaging. Very rare to even bump into a GM on the “floor” of a hotel these days.

Absolutely will be making The Wallace our go to for future NYC visits. 

Thank you Justin particularly for all your assistance and attention.

If I had to be constructive in my criticism, which I guess makes for a well-rounded review, I would have two pieces of feedback:

1. The elevators are slow and can take some time

2. There was no glassware in the room. My husband had bought a lovey bottle of wine for our anniversary and it was a shame to have to drink that out of plastic cups. However, I imagine this will be fixed once the bar is up and running and the hotel has glassware stocked.

title: Parfait !
text: Très bel hôtel dans le quartier plutôt tranquille Upper West Side proche Central Park. Chambre impeccable, spacieuse pour NY, super bien équipée,  très bon standing. Une halte très confortable après avoir parcouru tout New-York. Métro 72e rue à 5 minutes à pied.

title: Exceeded expectations!
text: Clean, new, friendly staff.  Had an excellent experience there.  Highly recommend.  The hotel opened in Oct 2021, so there is no bar/restaurant yet.  I was told it is opening in October 2022.  That will make this a perfect place to stay on the UWS.  Loved it.

title: Best luxury hotel in NY
text: Wonderful and friendly staff. Great and safe location in upper West side. New, well maintained and clean room. One of our most wonderful hotel experiences ever. Will definitely go back to The Wallace hotel.

title: Service is AMAZING!!!!!
text: This hotel is in a great location and is beautifully redone. The rooms are large for NYC standards and wonderfully appointed. Comfortable beds and quiet rooms. The lobby smells amazing! However, the most spectacular part of our experience was by far the service. The front desk staff was superb! They went above and beyond to make sure our stay was everything we were hoping for!

title: Absolute gem
text:
We had a fabulous time at The Wallace. Our bedroom was well appointed and very modern.  The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was great.  Our room was generally very quiet with only occasional noise from the corridor.  The air conditioning was very efficient and also extremely quiet so did not disturb our sleep at all.
The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  It was great having a kettle as well as a coffee machine and the generous fridge was very welcome.  The hotel is in a great location in the UWS.  It's only a very short walk to the subway which takes you into Times Square in a few minutes as well as other key locations.  There are also lots of shops and restaurants nearby.  We would love to go back.

title: Exquisite upscale beautiful hotel!
text: Exquisite upscale beautiful hotel located in the heart of Manhattan, easily walkable to all the desirable attractions. Staff were always friendly and informative.I thoroughly enjoyed my vacation here. Despite a constant crying baby next door, I can’t wait to return! A Boston native.

title: A Wonderful Place to Stay in NY
text: The Wallace is fantastic, a wonderful room and helpful, friendly staff. The location is excellent, on the Upper West Side in a nice neighborhood but in walking distance to Central Park, Riverside, and the subway. The only thing missing is a continental breakfast, Highly recommended.

title: Loved The Wallace
text: Great hotel on the Upper West Side…New and modern, very clean, lovely staff.  Three blocks to Beacon Theater, Subway, Fairway and lots of great restaurants. This is most definitely my new favorite NYC stay.

title: New York in July
text: Wonderful stay in an elegant hotel. Ideal location. Friendly staff (thank you Justin). Clean rooms. Good service. Close to shops, restaurants and Central Park. Short walk to Lincoln Center. Good value for money

title: Classy Hotel
text: I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff was extremely friendly from check-in to check-out. Betty especially goes above and beyond. Everything in the room was helpful and thoughtful, and no extra things that only cause confusion. It's a few minutes away from the 1/2/3 trains, and surrounded by cute places to eat at. Highly recommend! Looking forward to staying here again.

title: Beautiful, luxurious hotel! What a treat!!
text:
We had a king suite, and it was a nice retreat each day after sightseeing and before dinner and shows. The location is great, especially if you're seeing a show at the Beacon Theater - it's right around the corner! We were "home" before most people had even gotten on a subway train or into an uber. 

The staff was very friendly,  kind and accommodating. The shower with dual shower heads and then super thick luxurious towels was wonderful!

title: Wallace
text: We liked the hotel.  However, it was a bit noisy near our room late at night and there is no food and beverage service.   The room was comfortable.  On our initial stay we were upgraded to a lovely suite.

title: Excellent hotel!
text: The hotel is very beautiful and has an excellent staff. I would definitely stay here again. Our room was clean and updated.  There is a Nespresso coffee machine in the room and automatic shades. The room was quiet, except for loud guests next door that came in late, but I think you would experience that in any NYC hotel.

title: Loved this hotel!
text: Our stay at the Wallace was amazing. The staff were courteous, friendly and ensured any requests were met. Our room was clean, comfortable and accommodating. We lucked out with a free street parking spot with help of the doorman, which we were incredibly thankful for. We will definitely be back.

title: Home way from home is the best way to describe it. You’ll feel like you’re at a home vs a hotel.
text:
This hotel is amazing. My daughter and I stayed here for her 11th birthday while hanging in the city. From the moment we walked in to the moment we checked out we felt like welcomed guest.
