From heating up food in the microwave for me (which I learned they will put one in your room if you request it), to making sure we had everything we needed in our amazingly beautiful and modern suite. 

My favorite part aside from the service was the beds. So comfortable. The good nights sleep is worth it.

The location is great. Close to things while feeling like you are in a calm part of the city. 

My new go to hotel for my frequent visits to the city.

title: Best place in NYC
text:
Awesome place. New, clean, quiet. 
Best place in west upside.
There is starbucks across the street and a good market too and a bakery in front of the hotel.
A extension from home. All the staff are aces! 10! 
Next time when i go to nyc i’ll be stay again!

title: Amazing stay on the upper west side!
text: We had a marvelous stay at The Wallace! The staff was amazing and the property was immaculate. Perfectly located outside the hustle of midtown, but close enough to do everything you could want. We will definitely be back to The Wallace!

title: Better than I could even hope for!
text: Spacious, modern rooms, impeccably clean, friendliest staff, and great location! Would recommend this hotel again and again. From check-in to check-out, our entire stay at the Wallace was amazing!  Beautiful hotel!!!

title: Peaceful location
text: Hotel was in an ideal location away from the buzz of the city centre. Perfect to end the day after a long one sightseeing. The suite was spacious and kept spotless for us at the end of long exhausting days.

title: Best Place to Stay In NYC
text: The Wallace is an excellent hotel. I've been to NYC many times and have always stayed in mid-town or downtown. This trip we were visiting our son who attends Columbia and lives on the upper west side. So, we chose The Wallace for its location. This was a totally different experience--as it was like staying in a west side neighborhood. The room was super clean. Staff excellent. We will choose The Wallace again.

title: Great stay at The Wallace
text:
Perfect Upper West Side location. Stayed in 2 queen suite and had so much room for our family of 4.
Comfy beds. Quiet at night. Modern decor. 15-minute walk to central park. Nice staff. Good A/C and water pressure in shower. LOVED staying here.

title: A shiny new gem in the UWS!
text:
Our stay at The Wallace was wonderful. We had a queen suite which was very spacious and perfectly appointed with all the right amenities. Some of them were never mentioned on their website such as a robe, an umbrella, an electric water kettle, and a bottle opener/corkscrew. The lights in the room are electronically controlled and I was a big fan of the “Relax” setting which dims them down for the evening. The shades are also automatic and move with the touch of a button. The wet bar was a nice touch providing a place to sit with your morning coffee and a handy sink to use. The bed and furniture were all very comfortable. Don’t miss the drawers under the bed where the ironing board and extra blanket are hiding. The safe is also hidden in the nightstand drawer. The “residential style” of the hotel and the quite neighborhood made us feel like we were staying at a home rather than a hotel. It made coming back at the end of a busy day so much better. All of the staff at the hotel were very polite, easygoing, and friendly. 

Only one minor issue… if your room has a terrace be prepared for dealing with a rather cryptic door lock. It’s like opening a bank vault and requires an not-so-standard method of operating the lock. It also requires a firm, strong hand so my mom gave up on it and just climbed out the window. But that’s what many New Yorkers do to anyways, right? Not a big deal. The staff will help you out. 

The price of the rooms aren’t cheap but are less expensive (sometimes much less) than comparable hotels and even “nicer” hotels. The fact that The Wallace is so shiny new certainly helps. Many of the comparable hotels are really showing their age. As long as the price point of The Wallace doesn’t shoot up, I’ll definitely be returning!

title: Hidden Gem
text: I am reluctant to share our new favorite hotel.  It's a wonderful boutique hotel in a convenient neighborhood close to all.  The hotel is modern, clean, warm, and has a very friendly staff!  We had an amazing room with a huge patio.  Love this hotel.

title: Almost perfect
text: I highly recommend this hotel. It’s located in a quaint quiet street - the perfect location on the west side. The pillows were very hard to sleep on for my personal preference. To make my experience totally perfect, the next time I plan to take my own pillow with me.

title: Great upper west side hotel
text:
I’d stay here again in a heartbeat. The room had good size, and it was in a great location in the upper west side.

The only thing I wish would have been better was the fan in the bathroom — it didn’t work and it kept the room uncomfortably warm after showers. Small issue in the larger picture.

title: Our new favorite when visiting NYC!
text: We stayed recently during a short trip for a family reunion.  We loved EVERYTHING about The Wallace!  Location was perfect, so many restaurants within walking distance.  Super safe area and lots of street parking.  The room was spacious and impeccable!  The front desk staff was very friendly, accommodating and extremely professional!  The doorman was great too! They are top notch!  We cannot wait to go back...

title: New York trip
text: The Wallace is a beautiful boutique hotel on the upper west side.  The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms were state of the art.  The location is great.  One can walk to Central Park and many museums as well as a multitude of restaurants.

title: Great location
text: Close to transportation and restaurants. Looks good but lacks some things like a place to sit beside the bed if there are two of you and hooks in the bathroom to hang things on. Staff is lovely. But wouldn’t come back unless I booked a suite.

title: Will definitely return
text: This property is close to family and within walking distance of the subway and Central Park. Clean, modern, and a comfortable bed. Staff has always been nice and easy to work with. Happy to have found this gem in the Upper West side. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Great hotel in Upper West Side
text: If you are looking for one of the best rooms you will ever stay in, come to the Wallace (plus, its not a chain)! It's in a great location;  close to both Riverside and Central Park, the subway, and many great restaurants. We stayed in a Junior Queen Suite. Spacious, with a great view and many thoughtful amenities. We will stay here again.

title: My new favorite
text: I lived on the UWS for years and have never been able to find accommodations while visiting that felt suitable and comfortable. The Wallace has changed that and I cannot wait to make it my regular go-to place for visits to NYC.

title: excellent hotel
text: Quiet oasis on the UWS, friendly and professional staff, clean and spacious rooms.  Would definitely stay here again and have recommended hotel to others.  Easy walk to subway station to head downtown and walkable to Central Park and many restaurants.

title: Great Location
text: Our stay at the Wallace Hotel was really wonderful. The rooms were surprising spacious especially given it was in the city. It was very comfortable and clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly to us. I would love to stay here again.

title: West Side Luxury
text: I wanted a luxury experience but did not want to stay in a stuffy, mid-town hotel. I wanted to stay in the neighborhood where I used to reside. The Wallace was a great find. I had not heard of it before but visited their website and decided to take a chance. The price point let me know that I should be in for a wonderful stay and I was not wrong. Loved it. Have already recommended to friends. Fantastic hotel. Keep up the good work Wallace team.

title: Top Hotel
text: The best hotel in Manhattan and Upper West Side. Very organized, clean, safe and top service. The hole staff was very nice and very helpful. It has also a lot of nice/good restaurants near from the hotel.

title: Best hotel I’ve stayed in NYC. Classy, quite and spacious room.
text:
The best hotel I’ve stayed in NYC.
Great service and hospitality.
The suite was classy and very spacious we loved it.

The hotel manager was kind enough to offer us a late checkout because we had a late night flight - that was an excellent service! Well done.

We loved the location! Quite area near the park which we loved after all the noise in lower Manhattan

title: Hard product great, too much noise
text:
Brand new hotel with nice rooms full of the latest tech. The room is functional and everything is high quality. 

The big downside for me was the noise. There’s a construction next door with construction lift starting to go up and down as early as 8am. If you want to sleep past 8am this hotel is not for you. The walls are also very thin. You will hear your neighbor showering and talking just like they’re in your room.

In my opinion this hotel will be great in a few months/year when the construction is done and they’ve added more sound proofing but for now I would avoid!

title: Nice hotel close to Central Park
text:
This charming hotel is located on a quiet street, a short walk from Central Park. The room was a respectable size, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spacious, and the air conditioning worked well and was quiet. We also appreciated being able to deposit our luggage there before our check-in and after our check-out.

Of course, since we stayed at this hotel during Memorial Day weekend, the cost of the room was expensive.

title: Spacious and smart design
text:
I was very impressed with the Wallace hotel. The room was very spacious for any standard, especially NY. Perfectly appointed, modern and immaculate. Every detail in the room was well thought out and designed. I would recommend without hesitation. 
Excellent location within a few blocks from the river, Central Park, beacon theater, and lots of dining options.

title: Great place!
text: Friendly staff, nice rooms, centrally located, everything about The Wallace exceeded our expectations. We stayed in a block of rooms for our wedding and our families were more than pleased with their rooms and we were even able to sneak in a few gifts before they arrived

title: Wonderful surprise!
text: I can't not express more what a pleasant surprise! Everything at the Wallace met with our approval.  The staff were friendly, competent and when out of their way to make everything about our stay wonderful. Besides welcoming the facility was spotless with all update technology.  We will be returning.

title: Wonderful Staff
text: I only give a 5 if I believe I’m close to perfection. I loved our room I just wished there was a shelf in the bathroom for toiletries. I do give the staff a 5. The friendliness and kindness was exceptional!

title: Best place to stay in NYC
text: Newly renovated room was well appointed and very clean.  Friendly staff and great location.  Checking in was easy and there was a welcome note for me displayed on the TV screen as I entered the room. Classy.

title: The Wallace is a GEM!
text: The Wallace was the perfect find on the UWS. The staff was incredibly helpful, friendly and attended to our every need. The location can't be beat and the neighborhood there was lovely for whatever the occasion. The room was very clean and spacious. Overall, our stay was excellent in every way! We will definitely be staying there again and would recommend to anyone.

title: Excellent
text: This hotel is totally renovated. Rooms are modern and clean. Loved being away from the hustle and bustle. Loved the quiet area and walkable to Central Park and Columbus circle. Close to wonderful restaurants.

title: Beautiful!
text:
Exceeded our expectations! Highly recommend it! The staff is so nice and friendly. They go out of their way to help you!

The location is also great, nice neighborhood and very close to Central Park. 

It was an experience that I'd love to repeat!

title: Impressive UWS
text: The location was second to none. The hotel is newer and appointed well to include higher technology. Professional staff were very nice. The room is larger than it appears in pictures due to walk way to bathroom.

title: Great hotel
text: Very clean, spacious, updated hotel. Friendly & helpful staff. The bathroom vanity is small, so difficult with 2 or  more people. Disappointed that there was no bar or food service, but that is coming. Great location. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great find on the Upper West Side
text: The Wallace is on West 76 near Broadway so close to the subway it is easy to get anywhere in the city. The hotel just went through an extensive remodel and the rooms are gorgeous! The shades are electric and the street is quiet since it is in the middle of the block with West End on the other side. The decor is beautiful, modern and soothing and the beds are so comfy. The shower is beautiful and awesome too. The workout room has 2 Peleton bikes and though it is small it is a nice clean environment. The staff is friendly and helpful and soon they are opening a new restaurant. I can’t wait and I will be back - this is my new favorite NYC hotel!

title: Good value, super clean
text: This is a new hotel in Upper West Side. No amenities although they have the space for a bar. Not sure why not using it. Room was very basic but very clean and decently sized. Beds were super comfy!! So much so we took a picture of the mattress and sheets so we can buy for home!!

title: The Wallace
text:
Excellent location, great staff, clean, modern rooms. We had a deluxe King and it was quite roomy
by NY standards. Location was perfect. Close to many restaurants and shops. Easy to get transportation. Most important, quiet. .

title: Great rooms
text: 10 / 10. Beautiful clean and modern rooms, great location (only few blocks from central park) and very friendly and helpful staff. Would 100% stay again. I did not get a chance to try the room service.

title: Found my new home when visiting NYC
text: The Wallace is a fabulous spot to stay, I loved it's convenient location to many fun spots to grab a bite to eat. The neighborhood isn't touristy (more residential), giving a visitor more of an authentic experience of what living in the City is like. The room is perfection. Fresh, clean, and so many nice (automatic) touches. Staff was sincere and professional. Quiet, comfortable....we will definitely be back to stay again.

title: Great stay on Upper West Side
text: The hotel was everything we'd hoped for.  Great location, friendly and helpful staff, lovely clean room, all at a very reasonable price.  Oh, and the rooms were extremely quiet -- absolutely no street noise at all.

title: Best Hotel on Upper West Side
text:
Fantastic in every way. Amazing rooms that are high tech. Great location. Easy access to subway.  Friendly staff

We came for Columbia graduation. This is now the only hotel we’ll stay at when visiting Manhattan.

title: Exceptional addition to Upper West Side
text: Among the 50 or so NYC hotels I've stayed in over the decades, this newcomer easily ranks among the most satisfying I've experienced, from the genuinely friendly reception desk to the cool room decor (and very welcome tea kettle). Although I was looking for a spot within walking distance of Lincoln Center when I settled on The Wallace, I'd happily make this a base no matter what my plans were in the city. (I'm suspicious of any effusive review, so let me add one quibble: Hallway noise carried into the room to a sometimes startling degree. But I've encountered that in many a first-rate hotel. Besides, more important to me, room-to-room noise, even in the bathroom, was almost non-existent -- one more plus.)

title: Great location. Bright, airy room. Friendly staff.
text: We used to always stay at the Excelsior, but now that it is closed had to find a new landing pad. The Wallace feels like it is still being beta-tested, so if you need a luxurious ground floor with a bustling social scene, this is not your spot. It could have coffee set up, or complimentary wine at 5 sort of thing, but clearly filling its vast lobby during COVID is not a priority. Our room was really fantastic (large, lots of windows w  views! that opened and let in fresh air, clean), with the small exception that there was no full-length mirror or magnifying mirror--two essentials for a woman of a certain age to get out the door looking her best. The mirror over the sink in the bathroom was not well-lit for make-up application or checking colors, and it was too small. Also made it hard to convince my husband that his bright blue running shoes clashed with everything he was wearing. We will definitely return.

title: A wonderful hotel
text: The Wallace is a very pretty, well appointed hotel on the upper west side. It was the perfect location for our daughter's wedding as it was just blocks from the venue. All the wedding guests who stayed there greatly enjoyed the hotel and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating and friendly. I would be happy to stay there again.

title: A jewel of a hotel
text: This is a quaint , tasteful, exceptionally clean boutique hotel.  Away from the hustle and bustle, yet close to so much.  The staff are exceptional.  They make you feel at home.  This will be by new "go to" when in New York.

title: Welcoming staff
text: My wife and I stayed at The Wallace during the weekend of a family wedding. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was not huge, but certainly adequate, clean and quiet. There is no restaurant or bar, but staff provided two pages of recommended eateries all withing a short walk. Staff was accommodating when we had to leave early due to health issues.

title: Great Choice For Upper West Side
text: I love staying on the Upper West Side. It’s a great neighborhood and I have family there. I have stayed at many hotels there and The Wallace is by far the best. Very nice new rooms with nice feature like electric drapes. Staff is terrific…very sweet and accommodating.

title: Brand-new hotel with great rooms and great service
text: The Wallace is our new go-to hotel in NYC. Beautiful immaculate rooms with modern details; wonderful friendly service, 1/4 block off of Broadway (better than being right on it) with all of the Upper West Side right nearby and the 72nd St subway making the rest of the city easy to reach. Our Deluxe Queen room was generously sized and a nice place to relax when not busy, and even to have a friend over. Can’t wait for our next trip.

title: Exceptionally Clean, Comfortable, and Quiet
text: Lovely boutique hotel on a quiet street steps from shops and restaurants. the subway and Central Park are only a few blocks away from this residential area. The front desk staff was very friendly, helpful and kind. The entire hotel was clean and beautifully decorated. My Queen room felt luxurious- very comfortable bed, great rainfall shower, thick robe and slippers. I only heard one siren, otherwise very quiet. The room isn't huge but it didn't feel small and I had all the space I needed. Highly recommend and will definitely stay here again!

title: Mother's Day Weekend
text: I was visiting New York with my younger daughter to visit my older daughter and her husband, who live on the Upper West Side. We arrived on a cold, rainy afternoon, and were greeted by a friendly, professional young woman. When she determined our room wasn't ready she upgraded us to a beautiful modern suite. What a great way to begin a memorable Mother's Day Weekend! The hotel was quiet, extremely comfortable, perfectly located, and clean. I would not hesitate to return on my next visit!

title: Wonderful stay at the Wallace
text: Our family of 5 booked 2 suites for a long weekend and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were beautifully renovated and spotless. Comfortable beds and great service from the kind staff rounded out a great experience. The location is perfect for visiting museums and strolls through Central park. Lots of great food options nearby.

title: Abysmal Service! I’m Still Mortified!
text: Since the start of Covid-19, hotels have collectively decided to stray away from daily housekeeping services to eliminate the spread of coronavirus, and have thus made the service optional. Unlike the rest of the globe, The Wallace hotel could obviously care less about the safety or comfort of its guests who would like to avoid infection. I spent the day at a work conference, arrived back to The Wallace to find out I was locked out of my room. Why? Because management called me during the conference to schedule a housekeeping cleaning. Yep, You read correctly. I obviously could not answer, I was at work. Their solution was to lock me out of my room, which would force me to stop by the front desk before the day ended. Then!!! Management  escorted me to my room as if I were a criminal! I'm confused....is this a hotel in which I am paying for hospitality and comfort, or is this a college dorm? I practically live out of hotels as my job requires that I travel a ton throughout the year. I felt like I was back at college dealing with R.A's. It was awkward, embarrassing, and down right infuriating. I paid thousands of dollars to stay at their hotel and be humiliated. This is not good business practices Wallace. Their staff needs to revisit their hospitality manuals. This poor treatment will continue to cost you guests. Without us guests who literally pay to keep your lights on, you would be out of business. It would do you good to remember that fact if you would like to succeed in the business of hospitality.

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Nous avons séjourné pendant cinq nuits dans cet hôtel. Tout était parfait. La chambre était spacieuse, très propre, calme, literie très confortable.
Le quartier est situé près de Central Park. Le personnel est vraiment très agréable et disponible. Nous recommandons cet hôtel

title: A fantastic experience
text:
Definitely the most beautiful hotel I’ve ever stayed in! Comfortable and friendly environment.

The entire lobby is beautifully curated and embodies a modern, warm aesthetic.

The room was fantastic, made me feel like I was staying in a friends apartment with the layout and plush beds and couch. Very helpful and friendly staff, that made us feel very welcomed and respected. 

Another huge positive was how clean everything was, setting the standard for other establishments.

title: My Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
This hotel was recommended to me by some friends for my upcoming NYC trip. Normally I stay in AirBNBs but they spoke so highly of this place I had to try it — and thank goodness I did! 

The Wallace immediately felt like home and by my 2nd day I was calling it my apartment. Leaving was very hard, it’s been a few days and I am still missing the beds there. I have never missed a hotel’s bed or pillows but I do now. The smart lighting throughout the room was perfect for two people to easily compromise. We had plenty of space to lounge and get ready for the day! And the bathroom was perfect, I loved the light up mirror and the waterfall shower head. And the view was perfect! Normally I’m looking out at a brick wall. 10/10 will be staying here again. 

PS — the lobby is absolutely adorable! Bonus points if you can find the dog in the mural.

title: Wonderful and amazing hotel
text: Try the Wallace Hotel, I am 2000% sure you will return many times. Fantastic and amazing staff location!!!! The rooms are top notch and lot of amenities.  Location is perfect, waking distance for 79th Subway station and across the hotel is Le pain Quotidien

title: Excellent facilities and staff
text:
The hotel room, location, cleaningness, and staff manners and response exceeded my expectations. Outstanding facilities and staff . Thank you. I will stay in you hotel any time soon. Looking forward. 
A+ calification

title: ecxcellent stay
text: the room including the bed was superb.  the staff is extremely nice and responded promptly to all minor issues we had.  the location was excellent for us. we walked to all the museums we visited and used the metro to go downtown.  there are many locations to eat in the hotel vicinity.

title: Disappointed
text: The shower was fabulous, but it didn’t justify the high cost. Everything else was meh. The room itself looked like a modern motel for truck drivers. Housekeeping would visit the rooms regularly, and still didn’t manage to get it clean. The floors were filthy. I ran across the dreaded hairs on the sheets, and towels. The walls were paper thin. I heard people in the hallway, and walking above my head. The room tried to include a- lot of high tech additions, but they didn’t work. I had to get out of bed to turn the lights off, had issues with the tv, and couldn’t get the room service app to work. The room’s decor resembled a funeral home. It reeked of darkness and despair. I had a rather depressing stay at The Wallace in NYC. I just cannot recommend it. What a waste of money.

title: Lovely but still much to do
text: We found the hotel lovely. The staff was fine.The room was a great size but we could hear our neighbors next door. We really didn't care because of the size and comfort of the room. There still is no bar or restaurant. When we tried to rebook the price doubled! That was very disappointing considering the hotel isn't even finished.

title: Disappointing. Don’t waste your money.
text: I really wanted to like this hotel. But the staff care so little about those staying there and I don’t think they ever receive training in customer service. It’s really just a small apartment building it’s been revamped in some of the rooms aren’t even fully renovated. Perhaps in a year this place will be up to par but it is a disappointing experience with broken elevators and untrained staff and no room service food or real fitness center on premises. Stay at a real hotel until they get their act together.

title: Modern and clean with excellent customer service
text: We typically stay with family when visiting NYC. But for this visit we needed to stay at a hotel. The Wallace is in a great location to everything we needed and planned on visiting. Decent walking distance to the American Museum of Natural History and Central Park. Tons of great restaurants too. The big plus was the grocery store nearby (Fairway and Trader Joe’s). The wet bar in our room had a small fridge that allowed us to keep some grocery items cold to have for breakfast and snacks. The 72nd Street subway station was also nearby which was great when we took the subway to Queens to see my family. Quick and easy! Our twins loved staying at this hotel because we were able to cast Netflix and some other shows for them on the tv. We loved the technology in the room with the ability to control lights and the shades remotely from a bedside panel. The finishes in our room and bathroom were well done and luxurious. Especially the marble bathroom with the amazing shower which had excellent water pressure!! The entire staff during our stay were awesome and super friendly. They were even accommodating and able to help us when our return flight was cancelled overnight on our last night. Never good to wake up next morning to learn you have to stay another day unsure if you can stay at the hotel. Staff were able to keep us in our room for an extra night and accommodate us. Housekeeping was also excellent. Overall we will absolutely stay at The Wallace again and highly recommend staying here!

title: A Great Place to Stay on the Upper West Side
text: The Wallace was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at. The rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable with a nice selections of amenities. The hotel has recently been renovated and appears to have been thoroughly updated. We appreciated that a sprinkler system has been installed (many older buildings don't have them), and we liked the "tech" in the rooms with a shade that lowers at the push of a button and a "do not disturb" button that turns a light on outside the room. Also master switches for the lights. The staff was great - very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located is a nice part of the Upper West Side, near restaurants and transportation.

title: A great place and a great stay.
text: It was a great location. Lots of nice restaurants in the area. An amazing and super friendly staff. The rooms were beautiful and spacious. The workout room was just the right size. Everything was great.

title: Perfect location and exceptional service
text:
The Wallace is conveniently located on the UWS. It’s a residential area, so not overly touristy. We stayed there for a brief family trip and it was a breeze to get everywhere (Times Square, Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center, Columbia University). The rooms are lovely and quiet. We were on the 8th floor and barely heard traffic and other city noise that your expect.  Comfortable beds and great shower. Lots of amenities in the room. 

What really distinguishes The Wallace, though, is the customer service. There was a miscommunication regarding our renovation (my error) and we had booked a room with 1 bed instead of 2. I thought our booking site had fixed the error but they had not.  The hotel was almost fully booked. The Wallace gave us a larger room (a suite) but at the original price. They absolutely did not have to accommodate us but they chose to do so and we were so appreciative. 

The rest of the service (room service, bar) was equally top notch and friendly. Highly, highly recommend and will definitely stay there on our next trip to NYC.

title: Fantastic Upper West Side Boutique Hotel
text: Our recent stay at The Wallace was fabulous.  The hotel is in an extremely convenient location right off Broadway and 76th and just a couple blocks from Central Park.  The hotel itself is very new, spacious rooms, extremely attentive staff and full of modern touches not routinely found in NYC.  Flat screen TVs, in-wall tech to open/close shades, request privacy or service, dim or turn off lights, etc.  Just a wonderful experience and a must stay if you're in need of something in the Central Park area.  The Wallace is our go to when we visit NYC.

title: Place was Perfect
text: Can’t say enough about how nice this hotel was. Brought daughter to visit Columbia as possible grad school choice. Wanted something relatively close and in a nice area. Came across The Wallace…and glad I did. Place was spotless and technology implemented in rooms was as good as one could imagine. Electronic blinds, all types of light settings, huge shower with multiple heads, just all you could ask for. And room was surprisingly large, especially for NYC! Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel was extremely nice as well. All I know is if she chooses Columbia, this will be our first hotel choice when coming to visit!!

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Highly recommend-perfect Upper West Side location- close to everything. Room was huge, newly renovated with stylish fixtures and decor. Feels like having your own Manhattan apartment. Friendly staff, chic, understated lobby. Quiet. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Well located, quality hotel in quiet street
text: Recently renovated quality hotel. Everything worked well from check-in to check-out. Conveniently located just half a block from Broadway in Upper West Side, yet in a quiet street. Short walking distance to key subway lines, buses and attractions such as Central Park, Museum of Natural History to name a few. Very friendly and responsive staff.

title: Perfect upper west side accommodations!
text: Love everything! So clean and room was beautiful! Super friendly and efficient staff. Beds were so comfortable and the linens felt very high end and luxurious. Location is very quiet and has a residential feel.

title: Long Weekend
text: We stayed in a double queen suite. The room was lovely, modern, well appointed and clean. The staff was nice and pretty helpful. The downside is that for a hotel this pricey there was no restaurant, concierge or even a bar or coffee service in their lovely lobby.

title: Best Hotel on the Upper West Side
text: We travel frequently to NYC. The Wallace is hands down our favorite place to stay. It's new, quiet, immaculate and the staff (shoutout to Steven and Betty) are the nicest in NYC. It has a functional gym with a good variety of equipment. The bathrooms are a nice size and the beds are extremely comfortable. If you want to be on the Upper West Side, this is the perfect place to stay. You won't be disappointed!

title: Refreshing stay in NYC
text:
New hotel that is clearly only going to keep getting better. Room was really spacious for a NYC hotel room. Extremely clean!  The bed was very comfortable as well. Friendly and helpful front desk staff—Joseph made us feel right at home as soon as we checked in.

Super convenient location for the Upper West Side. The Beacon Theater is literally right around the corner making this the ideal spot to stay after a show which is what brought us into the city. 
Highly recommend The Wallace and hope to stay again soon. 👍

title: Family Trip to New York
text: I booked our stay at the Wallace after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. This is a wonderful boutique hotel in a great location. The rooms were newly renovated, modern and clean. The additional sitting area is a nice touch to be able to relax while our daughter was sleeping. The beds were super comfy and rooms were very quiet. We never felt like we were in the city. Wonderful restaurants and markets nearby and so much was within walking distance or just a subway away. We are definitely going to stay here again when we return this fall. Don’t hesitate about the Wallace…. Book it!!

title: Neighborhood Gem!
text: Stayed one night in this wonderful hotel. Nice quiet neighborhood on the Upper West Side with tons of restaurants and amenities very close by on Broadway. The hotel is new and the room was perfect. Clean, comfortable, and quiet. Loved the fact that there were wood floors rather than carpet. Service was excellent - check-in with a huge smile! Will defintiely return.

title: Really great hotel
text: Well appointed rooms with coffee, tea, refrigerators, great neighborhood (right around corner from Fairway Market, easy subway access, lots of restaurants).  Rooms are quiet.  Hotel just opened in Oct 2021, so everything is new.  Staff is very friendly and efficient.  Definitely the place to stay on Upper West Side.

title: Great neighborhood, even better hotel
text: Can't say enough about this hotel and its staff.  Every moment in the hotel was lovely and the staff were a big part of that experience. The hotel itself is in one of our favorite neighborhoods.  Quiet and convenient. The rooms are far and beyond any room I've had in NYC.  No negative feedback. Just a great time in one of the greatest cities this world has to offer.

title: Flawless
text: Throughout our  four nights stay we were uniformly impressed by the staff and the facility. Both the staff at the front desk, as well as the housekeeping staff  performed flawlessly.   Essentially a new hotel in a great location with an exceptional staff.  What more could you ask?

title: Fantastic Experience!
text: This is a fairly new boutique hotel with all the latest amenities as well as a great location in the Upper West Side. Beds were incredibly comfortable, the shower was amazing and room was spacious and well organized. The staff was outstanding - so friendly and helpful! If you're looking for place in this area at this price point, The Wallace would hard to top. We're definitely going back...

title: Lovely and cozy hotel on the UWS
text: A new hotel with cozy accommodations, friendly staff and in a great location.  Definitely recommend it.  Close to subway, markets all around for a quick bite.  Room was modern, bed was comfortable and housekeeping was excellent.

title: Comfortable and luxe
text: My husband and I came up to see friends and see a show at the Beacon Theatre.  We stayed for one night.  The bed is very comfortable, there is a great rain shower with cool toiletries, the lighting and Nespresso machine are modern touches.  Great stay!

title: A real gem
text: Great location, unbelievable staff, beautiful property, perfect location.  We will definitely make this our NYC hotel going forward.  The owners hit it out of the park with their recent renovation- great spot

title: Great addition to upper west side
text: This hotel is brand new.  The double was large by New York standards, with very comfortable beds, roomy bathrooms, and ample storage.  The lobby is very inviting and will be even better when the bar opens.  Staff is friendly.

title: Lovely hotel in a great location!
text: We enjoyed out stay at The Wallace.  It is a perfect location for us to visit with our son and his family.  It is near the active 72nd area but located just far enough to make it a quiet stay.  The stay is friendly and helpful.

title: Spring Break in NYC
text: The property was very clean.  Located on a side street and was very quiet.  Location was excellent with local shops and restaurants nearby.   Subway stop was only a couple blocks away as well.  The staff was friendly, and allowed early check in.

title: Simply a Wonderful Stay
text:
In planning my recent visit to NYC I decided I really wanted to select a unique place to stay and not just another stay at one of the many chain hotels around the city.  The Wallace ended up as one of three finalists and I am so pleased with my decision to pick it.

Location:
This was probably my biggest concern heading into the stay.  The UWS looked lovely but I wondered if it was going to feel too far removed from the rest of Manhattan that we came to see.   By the end of our 4 night stay I would say location was one of my favorite features.  Subway service into midtown was an express stop or 4 regular stops and rook just minutes.  Access to lower Manhattan was relatively quick as well.  The neighborhood was great for grabbing breakfast and coffee and calm in the evening for grabbing dinner.   Central Park was easily accessible via walking a couple of blocks. 

Lobby:
The lobby is impressive upon entry.  It's a very classy but modern design.  It's a shame the bar isn't open yet.  It will be a fantastic place to hang out.

Rooms:
The room was a hit with us.  Immaculately clean.  As they are pretty new everything was in pristine shape.  We had a single queen size bed and the room for plenty spacious for the two of us.  Every little detail is thought of for storage,  lighting, and all the automated controls.  Bathroom is good size with a very nice shower.  It had plenty of hot water.  Sleep quality was good too. It is o e of the quietest hotels I've been in, possibly due to the hallway layout.  We never felt like we heard everyone else coming and going which is nice.

Staff:
My interaction with the staff was relatively limited, but check in and check out were both done quickly and efficiently.  The front desk staff simply look very polished in their dark suits which lends an air of elegant sophistication to the property.  The cleaning staff took care of our room when requested and did a nice job of restocking everything in the room 

For most hotel stays, even if they are nice, they tend to be forgettable.  This is a location and property that I want to spend my time at during my next vacation in NYC.  Looking forward to returning.

title: The Wallace in winter
text: The Wallace was an excellent boutique hotel on the upper west side, very clean, very friendly staff, pet friendly, awesome showers, comfortable beds. The neighborhood is convenient to Central Park and the Hudson, but also quiet and very walkable.  Loved my stay here.

title: Birthday Weekend
text: Our best hotel experience in NYC.  Staff, especially Emar and Betty could not have been any friendlier.  Rooms are spacious and had everything you could want.  Our new home away from home while visiting NYC.

title: Incredible hotel on Upper West Side!
text: A new, beautiful hotel on Upper West Side of Manhattan. Experience was great; including having a wonderful staff, huge rooms with large new bathrooms and very comfortable beds. Don't  stay anywhere else!

title: Top notch, luxurious UWS hotel.
text:
We heard about the Wallace Hotel a few months back. Decided to give it a try. Extremely glad we did. Fast forward we have now stayed at his beautiful, luxurious property multiple times. The Wallace is perfectly located on UWS. The rooms are very spacious, high tech and impeccable designed. We have stayed at hotels all over the world and I believe it’s very safe to say that the Wallace experience ranks up there, easily comparable and even better in our opinion to some of the worlds finest properties. What makes a difference here is that in addition of being a five start hotel, the top notch staff led by the incredible General manager Mr. Victor Freeman is rare to come by, best in the business. They really do make  you feel like family here. You get that impression right away when you check in and are greeted by the super friendly, professional and attentive front desk staff. The Wallace has most definitely become our home away from home.
Many thanks Victor and staff for yet another great and memorable stay. Can’t wait to visit the amazing Wallace and staff very soon again.
Best. JJ.

title: Great New Hotel - Location & Rooms 5*
text: Great stay and lovely room upgrade. Really clean and high spec rooms. Much larger than average NYC rooms. Location was fantastic, only 1 stop on express train from local subway directly to Times Sq. Fantastic!!

title: Great stay
text: Highly recommended. Well appointed room with very modern features. Electric black out shades. Great well thought out lighting . A very friendly and welcoming staff. Very clean . Extremely comfortable bed.

title: Quick UWS weekend
text: The Wallace is amazing.  We stumbled upon The Wallace after complaining about upper west side hotels and thought we would take a chance.  The Wallace did not disappoint.  The staff was friendly and very helpful and the hotel is beautiful and quiet.  This will definitely become our go to spot for the UWS.

title: Fantastic
text: We loved our stay at The Wallace.  The staff were welcoming and knowledgeable, the rooms are spacious and well appointed, bed was incredibly comfortable and it was very quiet - even in the heart of the upper west side.  Location was ideal, terrific restaurants within walking distance.  Easy access to the subway as well.  We cannot wait to return.

title: High Tech Boutique
text: I loved the spacious room with all the high tech features you would want, but still set in a quaint setting. The shower and bathroom is SO NICE, especially for NYC! The hotel was also in a perfect location. Easy to access the subway on 72nd.

title: best hotel in NYC
text: This is the most beautiful hotel I've experienced in NYC, and by far the most spacious room.  Also the price per night is way below many other hotels I've stayed in the city where there were much smaller rooms and less accommodating staff.  When we experienced travel delays due to weather in our hometown, Steven, the manager, was quick to accommodate our changes and so kind and even greeted us when we arrived!  Every staff member we encountered was kind and friendly.  The hotel itself is very quiet and felt like an escape from the bustle of the city.  It was quick to get anywhere on the west side, as it is only 3 short blocks from the 1 train.  We frequently visit NYC, and love the Upper West Side, and I don't imagine we will ever stay anywhere else when we visit in the future.

title: Romantic getaway
text: Once we finished admiring the craftmanship, the deft use of space and the ease of use, we settled in to a perfect romantic getaway. Not being able to mirror our cells onto the TV was a disappointment, albeit minor. We're so glad we discovered the Wallace. We'll be back soon.

title: Great room & excellent location
text: Wonderful Hotel, luxurious room and best of all super quiet. Nespresso machine in the room was the perfect touch. Staff very attentive and helpful. Parking was super easy. Will definitely come back to stay !

title: Best choice for Upper West Side-Manhattan
text: Great location, excellent staff, spacious and well-designed rooms. The atmosphere is elegant and refined. Enjoyed relaxing in the lobby in front of the fireplace. Best option for the Upper West Side as everything is within walking distance:  museums, Lincoln Center, shopping, Central Park, Riverside Park.

title: Keeps Getting Better!!!!!
text:
I think this was stay No.4 ..... lt just keeps getting better! Stayed for 2 weeks this time and as always it was impeccable in all aspects.

I cannot express my delight that there is a hotel driven by service and hospitality culture in New York.... The Wallace 

I have had the great pleasure of watching the sensational lobby evolve.... the style, the colors, the decor and the people.... Every member of staff in this hotel from its incredible General Manager -- Vic and his front of house team led by the wonderful Steven make sure every guest is cared for.

I cant wait for this hotel to evolve and become even more sensational when they introduce their F&B concept. I rarely rave about housekeeping in a hotel but The Wallace prides itself on every detail and housekeeping are so caring and thoughtful - especially if you are a long stay guest.....

I have never been an 'Upper West Side' guest BUT there is no choice.... Columbus Circle is one stop on the subway a short walk from the hotel and the hustle and bustle of Manhattan is on your doorstep BUT the best part is getting back to the 'village' in the evening thats the upper west side and checking out great bars, restaurants and shops. 

Booked again fo March and April ...cant wait 

Enjoy it & Thank You Again - Team Wallace

title: The Wallace was amazing
text: it was a very last second choice and it was a long shot to book it last second, but it worked. Not only that, but the receptionist Joseph was so helpful and nice. He helped us set everything up and even gave us a room upgrade because he felt bad. We went from a 1 bed room to a 2 room, 2 bed suite with a view. It was incredible 10/10.

title: Neighborhood gem
text: The property had just been renovated and is very sleek and modern  Everything was very clean. The property itself is located off a Main Street and is quite  Comfortable bed. No restaurant or bar on site,  but they graciously provided nearest dining options that could be delivered to your room.

title: Great new hotel!
text: Loved our stay at The Wallace. Newly renovated rooms and common areas with modern/inviting decor, great staff, wonderful location, and a soon to be bar…make this hotel an easy choice when visiting NYC. An added perk is that it’s north of all the tourist mess but easy to get to if you have to - via 15 min walk, 10 min metro, or 10 min Uber. Neighborhood is also a plus, lots of options for eating whatever you want with actual New Yorkers, which is a plus if you are in NYC for more then the tourist attractions.

title: Great spot
text: great location on the UWS!  The hotel is new, with well appointed rooms.  I loved the refrigerator drawer and the comfy bad.  The lighting in the bathroom was great too!  I even got lucky & found on the street parking.  Great, friendly & attentive staff too.

title: What the UWS needs!
text: Lovely hotel.  Lovely staff.  Rooms work well.  Gym with Peloton bike was a plus (though I was the only one there....might feel crowded with others).  Can't think of any negatives, but really hope it doesn't get too popular, as I'll want to stay again in the future!

title: The Wallace Hotel
text: I have nothing but good things to say about The Wallace Hotel. The rooms are clean and quiet and the beds are extremely comfortable. All of the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and a pleasant. For the price, I don't think you can find a nicer place to stay. The location is great as it is away form the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Although they don't have a bar or restaurant onsite, there is plenty to choose from within acceptable walking distance. It's about a 4 block walk to the subway and a 3 block walk to the nearest bus stop. We will definitely be staying here again the next time we visit New York.

title: Amazing trip at an even more amazing hotel!
text: The staff was above and beyond the entire duration of our stay. They always had a smile on their face. The hotel was very clean and I loved the new modern look in the lobby area. Would definitely stay here again and again. The location is also central to many good restaurants and a close walk to central park.

title: Good location, excellent staff
text:
The Wallace is situated on  side road in what appears to be a nice and fairly quiet area. I don;t know how much busier it might be without Covid. Just a short walk from the subway and near to restaurants and shops.

My holiday didn't start well because Virgin Atlantic failed to transport my luggage. Before I even checked in I spent about half an hour debating with myself whether to turn around and fly back to UK. The receptionist was very calm, helpful and patient with me, which was much appreciated, as I was very stressed. Eventually I checked i but I didn't sleep because I was very worried at not having my luggage and because I could hear AC fans outside the room all night  (I am very sensitive to noise). The next morning they offered me another room, which I declined because that too have AC fans, so the manager then offered me a suite! It was very nicely appointed with no AC fans. It had 2 huge TVs and a kitchen with coffee maker, kettle and fridge. More teabags would have been nice as mine were still in my suitcase in Heathrow! But I only had to ask for more. I accept that during Covid the hotel probably wasn't full, so can't guarantee anyone else would receive this treatment, but still, they didn't have to do it. 

The staff were very considerate of my predicament and suggested places were I could by some essentials til my luggage arrived. And the doorman suggested a great diner near the subway for breakfast - Utopia - which I also recommend. Sadly there was no in house dining and no bar. Maybe soon ..... But they did offer a service for delivery of food from outside the hotel. 

I did have some problems with the electronic buttons for lights and blinds, but that was a v minor issue. 

All in all it was a very nice stay with really helpful and friendly staff. If you are looking for a hotel near the subway but slightly apart from the usual noise and bustle of Manhattan this might be the place for you.

title: Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms
text: We were delighted to stay for six nights at the Wallace in January 2022. My daughter and I enjoyed the perfect location as we love to walk in Central Park and it is close to subway with many key areas with walking distance. The room was lovely and very well designed for longer stays. Nespresso coffee capsules were abundant as were bottles of water and really, anything we needed. Staff was super friendly. We recommend the Wallace and will return again .

title: Stay at The Wallace Hotel!
text: The Wallace Hotel was an excellent choice for us. The entire hotel feels new and clean! We felt this was a great value at the room price and for the location. If you are stating in the Upper West Side, our favorite neighborhood in NYC, Then The Wallace should be your chosen hotel.

title: Unexpected Trip To The City
text: Had to quickly book 3 rooms as a large snow storm approached. Staff was wonderful and friendly, rooms were new, spotless and very comfortable. Location was very close to Lincoln Center where we were going to see an opera.

title: Nice hotel with modern conveniences. Good location and friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again.
text: Nice new hotel with modern conveniences. Clean and up-to-date technology. Would recommend it to friends and family. Would definitely stay here again. Only complaint is need 2 robes in each room rather than one.

title: Our new home in NYC!
text: The Wallace is brand new and lovely. We were upgraded to a suite upon check in, what an awesome surprise! Decor is modern and stylish and they thought of every detail. Price is very reasonable.  Staff super friendly and it’s so quiet at night. Location is amazing. Highly recommend!

title: Superior hotel
text: Very clean and neat hotel.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Perfect location and the room I stayed in was very quiet which is hard to find in NYC.  Huge lobby with a gas fireplace which felt cozy during the cold weather.

title: Highly recommend
text: Great boutique hotel. The rooms are very nice with great bathrooms. Everything was spotlessly clean. The lobby is well done. And the staff is friendly and helpful. The location is great for access to the Upper Westside of New York which doesn’t have many hotels.

title: Almost 5 star experience!
text:
We had a wonderful stay at The Wallace! The staff was genuinely welcoming. After having landed early from a red eye flight, we were anticipating anything more than a bag drop off, but our room was ready! Spacious rooms (we loved the automation!), modern decor, clean, and awesome location to many, many restaurants (on Amsterdam and Columbus Ave,) and two subway stations. Central Park, Lincoln Park, and the river, were a short distance away too.

5 stars for the staff, rooms, and location. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and have already done so to friends and family.

So why just 4 stars? I really wish there was a better way to note the minor, yet important issues that took away a star. 

We ordered room service one day and although it was a couple of days prior to the NYC marathon, and we were okay with a delay of an hour in food being delivered, the food was soggy and stone cold! Very disappointing. The hotel's onsite restaurant wasn't open yet, so they had contracted with another food service. We were assured the experience would be no different than if the restaurant was onsite, but it clearly wasn't. Perhaps if they weren't as busy, but while a delay is understandable, the condition of the food was not.

The lobby was nice, but lacking amenities and 'personality'/warmth. We were told this was coming, so perhaps this will change soon, although the website doesn't reflect this yet.

There were also a couple of issues with housekeeping. Slow -  we had to remind them a couple of times about the cooling (the heat kept turning on). The issue still wasn't resolved when we left. A couple of times, the toiletries weren't refilled and we had to ask. Hopefully, these are just growing pains and will be resolved quickly. 

Finally, a shoutout to the staff, who were very sweet to get a box of goodies and a hand-written note from the manager Steven with good wishes on our special occasion. Thank you to The Wallace staff for a very good stay!

title: Fantastic Stay at a Fantastic Hotel
text: The Wallace was one of the best hotels I have ever visited. I had the pleasure of staying a week at this wonderful hotel while on vacation with the family. It is in a fantastic location near many great restaurants, shops, sight seeing spots, and is of course a short walk to a nearby subway station that can take you anywhere in New York. The hotel itself had attentive and warm staff that went above and beyond to make my vacation relaxing and enjoyable. When I first arrived at The Wallace I immediately couldn’t help but notice that it has real New York character to it. The hotel is in a beautiful brick building with an eye pleasing modern interior design. The room we stayed in was also well decorated and VERY clean. All the furniture seemed to be carefully thought out as it was both stylish and comfortable, especially the bed. I usually have a tough time falling asleep at other hotels but at The Wallace it felt like home away from home. They had a large flatscreen tv in the room with a plethora of tv channels which I also thought was a nice touch. There is a spacious desk with great Wi-Fi which allowed me to get some work done on the road. But what I enjoyed the most about my room was the dual shower heads in the bathroom. It made me take way to long of showers because they were so relaxing! Overall I recommend everyone traveling to New York stay here. If you’re looking for luxury at reasonable prices then this is the hotel for you! I promise you that I will definitely be staying at The Wallace again the next time I visit New York.

title: Great Option!!
text: Quiet and great location! Dog friendly as a plus!  Rooms are a great size and are super modern! Staff were friendly and helpful. Lots of free parking and paid parking nearby! I will definitely be back.

title: Great boutique hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Midtown and Times Square
text: Beautifully appointed guest rooms with all the latest amenities for a wonderful stay, very comfortable bed and awesome shower - walking distant to Central Park and a multitude of great restaurants and cafes on the UWS. Staff were very friendly and happy to provide great hospitality.

title: Outstanding service
text: The Wallace is a new and beautifully renovated hotel in an excellent location. The staff are very kind and courteous. Although food is not available, there is a Butler delivery service available which has a good menu and is very convenient. Highly recommend this outstanding hotel.

title: Gorgeous hidden gem!
text: The newly refurbished and reinvented The Wallace was fabulous! My partner and I loved the endless, sleek little surprises in our room: the fridge, the multiple lighting options, the heavenly rain shower, the toiletries' fragrance, the mattress, the TV quality.... the list goes on & on! The room had so many finer finishes that wouldn't even be in hotels costing much more in Manhattan! We also loved the swift elevator, friendly and attentive staff that helped us feel safe & secure, and location! We'll be back!

title: Gorgeous
text: Absolutely gorgeous, immaculate hotel. Finish out is so solid, so comfortable, so beautiful. Staff was courteous, welcoming, helpful. Security was always present, quietly attentive. Was given a free upgrade which delighted us! Location in UWS is fantastic. Close to market (Fairview), shopping (I walked to lululemon, North Face, bloomies outlet, etc), gyms (I walked to SoulCycle for spin, bode nyc for hot yoga), Central Park, subway, bakeries (Levain, etc), bagels, pizza, all the NY things! My sister lives nearby and this is our new favorite place to recommend to visitors.

title: Exceptional experience
text: We were upgraded to a King Suite, which was commodious and had a beautiful bathroom, including an exceptional shower.  The room was nicely furnished abd the staff was great. We were accompanied by our dog, and the hotel is exrtremely pet friendly,

title: The perfect hotel on the Upper West Side
text: The Wallace is in a great location with lots of good restaurants, Central Park, and many Museums within walking distance. It is in a busy neighborhood, but it is not full of people like Times Square, although it is a short subway ride away if you want to visit. It is easy to see how much thought and care went into the hotel's recent renovations, from the light switches in the rooms to the easy-to-control rain shower. We stayed for a week and had a suite; a large bedroom, and a separate sitting room. The suite was probably larger than some nearby apartments. Everything in the suite was tasteful, comfortable, and understated. The staff at the Wallace were excellent, warm, and welcoming, and the housekeeping team kept our suite spotless, and the hotel felt very Covid safe. I would love to return to the Wallace; it is the perfect Upper West Side hotel.

title: Contemporary gem of a hotel with a great location
text:
I recently stayed at the Wallace while visiting NYC on a business trip with a little pleasure mixed in.  I found its location to be extremely convenient, only two blocks from the subway station on a direct line to midtown and Times Square.  The hotel is close to several well-known and superb restaurants, as well.

The hotel is essentially new.  I understand that the owner purchased an older hotel and gutted it completely, creating what I would call a contemporary masterpiece.  The modern feel doesn't stop at the design: fans in the bathroom switch on with motion sensors; pocket doors close silently and magically; the window shades and all lights in the room close with a master on/off switch; and the Internet was the fastest I have ever experienced in a hotel.  I would use the word meticulous when describing the level of detail the owner used when renovating the property.  

The staff couldn't have been nicer.  Of special note is Steven Fennell, the front desk manager, and his team, who were unfailingly courteous and helpful for our entire stay.  

If you're headed to the upper west side in Manhattan, it will be well worth your while to consider staying here.

title: Very nice boutique hotel on uws
text:
Renovated boutique hotel
Nice rooms
Pleasant staff
Clean 
Casting  from smart device to big tv is great idea 
We plan to return 
Upper floors have better views
Lobby pleasant
