title: Great location
text:
It’s DEF one of the better hotels on the UWS, as you won’t be able to find as much, location is great, service is fantastic however not a 5 star in my opinion 

I stayed on the 3rd floor, spacious standard room, great bathroom however my view was a courtyard and 3 large AC systems, therefore extremely dark, those systems were a nightmare during the evening, they were on all night making the most insane noise, luckily I had earplugs but it was a huge problem 

Rooms look better in pictures, for some reason I was expecting these amazing hardwood floors, instead a cheap alternative, furniture scratches it and by next year it would look old and very damaged. The wear and tear will be very visible soon which is unfortunate as many things do work 

Bathrooms are great, however products are cheap and I went to Aesop to buy soap, you’d expect more from a “5 star” hotel. 

Tech wise it’s fantastic and has all the bells and whistles, from the plugs to the easiness of managing the lights and such and again, Service is great 

No F&B facilities at all, an alternative of something called butler to deliver, I used it for breakfast and taste and all is mediocre, again not what you expect from a 5 star hotel. 

Overal, it was fine however nothing wow

title: Family trip to NYC
text: Outstanding. I don’t think we’ll ever Stay anywhere else. The suite was perfect For our family of four. Fast elevator service. Extremely friendly staff. Clean rooms with all the bells and whistles Nestled into the cutest neighborhood with quick access to the subway. Fantastic!

title: Well done Wallace! Great experience.
text: We came as a couple for a Christmas weekend in NYC. The Wallace was a great choice that we will return to again. Check in and out was effortless. Rooms are brand new and immaculate. Our standard king room felt spacious. The lobby bar isn’t open yet but you can see it’s a lovely well designed space. The neighborhood it is in was safe and residential. An easy, less than 5 minute walk to the 72nd street subway station that we used plenty in touring the City. We loved the French cafe across the street for daily breakfast. We also frequented the many restaurants in the area. Only upgrades we would suggest they add to make it even better: a shelf in the bathroom for toiletries, a couple more bath towels, and a mini microwave in the bar area. We will be back!

title: NYC Vacay
text: This hotel is absolutely beautiful and the pictures on the website is exactly how the room looked. We stayed in the Double Queen Suite and it is spacious and roomy. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. If we needed anything for the room, the staff bought it up within 10-15 minutes. It was an absolute pleasure to stay here!

title: Beautiful hotel
text: This is a gorgeous boutique hotel on the upper west side. Very quiet street and close to subway stop. It has been recently renovated Fall 2021. Many shops and restaurants close by. Would highly recommend.

title: Stay here!
text:
The recently-reopened property (under a new name) was beyond expectation. The location is terrific and staff helpful and friendly. My room was very well-appointed with small and thoughtful touches, which added to the enjoyment of my stay. 
Highly recommend!

title: Fabulous new hotel on the Upper West Side
text:
Our family booked a number of rooms for a nearby family event and could not have been more pleased with the hotel accommodations and staff.  We all had a wonderful stay, and the staff was helpful and friendly.
Looking forward to our next trip to NY and staying at the Wallace.

title: A great location and a friendly staff
text:
The quality of our suite was excellent and always immaculately cleaned. It will be nice when the bar facilities are open in the future as the ground floor is a lovely area to sit but use of the dining facilities at The Lucerne was very good.
The staff were always welcoming and very helpful.

title: Fantastic hotel on the Upper West Side!
text: The Wallace hotel team is EXCEPTIONAL. After just a few hours I felt like I was staying at my 'home' on the Upper West Side. I love the history of the building, the hotel design/concept, location and like I mentioned the impeccable staff. I will 100% recommend this hotel to my friends and family and future clients. I am a tour operator so I look at every hospitality experience with a different lens and The Wallace passed the test with flying colors! Cannot wait to come back and stay again. Bravi!

title: Exquisite hotel in Prime location
text: Beautiful newly renovated hotel located just a couple mins from major subway stn. Quick walk to Central Park and excellent local restaurants near by. Fabulous (large) room and perfect fireside lounge for work/business mtgs. Warm and welcoming staff. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Exceptional property
text:
This is a beautiful new property.
The design of the rooms is beautiful with high-end finishes and extraordinary attention to detail. The rooms are spacious.
The staff is extraordinarily willing to help and they are kind.

title: New favorite hotel
text: I found the Wallace while searching for a new hotel online and I am so glad I came across it. The staff was so friendly and the rooms were spacious and extremely clean. It’s in a great area and a close walk to the subway, shops and restaurants. I can’t wait to stay there again.

title: Incredible rooms in an incredible hotel!
text: I have stayed in many hotels around the world and The Wallace is right there with the best of the best. It is an incredibly beautifully and thoughtfully designed hotel with wonderfully spacious and comfortable rooms. The staff is incredible and I want to live in that lobby – it’s so incredibly beautiful. Will definitely be a repeat customer of the Wallace!

title: Ideal Stay
text:
We had two suites for 5 nights allowing my family to have a long a relaxing stay at The Wallace. It was a great experience for all of us! 

The suites are roomy and comfortable with a modern residential style. The location can't be beat with great access to transportation and everything (!!!) the Upper West Side has to offer. The kitchenette in the suites was great for having some snacks and drinks available in the room that were easy to pick up for the great markets in the neighborhood (fairway, zabars). Although not really an issue with all the amazing restaurants steps away (hummus grill turned us into vegans)!!!

The only issues we experienced were very minor. We had some issues with the HVAC system in one suite and the "butler" room service delivery did not work well for us, and there were some incomplete items in the room and hotel (but to be fair, brand new is awesome!)

title: Great hotel, room, and location
text: We stayed at the Wallace just after Thanksgiving and could not have been happier. The location was great and the room was spacious (by NYC standards) and very well appointed and laid out. Check in and service were top notch. It was a great value (again, by NYC standards) and we will certainly stay there again!

title: excellent property
text: hotel is brand new and spotless.  service was amazing, shower and room we’re spacious and so comfortable.  great location in the upper west side.  staff was so friendly and accommodating.  10/10 would recommend.

title: Unbelievable.
text: From the rooms, to the staff, to the location, everything was perfect. There is so much to do around the area but the room is enough in itself to hang out it. We will definitely be back ASAP, it was out of this world.

title: Terrific new hotel on the Upper West Side
text:
We loved our recent stay at the Wallace. Our room had great beds and bedding, lots of storage for clothes and good lighting in the bedroom and bathroom. 
The location is great and the staff are welcoming and helpful. 
There is no gym and no place to purchase food in the hotel as of yet but the hotel is brand new and I think those amenities will be coming in the future.
We are looking forward to our future stays at the Wallace!

title: Great stay!
text:
I stayed with my family at the Wallace and we loved it. 
I was looking for a nice hotel in the Upper West Side, and this place really delivered. I have traveled to New York many times for personal travel and for business, and this is one of the most welcoming and comfortable places I have found.
Our kids loved the spacious (in NY? yes!!) room and the high tech room accessories. My husband and I appreciated the genuine and friendly staff, and the great location. I can’t wait to stay here again and will be recommending it to anyone looking for a great place to stay in NYC.

title: Amazing Stay!!
text: The Staff was super friendly.  Room were extremely clean.  Bed was very comfortable and the windows had powered shades.  Smart lighting in the rooms.  Every time I arrived or left the hotel during my stay I was greeted by the staff at the front door and by the front desk.  We will definitely will be back!!!

title: Weekend Stay
text: Had a lovely stay at the Wallace. Excited to have a hotel of this caliber closely located to friends and family. Spacious rooms that were well outfitted and a professional and friendly staff made for a great stay. Especially appreciated the tv and tech features in the room

title: Fabulous new spot on the UWS
text:
Enjoyed a recent stay here. It is a 5 minute walk to the Beacon Theater and near two subway stations. Rooms was very comfortable. Best sleep I have had in a hotel in a while. Great bathroom with shower versus shower/tub combo which I loathe. 

It is a 5 star place but I just don’t give 5 stars as a rule unless there is something that is completely out of this world. So don’t let the 4 star rating fool you.

title: Excellent Value
text: Booked this hotel based on recent reviews and was not disappointed. Clean modern room with friendly staff within walking distance of subway as well as bars and restaurants. Would easily book here again.

title: Great stay
text: Terrific value, staff and location. Would definitely book again.  Room was clean with new furniture and fixtures.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Located close to restaurants, shopping and the Beacon Theatre.  Much better option than other older hotels in the area.

title: Wonderful new hotel!
text: Our first time in The Wallace. Really appreciated the upgrade. The junior king suite was lovely , clean and spacious, and bathroom with a large tub was a real plus. Staff was friendly and helpful.  Only downside was lack of valet parking, but there are some garages nearby. We will definitely consider staying at The Wallace again!.

title: Beautiful hotel and wonderful experience!
text: The location on the Upper Westside was perfect. All staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The lobby was beautiful and very welcoming. The room was large, clean and new. We were upgraded to a king suite when we checked in and had more room than we needed.

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC
text:
An absolutely fantastic little hotel - it is now my favorite property in NYC (for reference: I stayed at two famous 5-star properties on/near Central Park on recent stays and far prefer the Wallace).  Gorgeous rooms and great service.  The hotel has real character.

The service was top-notch - everyone from the front desk manager (Justin Cordaro, who deserves particular praise) to the housekeeping to the doorman - all were friendly, professional, yet down-to-earth.  Service in NYC can be pretty hit-or-miss, even at very upscale hotels, so it was almost surprising to be treated so well.  The team here clearly takes pride in this hotel and what they do.

I discovered the Wallace while looking for a hotel that was walking distance to Lincoln Center (treating my father to a weekend in NYC and a trip to the Met).  The property has just emerged from a top-to-bottom renovation and is now the right mix of modern and "homey" - sleek without being austere.  Rooms were very spacious (especially by NYC standards), spotlessly clean, and the beds incredibly comfortable.  Only quibble was that I had a bit of trouble figuring out the electric blinds at first, but that's definitely a first-world problem.

Hotel is still in soft-launch so no restaurant yet on-site.  So, don't stay here if you're the type to be grumpy without several in-house restaurants or amenities like a lap pool, etc.  Instead, stay here if you're looking for an elegant, smaller hotel with character in a "real" NYC neighborhood yet quiet and off the main drag, and walking distance to Lincoln Center and Central Park.

title: Hidden Gem
text: This is a gem of a hotel. Brand new, super clean, modern, spacious room for Upper West Side. Excellent location and quiet. Staff could teach a master class on hospitality - always gracious, always friendly and kind and always willing to take an extra step. I had foot surgery a couple months ago so needed to spend more time in room with foot on pillows. It was always quiet and peaceful. Thank you for a wonderful stay. We will definitely come back!

title: Loved this hotel
text: Clean, simple, stylish. I was immediately put at ease with the simplicity and cleanliness of the hotel and my room. The lighting and modern ammenities contrasted with the old-world charm of the upper-west side really works well. I love the room furnishings. There are two nearby bakery and cafes that make breakfasts a breeze. The staff is friendly and helpful. The bathroom is very open and the showers were powerful and spacious.

title: Great location, great room, super helpful staff
text: The Wallace just opened in Sept 2021. They are still putting on the finishing touches, but their communication is great, the rooms are spacious, the staff is helpful and friendly (shout out to Joseph at the front desk!), and the location on the Upper West Side cannot be beat.

title: New, clean and welcoming
text: Hotel is newly refurbished so spotlessly clean with accommodating staff.  The front desk made my daughter feel special as she celebrated her birthday.  The rooms have great technology.  The hotel is close to a wide choice of restaurants and walking to Central Park.

title: NYC Upper West Side.
text: A well appointed hotel with a friendly Staff at a reasonable price. Rooms are clean and spacious. A short walk to restaurants and retail. Great neighborhood. An easy a quick ride to the Lincoln Center or the heart of the City.

title: Great UWS New Addition
text: Simply high class staff and property. I had a Deluxe King room and it was one of the largest NYC rooms I've had. I do travel to the city frequently. When this place catches on, it's going to be hard to book. Check it out early!

title: Charged with no refund!
text: I booked the Wallace hotel through booking.com from the 10th of November for 2 nights. The booking was free cancellation and no prepayment needed. Yet the Wallace charged me 558 USD since the 21st of October with no refund! I have cancelled my reservation for FREE and requested the refund of the early deposit (which was not part of the NO PREPAYMENT NEEDED deal) for 3 times however no answer and no collaboration from the Wallace! This is so bad that I will never ever consider staying in such a hotel if there services are so bad even before staying there!!!

title: The Wallace is a great choice!
text: We took a chance booking a hotel that had just opened four weeks ago, and we were delighted with our choice.  We were greeted warmly by the staff,   check-in was easy, the room was beautiful, light and bright, immaculate, super comfortable bed, excellent lighting in the bathroom, elegantly decorated.  We look forward to many more stays at The Wallace!

title: perfect stay for NYC Marathon
text: I was in New-York for the marathon with my girlfriend and we were walking distance from Central Park, the subway , very nice restaurants. Beautiful neighborhood. Loved my stay! The staff is really nice and helpful!

title: Hidden Gem on the Upper West Side
text: We were there to celebrate our son's engagement.  The staff was so welcoming and accommodating during our stay.  The rooms are much bigger than most NYC hotels and everything was very clean.  Looking forward to when the lobby bar is open for business...We will definitely be back!

title: Amazing
text: Highly recommend!! This place is stunning. Rooms are gorgeous and spacious. Extremely clean and a very accommodating staff. Have already told so many of my friends and family about this hotel and will definitely be the only place i’ll be staying when i need somewhere to stay in nyc from now on!

title: New York 'Gem'
text:
The Wallace is a real Upper West Side find in NYC ( actually in New York! ).... It's newly opened and in its infancy but it's really sensational. I cannot comment highly enough about the staff from its wonderful General Manager - Victor to the entire team operationally. They are focused to service service service....

From check-in and the sheer level of friendliness and engagement I knew this hotel is going to create a real destination for those seeking a good hotel up in the West neighborhood of Manhattan .... intimate, clubby and driven by old school service. The refurbishment has been really well thought out and the rooms spacious and so well appointed. I have struggled to find a hotel in NYC that has real thought and insight put into it let alone value for money and that 'clubby' feel.

I loved my room and the fact your needs s a guest have been considered.

The team are developing the F&B concept in the hotel and if they get that right with a cool bar and dining / food option The Wallace could become a real scene and place on the Upper West Side.

I have never really found a hotel I like in NYC and one that I can make my regular haunt but I think The Wallace is going to be an amazing addition to the hotel scene and future place to be!

title: Newly Renovated in Great Location
text:
CONS
The hotel was newly renovated but overthought with all the unnecessary "smart" light switches that were supposed to alleviate getting up so much but caused too much of a hassle in the long run.  The elevator bell was too loud and could be heard on the regardless of what time it was. The lobby lacked décor and was a bit bare and could have been so much more inviting. 

PROS
Staff was warm and inviting every time we walked in the door, and you cannot renovate that. And the location alone made me daydream out loud about living in New York. Out of all my trips to New York for visits, events, work, and conferences it was the best location and at the end of each evening/night I was returning home and not to a hotel.

title: Best Hotel Ever
text: The hotel staff was excellent, helpful and so accommodating and the rooms were beautiful and clean. I would recommend this hotel every time I go to New York City.  The hotel staff even made arrangements for transportation to the airport.

title: New Upper West Side Gem
text: The Wallace is a welcome addition to the few and far between hotels on the Upper West Side. The attention to design detail is truly beautiful in the rooms and common areas, nothing is “worn out” of course because it is brand new, which is a treat. The finishes and fixtures are top of the line, rooms are enormous and spotless. Super friendly and welcoming staff, feels a little quiet now “soft opening” but with the addition of the lounge/bar area it will likely take on a perfect private clubby feel. A hidden gem!

title: Fabulous new hotel on the upper west side in NYC - The Wallace
text: A fabulous new small hotel has opened on West 76th Street. It’s accommodations are beautiful, very high end, and quite classic. This a boutique hotel that oozes luxury at every turn. The staff is very nice and caring. If you know this neighborhood, you’ll appreciate having a top end luxury hotel here once again.

title: Best Of NY
text: I loved The Wallace, I had to come to NYC for a procedure and had to stay near Lenox Hill for 5 days. From  the time I arrived to The Wallace I was treated well. The room was very spacious and felt like home. The check in was very easy, and lots of information about the area was giving to me. Although a restaurant is not on site there are plenty of places to eat that’s near the property, also Uber eats is very friendly with lots of choices in the area. The room was very quite and equipped with exactly what was needed. I stayed in the 1 bedroom King Suite. I highly recommend The Wallace Hotel  and will be returning when I come back to NYC.

title: The Best!
text: The hotel is gorgeous. The staff were all wonderful, courteous, helpful, and friendly. The bed was fantastic, the room was elegant and clean. We brought our two large dogs and everyone was very welcoming to them.The location is PERFECT whether you’re traveling with dogs, or not. It’s very close to riverside park and Central Park. I would definitely stay there again. In fact, I hope to return.

title: Beautiful Hotel in Upper Westside!
text: Great location, brand new hotel. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Staff were courteous, accommodating and professional! Lots of shopping, restaurants within walking distance and subway just a few blocks away. Riverside and Central Park walking distance!

title: Classic, Brand New and Clean
text:
The rooms are brand new, HUGE and sparkling clean. The decor is classic and comfortable. THE BEST New York hotel i’ve ever stayed in. Because the hotel is 2 weeks old, there’s no restaurant or bar, but there are restaurants everywhere to order from and the Beacon Liquor store is across the street and they have THE BEST wine on the planet. :-)

If you want a hotel thats new, clean and SUPER nice, The Wallace is your place!!! The staff makes you feel at home! 

Its also in a very convenient location. Had to be in Brooklyn at 9am…took the 2/3 train a few blocks away at 8am and was there in 20!!

title: Great location, clean & friendly staff
text: Chose this hotel because of the proximity to the Beacon Theater.  It was their 3rd day open.  Staff was very friendly & accommodating.  Rooms were new, clean, & had great lighting.  Bed was extremely comfortable.  Great amenities such as slippers & nespresso machine & refrigerator.

title: Wonderful stay
